column1: What People Are Saying:

column2: >
column6: >I've been eating these amazing products since I was 15. Never has there been any fish of any species that has not only impressed me, but left me wanting more. I will never again have the privilege of knowing someone that has caught and prepared fish like Smokey. His processes and quality standards have always been far more than any business I've seen. This man has the expertise, experience, education and passion to truly create products like no one else! Trust me, once you've had the luxury to taste his amazing talents, nothing else will ever come close!

column4: >As a certified nutritionist, I know that food directly affects our health – positively or negatively. The fact poor health is now affecting our children, specifically in the form of obesity, is unacceptable. In the U.S., more than 1/3rd of children under the age of 13 are clinically obese. The alarming news is that this problem – epidemic, actually – is getting worse not better. Recently, medical scientists had to add the term “severely obese” to diagnose the ever-growing waistlines of our children, alone. Why is this happening? Aside from social or physiological reasons, it is poor choices in food, and simply not eating “whole food” any longer. We are a nation of processed, packaged food that is void of nutrients and energy for life. We are literally giving our children processed, fast food, as soon as they are weaned. I have clients who tell me their children do not like vegetables and “health foods.” The overwhelming conclusion, I discover, is that parents never gave them any to start with, nor are they eating healthy food themselves. Children copy what they see. Unfortunately, no matter what healthy lifestyle that child may adopt as he or she grows, they will always be fighting the fat cells that they developed prematurely, and most of all, the consequences of limited nutrition as a child. They need healthy food to be given and available to them.

column1: The good news is, we have total control over this obesity and poor health epidemic. We can make healthier food choices, no matter what our age. Providing healthy food for our children is paramount, though, so they will continue to make better choices and enjoy good health in their future. We all know that fish is one of those foods that contain nutrients and minerals needed by us all
column2: but maybe some have had poor quality in the past and therefore think all fish tastes the same. Smokey’s Sashimi Grade, Regular or Smoked Albacore Tuna and Salmon have all the health benefits I want for my clients, and with natural smoky flavor that “non-fish eaters,” and even my youngest clients love.

column1: The difference in Smokey’s fish is the entire process. It is wild caught with a single hook on a troll line (never farm raised), and processed utilizing the strict traditional Japanese sashimi method(s) for optimum freshness and quality. It is then naturally cured and smoked using no nitrates or nitrites. It is processed and canned entirely by hand, in pure spring water or pure coconut water, preserving all of its natural flavor and nutritional value.

The health benefits of fresh Tuna and Salmon are tremendous. Everyone knows they contain heart healthy Omegas, but most do not know that these Omegas are proving to support brain health and cognitive function, not to mention energy. This is a great snack for our school age children and adults alike. Fresh Tuna and Salmon are also high in selenium, which is not only an antioxidant and immune booster, but also an anti-inflammatory. The standard American diet is highly acidic due to processed and sodas. Acid causes inflammation, which in turn causes a host of maladies such as arthritis, joint, muscle pain, and weight gain to name a few. Tuna and Salmon are also high in B vitamins and calcium, and packed in coconut water
column2: provide electrolytes for energy and loads of additional potassium.

column1: I recommend Smokey’s Gourmet Smoked Albacore and Salmon to all my nutritional clients and believe they should be available in every healthy vending machine, and store. We need to start making changes in our lives and the lives of our children, even if it is one snack, lunch able, or a single meal at a time.

column1: ","Sashimi Grade Albacore Tuna That Is Nothing Like You Have Ever Tasted Before

Hello to all our future contributors for our new indiegogo campaign. As you will see very quickly, we are involved in Seafoods, and especially with Albacore Tuna. So, before we get too far into it, we want to assure all of you out there, that we do not utilize any fish specie that is not completely sustainable, and we never use tuna that has been caught with nets
column2: particularly the infamous ""Purse Seine"" Nets that have been in use throughout the world's oceans over the past 60 + years, and continue to decimate our tuna resources mercilessly....  Thank you. I hope you will join our efforts to establish our responsible, sustainable, and renewable New Sashimi Grade Albacore Processing Facility in the Coastal Community of Florence, Oregon on the beautiful  Coast of the Pacific Northwest.

column1: Smokey's Gourmet Seafoods

We are totally ""Dolphin Safe."" All of our fish that we utilize and process are caught individually with hook and line. We use no fish that have been caught with nets of any kind.* The foregoing applies equally as well to all of our endangered Sea Turtle friends, which we never try to catch and eat anyway.
Endangered Loggerhead Amphibious Turtle.
*Note: Tuna Fish caught with nets are unable to be graded     as Sashimi Quality.
Pacific Northwest Sashimi Grade - Real Hickory Smoked Tuna - In Pure Spring Water - Hand Packed In Our 7oz. Easy Open Can
Our campaign is all about introducing the American people to the most flavor-able Albacore Tuna that can be obtained in the United States, or anywhere else on this planet except perhaps, for Japan.

The foregoing opportunity has presented itself only because the Albacore Fishermen of the Oregon Pacific Northwest have recently adopted and are currently processing their Albacore Tuna, utilizing traditional Japanese Sashimi techniques and methodology. The aforementioned is accomplished immediately upon catching each individual fish when bringing it aboard the fishing vessel.

Over the past 20 to 30 years the Oregon Albacore Fishermen have had some severe economic problems ranging from some years of extremely low catch rates, to too much tuna, creating low prices at the canneries
column2: and, of course, always together with the ever increasing vessel and equipment operating costs.

column1: In order to help alleviate some of these adverse conditions, the State of Oregon relaxed some laws & regulations allowing the fishermen to sell their fish directly from their boats, at the dock, to the public. This allowed them to by-pass the canneries
column2: however, it wasn't enough, so they decided they must also raise the quality of their fish and increase their market share.

column1: See The following Oregon State Sea Grant Video:
http://s1297.photobucket.com/user/smokeytuna/media/BuyingTuna_zpsbfebf826.mp4.html

In Short, they elected to embrace some of the traditional methods from the Japanese, whom, up until this point in time, were the only fishermen that had developed and were utilizing freshness and natural flavor retention practices
column2: commonly referred to as ""Sashimi Grading."" The above custom ""bleed-out"" action, when practiced properly, will ensure the inherent high quality traits and attributes of the fish, along with the natural and providential flavors of the fresh Albacore Tuna.

What People Are Saying:

I've been eating these amazing products since I was 15. Never has there been any fish of any species that has not only impressed me, but left me wanting more. I will never again have the privilege of knowing someone that has caught and prepared fish like Smokey. His processes and quality standards have always been far more than any business I've seen. This man has the expertise, experience, education and passion to truly create products like no one else! Trust me, once you've had the luxury to taste his amazing talents, nothing else will ever come close!
- Valinda Miller Myers

As a certified nutritionist, I know that food directly affects our health – positively or negatively. The fact poor health is now affecting our children, specifically in the form of obesity, is unacceptable. In the U.S., more than 1/3rd of children under the age of 13 are clinically obese. The alarming news is that this problem – epidemic, actually – is getting worse not better. Recently, medical scientists had to add the term “severely obese” to diagnose the ever-growing waistlines of our children, alone. Why is this happening? Aside from social or physiological reasons, it is poor choices in food, and simply not eating “whole food” any longer. We are a nation of processed, packaged food that is void of nutrients and energy for life. We are literally giving our children processed, fast food, as soon as they are weaned. I have clients who tell me their children do not like vegetables and “health foods.” The overwhelming conclusion, I discover, is that parents never gave them any to start with, nor are they eating healthy food themselves. Children copy what they see. Unfortunately, no matter what healthy lifestyle that child may adopt as he or she grows, they will always be fighting the fat cells that they developed prematurely, and most of all, the consequences of limited nutrition as a child. They need healthy food to be given and available to them.

The good news is, we have total control over this obesity and poor health epidemic. We can make healthier food choices, no matter what our age. Providing healthy food for our children is paramount, though, so they will continue to make better choices and enjoy good health in their future. We all know that fish is one of those foods that contain nutrients and minerals needed by us all
column2: but maybe some have had poor quality in the past and therefore think all fish tastes the same. Smokey’s Sashimi Grade, Regular or Smoked Albacore Tuna and Salmon have all the health benefits I want for my clients, and with natural smoky flavor that “non-fish eaters,” and even my youngest clients love.

column1: The difference in Smokey’s fish is the entire process. It is wild caught with a single hook on a troll line (never farm raised), and processed utilizing the strict traditional Japanese sashimi method(s) for optimum freshness and quality. It is then naturally cured and smoked using no nitrates or nitrites. It is processed and canned entirely by hand, in pure spring water or pure coconut water, preserving all of its natural flavor and nutritional value.

The health benefits of fresh Tuna and Salmon are tremendous. Everyone knows they contain heart healthy Omegas, but most do not know that these Omegas are proving to support brain health and cognitive function, not to mention energy. This is a great snack for our school age children and adults alike. Fresh Tuna and Salmon are also high in selenium, which is not only an antioxidant and immune booster, but also an anti-inflammatory. The standard American diet is highly acidic due to processed and sodas. Acid causes inflammation, which in turn causes a host of maladies such as arthritis, joint, muscle pain, and weight gain to name a few. Tuna and Salmon are also high in B vitamins and calcium, and packed in coconut water
column2: provide electrolytes for energy and loads of additional potassium.

column1: I recommend Smokey’s Gourmet Smoked Albacore and Salmon to all my nutritional clients and believe they should be available in every healthy vending machine, and store. We need to start making changes in our lives and the lives of our children, even if it is one snack, lunch able, or a single meal at a time.- Cheryl Mothes Proulx

column11: >Hustle for Health fitness program features music by International recording artist DJ Maestro, creator of the Turbo Hustle and several other popular urban line dances.

column1: We all know exercise is an important part of a healthy lifestyle, but I’ll be the first to admit, I rarely make time to go to the gym.

The truth is, people make time to do the things they love, and America has fallen in love with line dancing! From the electric slide to the Wobble, line dancing, stepping, hustlin’ and sliding is what we do at family functions and parties.

Hustle For Health has combined the up-tempo line dances created by DJ Maestro, with aerobic exercises to create a fitness routine that is so much fun that you’ll actually forget that you are working out!

column7: >Your donation helps us produce and package the first Hustle For Health at-home fitness DVD.

column1: ","Thank you for clicking! We appreciate you and your interest
in health focused campaigns like ours.
With your support, we will produce a world-class at-home fitness DVD so everyone will be able to have fun and get fit anytime, anywhere.
The 60 min DVD will include a warm-up, step-by-step dance instruction, uninterrupted workout routine and cool down. Bonus Features includes Healthy Eating Tips and Couples Dancing.
Hustle for Health fitness program features music by International recording artist DJ Maestro, creator of the Turbo Hustle and several other popular urban line dances.
We all know exercise is an important part of a healthy lifestyle, but I’ll be the first to admit, I rarely make time to go to the gym.

The truth is, people make time to do the things they love, and America has fallen in love with line dancing! From the electric slide to the Wobble, line dancing, stepping, hustlin’ and sliding is what we do at family functions and parties.

Hustle For Health has combined the up-tempo line dances created by DJ Maestro, with aerobic exercises to create a fitness routine that is so much fun that you’ll actually forget that you are working out!
What We Need
Your donation helps us produce and package the first Hustle For Health at-home fitness DVD.
Studio Production Costs:
Green Screen Studio Rental
Equipment Rental (dollies, lights etc)
Director of Photography
Two Cameramen
Audio Technician
Casting Cost:
Fitness Instructor
Additional Demonstration Dancers
Voice Over
Talent Agency Fees
Post Production Costs:
Video Editor
Audio Mixer
Graphic Artist
Duplication of DVDs
Packaging

What You GetBy supporting Hustle For Health fitness program you will receive a unique gift to express our gratitude for your generous contribution to creating healthier, more active families in America.
Gifts include:
Recognition on our website and social media as a noted supporter
A Hustle For Health t-shirt, water bottle, swag bag and bracelet.
Advanced, autographed copy of the Hustle For Health At-home fitness DVD
A exclusive line dance fitness class for your and your friends led by our talented program staff (for local contributors only).
An invitation to the DVD release party with a celebrity host.
Other Ways You Can Help
Visit and ""like"" our website www.HustleForHealth.com
Follow us on Twitter @HustleForHealth
Share this campaign on your Facebook page and tell people why you Line dance.
ABOUT THE MOVEMENT:
We are inspired by First Lady Michelle Obama's ""Let's Move"" campaign, fighting to end childhood obesity by increasing physical activity with creative and fun exercises that you want to do!
The Girl Scouts of Western New York, NY Assemblywoman and Buffalo Council Members are avid supporters and participants of the Hustle for Health line dance fitness program.
In 2014 Hustle For Health will attempt to set a new record for the longest line dance in the Guinness Book of World Records.
We continue to perform at health fairs, college and community events exposing more people to the MOVEment of aerobic line dancing.
ABOUT LINE DANCING:
Line dances are very popular at family reunions and school functions because they bring people of all ages and backgrounds together for a fun and engaging activity.
JR Galactic has licensed a large catalogue of line dance music with instructional lyrics that make it easy to learn and follow the steps of the Hustle for Health fitness routines.
We have added aerobic exercises and Yoga poses to the basic line dances, increasing the number of calories burned and muscles toned with each workout.
ABOUT THE PRODUCERS:
JR Galactic is an experienced production & casting company providing high quality content for radio, television, film, Internet and DVD platforms.

This family owned business teamed up with International recording artist DJ Maestro to create a healthy living platform for the Urban line dance community and introduce the high energy dances to kids and college students.",3.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Buffalo, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/hustle-for-health-aerobic-line-dance-fitness-dvd/pica

Hello, Eva Cassini here. I am an actress. I am 24 ( almost 25 come November 9th ), and I have done many things in my life and since I have gotten into the career path I love and enjoy a little over a year ago, I have been getting closer and closer to achieving my ""goal look"", but some obstacles have gotten in the way. I have been hit hard with financial trouble and at times, even normal living expenses have been feeling the brunt of this. So with all my finances tied up to make sure I can still live under a roof, eat, maintain electricity to continue working ( I work from home and my computer is my workstation, as I am sure many of you know ), and other various things to keep my head above the waterline, trying to attain any type of ""improvements"" like surgeries and laser hair removal is absolutely impossible.

My goal here is to raise funds to get a surgical procedure known as a Brazilian Butt Lift. What this is, is they extract fat tissue from various places ( usually the ""bad spots"" ) and then gently inject it into the buttocks and hip region. This allows for the surgeon to literally sculpt this part of my body to whatever I please. What I ""please"", is to have a feminine looking butt and hips. Nothing over-the-top, just to where I have a female shape, instead of a beanpole.
This will not only greatly help my appearance, but also bring up my self esteem.
Thank you.

-Eva Cassini

We are raising funds to take Sports Video Partners (SVP) through the next stage of development. We have proof of concept!!!
Now we want to:
1. Enhance the current Sports Video Partners platform with new features
2. Develop a mobile app for Android devices
3. Enhance our current iPhone/ iPad version
4.  Build enhanced entitlement and reporting capabilities.

Look, the youth sports market is enormous. It is widely dispersed and taps into the collective passion of athletes,parents, fans and friends. Billions of dollars are spent each year on teams, equipment and lessons yet there is no common platform to capture game action or instructional sessions.
<div class=""O1"">
<div>
“10,000 Hours of Practice”

In the book Outliers, author Malcolm Gladwell says that it takes roughly ten thousand hours of practice to achieve mastery in a field. Rehearsing a flawed approach will slow or stunt the path of improvement.
<div>
“Practice does not make perfect. Only perfect practice makes perfect.” Vince Lombardi
<div class=""O1"">

SVP is the solution provider that helps everyone involved through visualization and video analysis : the athlete, family, fan, coach and instructor. By seeing the correct form (and being able to reference previous instruction) athletes can maximize the impact of their training.
<div class=""O1"">
ESPN was not a household name years ago.
Be part of something special. ""SVP"" is positioned to be one of the most recognized brands around youth sports videos, training and instruction.
Risks and challenges

As with any start-up there are definitely lessons learned. We launched version 1.0 of Sports Video Partners after having detailed feedback sessions from users and instructors that agreed to use a beta version. This led us to modify several things including adjusting our server configuration and adding a team coach module. Our main challenge was adjusting a process that impacted multiple components however one of our major focus areas was maintaining flexibility with our development design. Slight delays (2 weeks) but a better outcome.

Subsequent to our launch of Version 1.0 we received additional feedback about new features and enhancements that would be helpful. We resolved to develop a mobile app for the iPhone first so we could get feedback prior to building an Android version. There are several improvements we will make with the Android version and have plans to develop an updated version of the iPhone app as well.

This is definitely a process vs. project i.e. it is never done. We will likely experience new challenges but we are highly confident that the SVP team has the diverse skill set necessary to find solutions to new problems.

To achieve success it is critical to both have an organized plan and remain flexible as feedback from your community identifies both opportunities and issues.

I was in a bicycle accident on June 24th, 2011 where is suffered the following injuries: 4 fractured vertebra (T3, T4, T6, T7), my T5 vertebra was a burst fracture (which means it was compressed so hard when I hit my head on the ground that it blew out of my spinal column) and also a fully broken and displaced sternum (horizontally).  On July 1st, 2011 I had a fusion surgery performed (7 hour surgery) where the surgeon took a large part of the back of my hip bone, ground it up, made a paste, retrieved what was left of my T5 put into my spinal column and placed 2 titanium rods and 8 screws on my T3-T7 vertebra and covered it with the bone paste.  I then had my sternum surgically fixed on May 10th, 2013 where the surgeon had to clear out any debris, bring my bones back to be one bone, put donor bone in there and also some bone matrix, wired it together and stitched me back up.  In the many months since the accident I have had a lot of pain and a lot of things that have happened.  The spinal fusion never healed, which means that my spine did not heal solidly and now I require another 6-7 hour back surgery on November 19th, 2013 where the surgeon will go in the same incision, remove the rods, check all of the screws, take out my T5 (what is left of it) and use it for bone matter, replace the T5 with a Titanium vertebra!!  This surgery will entail the surgeon removing my cartilage from where my ribs meet my spine, all of the muscle in that area and a cage will be placed around that area to HOPEFULLY heal and make less pain for me!!  I have lost my job, am currently trying to raise funds to pay for my medical insurance premiums and medical bills as well as be able to live in my current home.  Please help me continue to stay in my home to be comfortable and heal to the best that I can heal!  In 1 year from the surgery in November, I will require another surgery to have the screws removed from my spine.   The last 2 1/2 years have been my hardest yet and I feel like I'm just sinking more...PLEASE help me keep what I have left of my life!

Why I Want To Become An AntiGravity® Fitness Instructor and How You Can Help
column2:
>

  • As many of you know, for the past few years I've struggled with double vision, cognitive functioning, and sensory processing disorder (explained in fuller detail here and here). 

  • A few months ago, at the end of my first semester as a PhD candidate at the University of Utah, Dr. Ericson at the Rehabilitation Center's Brain Injury Program said to me: ""It's time you start seriously considering a viable Plan B, outside of academia."" 

  • Instead, I renewed my efforts in vision therapy, physical therapy, occupational therapy (including vestibular, proprioceptive, kinesthetic, sensorimotor, listening, and sensory integration and regulation therapies), craniosacral therapy, myofascial trigger point release therapy, and mental health therapy. 

  • Then I found AntiGravity® Fitness, which changed my life. And now I want to become a certified instructor so I can help change others' lives. 

  • I'm going to go into a lot more detail about all of this below, but right here I'd like to ask for your help: I NEED TO RAISE $7,000, which will go toward CERTIFICATION COSTS (outlined below, including indiegogo's and other 3rd party fees). If you are able to contribute in any way, please select from the THANK YOU PERKS donated by writers, artists, musicians, photographers, editors, and publishers from all over the country. (If you are in a position to contribute and would rather not receive a perk, every $50 or $100 donation will go a very long way toward this campaign.)

column1: <span style=""letter-spacing: 0.8999999761581421px
column3: >AntiGravity® Fitness Has Changed My Life and How I Know It Can Help Others Like Me

column4: >Read about my first real ""breakthrough"" here.
column6: >Since then, I have stopped going to all but vision therapy (I still check in with my occupational therapist, but only once a month now instead of weekly). AntiGravity® Fitness incorporates physical therapy and ""heavy work,"" proprioceptive and vestibular stimulation and feedback, deep tissue trigger point massage, and, with the help of the hammock's tight, total body ""squeeze"" (which is like wearing a ""hug vest"") my central nervous system is calmed enough that I am better able to self-regulate prior to sensory overload or sensory meltdown caused by overstimulating environments (classrooms, grocery stores, movie theaters, etc.).
column10: >I spend, on average, 3 hours a day, at least 3-4 days a week, in the AntiGravity® Fitness studio, and this practice has become a fundamental and essential part of my recovery -- allowing me to reclaim my old life as a reader, reviewer, writer, editor, publisher, scholar, and professor.
column13: >This is my hope for future clientele: that with AntiGravity® Fitness they too will be able to better cope with their individual challenges and learn to manage the lives and futures they desire.
column15: >An AntiGravity® Fitness Instructor, I Hope To Serve Individuals Who Also Have Special Needs

column1: • After a few months of casual discussion, Darlene Casanova, the owner of my local AntiGravity® Fitness studio, Imagination Place, asked if I wanted to interview for an instructor position. During that interview, she said: ""How do you see yourself fitting in here with what we already do?""

• I answered: ""Once I'm trained in FUNdamentals, my primary goal is to help people discover just how able their bodies really are. Once I'm trained to teach Aerial and Suspension Fitness, I'd want to continue to help them realize their own strength and power. I'm happy to work with young, able-bodied clients, but I really want to get trained to teach Restorative, so that eventually I can focus on working with the disabled, autistic, sensory challenged, overweight, and recovering-from-surgery and brain trauma demographics. I'd also like to get certified to teach Kids, so I can help children with ADD/ADHD and other focusing and processing disorders and also teach parent &
column2: baby classes, hopefully with a focus on sensory integration and regulation for premature babies and infants.""

column5: >So . . . much sooner than I had anticipated: MAY 2014

Working from different hammock heights allows for the gentle opening of hips and spine.

column1: <span style=""letter-spacing: 0.8999999761581421px
column3: >AntiGravity® Fitness Meets Academia

column2: >I feel the need to state clearly that I am not giving up on academia.
column3: >But I also want to say that, to be perfectly honest, being in this PhD program feels like a responsibility, a duty, something I am doing mostly because I owe it to the old me who had a very clear path laid out -- BA, MA, MFA, PhD, tenure-track University job.

column1: <span style=""letter-spacing: 0.8999999761581421px
column2: >There is a part of me (the old me) that still wants that life -- so badly, in fact, that over the past three years whenever I've stumbled off the path I've found some way to clutch and claw my way back (usually with the help of some specialist. To date, I've spent over $12,000 of student loan money on medical bills).
column4: >But I don't know if the new me -- a calmer, more peaceful, less career-manic, more present me -- wants to suffer
column6: > intense visual strain (read: eye muscle pain) and the mental and physical fatigue of an academic's constant reading load for the rest of my professional life.

column3: >All I know is that right now I have an opportunity to incorporate a new kind of teaching into my life by becoming an AntiGravity® Fitness instructor. I want to explore this opportunity because it makes me feel better, because it makes me happy, and because maybe the old me owes it to the new me to just see where it takes us. And if it turns out that I can help facilitate a fraction of the relief I've experienced for even just a few clients a day, then not only will I have spent that day helping others while also helping myself but I'll then be able to go home and give more mental and physical energy to my future family.
column4:
>All this said, I believe that there will be a meeting of these two possible paths -- a middle ground that can support each in ways that I have yet to conceive or consider. And I believe, too, that somewhere between the old me and the new me there is a middle me, who will still be able to teach and read and write and edit and publish, and who will also find a way to teach and touch and help a lot of other people heal. 

","Why I Want To Become An AntiGravity® Fitness Instructor and How You Can HelpAs many of you know, for the past few years I've struggled with double vision, cognitive functioning, and sensory processing disorder (explained in fuller detail here and here). A few months ago, at the end of my first semester as a PhD candidate at the University of Utah, Dr. Ericson at the Rehabilitation Center's Brain Injury Program said to me: ""It's time you start seriously considering a viable Plan B, outside of academia."" Instead, I renewed my efforts in vision therapy, physical therapy, occupational therapy (including vestibular, proprioceptive, kinesthetic, sensorimotor, listening, and sensory integration and regulation therapies), craniosacral therapy, myofascial trigger point release therapy, and mental health therapy. Then I found AntiGravity® Fitness, which changed my life. And now I want to become a certified instructor so I can help change others' lives. I'm going to go into a lot more detail about all of this below, but right here I'd like to ask for your help: I NEED TO RAISE $7,000, which will go toward CERTIFICATION COSTS (outlined below, including indiegogo's and other 3rd party fees). If you are able to contribute in any way, please select from the THANK YOU PERKS donated by writers, artists, musicians, photographers, editors, and publishers from all over the country. (If you are in a position to contribute and would rather not receive a perk, every $50 or $100 donation will go a very long way toward this campaign.)

column1: How AntiGravity® Fitness Has Changed My Life and How I Know It Can Help Others Like Me

Read about my first real ""breakthrough"" here. Since then, I have stopped going to all but vision therapy (I still check in with my occupational therapist, but only once a month now instead of weekly). AntiGravity® Fitness incorporates physical therapy and ""heavy work,"" proprioceptive and vestibular stimulation and feedback, deep tissue trigger point massage, and, with the help of the hammock's tight, total body ""squeeze"" (which is like wearing a ""hug vest"") my central nervous system is calmed enough that I am better able to self-regulate prior to sensory overload or sensory meltdown caused by overstimulating environments (classrooms, grocery stores, movie theaters, etc.).I spend, on average, 3 hours a day, at least 3-4 days a week, in the AntiGravity® Fitness studio, and this practice has become a fundamental and essential part of my recovery -- allowing me to reclaim my old life as a reader, reviewer, writer, editor, publisher, scholar, and professor.This is my hope for future clientele: that with AntiGravity® Fitness they too will be able to better cope with their individual challenges and learn to manage the lives and futures they desire. As An AntiGravity® Fitness Instructor, I Hope To Serve Individuals Who Also Have Special Needs

After a few months of casual discussion, Darlene Casanova, the owner of my local AntiGravity® Fitness studio, Imagination Place, asked if I wanted to interview for an instructor position. During that interview, she said: ""How do you see yourself fitting in here with what we already do?""

I answered: ""Once I'm trained in FUNdamentals, my primary goal is to help people discover just how able their bodies really are. Once I'm trained to teach Aerial and Suspension Fitness, I'd want to continue to help them realize their own strength and power. I'm happy to work with young, able-bodied clients, but I really want to get trained to teach Restorative, so that eventually I can focus on working with the disabled, autistic, sensory challenged, overweight, and recovering-from-surgery and brain trauma demographics. I'd also like to get certified to teach Kids, so I can help children with ADD/ADHD and other focusing and processing disorders and also teach parent & baby classes, hopefully with a focus on sensory integration and regulation for premature babies and infants.""
When Does AntiGravity® Fitness Instructor Training Begin?I got the job! So . . . much sooner than I had anticipated: MAY 2014!
What I Need to Get Certified As An AntiGravity® Fitness InstructorAG FUNdamentals 1 & 2This will be my first (immediate) certification, with the others to follow over the next several months.
Cost of certification $1,200

AG Aerial Yoga 1 & 2Cost of certification $1,200AG Suspension Fitness 1 & 2Cost of certification $1,200AG Restorative YogaOffers accessibility to students with physical limitations, and incorporates levitating meditations, zero-compression inversions, supported sun salutations, joint opening poses, and a floating sivasana. Working from different hammock heights allows for the gentle opening of hips and spine.Cost of certification $750AG KidsAllows me to work with babies and children. Cost of certification $1,750
Where AntiGravity® Fitness Meets Academia

I feel the need to state clearly that I am not giving up on academia. But I also want to say that, to be perfectly honest, being in this PhD program feels like a responsibility, a duty, something I am doing mostly because I owe it to the old me who had a very clear path laid out -- BA, MA, MFA, PhD, tenure-track University job.

There is a part of me (the old me) that still wants that life -- so badly, in fact, that over the past three years whenever I've stumbled off the path I've found some way to clutch and claw my way back (usually with the help of some specialist. To date, I've spent over $12,000 of student loan money on medical bills). But I don't know if the new me -- a calmer, more peaceful, less career-manic, more present me -- wants to suffer intense visual strain (read: eye muscle pain) and the mental and physical fatigue of an academic's constant reading load for the rest of my professional life.

All I know is that right now I have an opportunity to incorporate a new kind of teaching into my life by becoming an AntiGravity® Fitness instructor. I want to explore this opportunity because it makes me feel better, because it makes me happy, and because maybe the old me owes it to the new me to just see where it takes us. And if it turns out that I can help facilitate a fraction of the relief I've experienced for even just a few clients a day, then not only will I have spent that day helping others while also helping myself but I'll then be able to go home and give more mental and physical energy to my future family.All this said, I believe that there will be a meeting of these two possible paths -- a middle ground that can support each in ways that I have yet to conceive or consider. And I believe, too, that somewhere between the old me and the new me there is a middle me, who will still be able to teach and read and write and edit and publish, and who will also find a way to teach and touch and help a lot of other people heal.",6.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Salt Lake City, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fly-with-molly/pica

column1:
REMI is your child’s new best friend when it comes to sleep routines. REMI is a smart, customizable sleep companion that goes to sleep with your little one and wakes up with them in the morning, ensuring they stay in bed until it’s time to get up. REMI grows up with your kids and has the ability to learn their sleep routines, becoming more customizable and interactive as time goes on. 
REMI uses Bluetooth to connect to your tablets and iOS and Android devices using a mobile app that is easy to navigate for both parents and children. Everything you need to track your little one's sleep patterns is all available within REMI's app.

Create your baby’s customized bedtime and naptime routine through alerts, lighting, music and more. Use the mobile app to customize REMI’s colors to ones that your baby will recognize and associate with going to sleep and waking up to create the ultimate sleep routine.

Customize REMI’s display and even let your child use the app to learn how to manage their bedtime routine. You can choose to display the time, date, facial expressions and lighting preferences that show your little one when it’s ok to get out of bed and when it’s time to sleep.

Make your baby comfortable at night with the adjustable nightlight, or even play your baby’s favorite lullaby! You can download your child’s favorite music, record your own song or play some of REMI’s sounds to settle them to sleep.

Track the sound of your child’s nights by creating and maintaining a diary with your app to help you identify what conditions are ideal to foster your baby’s sleep routine. Visually see when your baby is sleeping the best and what times they’re waking up. With REMI, you’ll always know why your child is groggy during the day or wired and full of energy!

Use REMI as a baby monitor to listen to your baby or talk to your child and let them know it’s time to turn off the lights or get out of bed in the morning. With the REMI mobile app, you can adjust the sound sensibility to hear more or less, whenever it’s convenient for you. If your baby is ever sick, increase the sensibility to hear them better or turn the sensibility down for nights when you need to sleep more soundly, but still want to be alerted.

 

Create an account or log in with Facebook to share your most useful tips and strategies for creating healthy bedtime routines for your children with your friends, family and other parents. If your child isn’t sleeping well or doesn’t like taking afternoon naps, see what other parents are doing to get new ideas that might just work for your little one!

REMI connects to your iOS or Android phone via Bluetooth, so you don’t have to worry about using up your monthly data plan while connecting to the app. Add and remove different REMI’s, and name them for each of your children- that way you can keep track of all of your kids and have different sleep diaries and alerts for each child!

column4: >“REMI can be of great interest not only for the busy parent to help their child have more regular sleep patterns, but also for the pediatric clinical evaluation of sleep patterns. In the daily clinic, if a parent can show their pediatrician the precise sleep pattern of the child, the sleep duration and the periods of awake time, it will help the clinician identify what the cause of the sleep trouble may be. The causes can be anything from anxiety to the need for parental contact or hunger, teething, pain or plain dreamstage cycle awakenings as well as hormonal melatonin cycle dysregulation. REMI will help differentiate these different causes and improve pediatric workflow and potentially improve treatment choice and outcomes.”
>- Dr P. Bitoun, MD FAAP fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics in Boston

column2: >

column1: <div>

column2: >We put in a lot of time designing REMI and interviewing parents to understand what would be most useful. We worked on several different prototypes and have already developed a network of industrial partners that we can count on to help manufacture REMI. But before we can start manufacturing, we're bringing REMI to you through Indiegogo to get the feedback and funds that we need to help make REMI a reality.

column1: <div><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><span><b style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Is REMI easy to use? How do you use it?

column1: <div>

REMI is easy for both parents and kids to use! Just download the REMI app on your Apple or Android device and follow the installation process. Plug REMI into the wall, press the Bluetooth button to pair up with your smartphone and REMI will immediately catch the time and you’ll have access to all of its features.
<div>

Can REMI be used as a Bluetooth speaker?
Yes, you can stream music from your smartphone to REMI via Bluetooth. You can also download music onto REMI to be able to play it without any connection to your smartphone.
<div>

Does the app keep recording even if I quit it?
Yes, you can quit the app and REMI will still record your baby’s night profile. In the morning, just connect to the app to get your sleep score and data history.
<div>

Can I adjust the display remote?
Yes, you can adjust the display remote using the app on your smartphone. All REMI’s display can be adjusted remotely (light, lullaby, bedtime, alarm, etc.).

How can I transfer my music to REMI?
Easily transfer your music by connecting REMI to your mobile device or laptop with the USB cable.

What happens if there is a power supply breach? 
In case of a power supply breach, all of your settings will be safe because they are stored in REMI’s memory. When the power comes back on, just connect REMI back with your smartphone. Time will adjust automatically. However, during a power breach, REMI cannot record your baby’s night profile.

column3: >Can I use REMI without my smartphone?
column4: >All of REMI's main settings are managed by the mobile app which you can use on your smartphone or tablet. However, we designed REMI with a keyboard on the bottom so that some of the features are accessible without your electronic devices.

column1: <div>

Where is my data stored? Who can access it?
Your short term data is stored in within REMI and in the mobile app. Your data history is stored in a highly secured cloud and only you can access it through your user account.

Does REMI ever get hot or heat up?
No, REMI is quite large for a Bluetooth device and stays cool.

“REMI can be of great interest not only for the busy parent to help their child have more regular sleep patterns, but also for the pediatric clinical evaluation of sleep patterns. In the daily clinic, if a parent can show their pediatrician the precise sleep pattern of the child, the sleep duration and the periods of awake time, it will help the clinician identify what the cause of the sleep trouble may be. The causes can be anything from anxiety to the need for parental contact or hunger, teething, pain or plain dreamstage cycle awakenings as well as hormonal melatonin cycle dysregulation. REMI will help differentiate these different causes and improve pediatric workflow and potentially improve treatment choice and outcomes.”
- Dr P. Bitoun, MD FAAP fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics in Boston

We put in a lot of time designing REMI and interviewing parents to understand what would be most useful. We worked on several different prototypes and have already developed a network of industrial partners that we can count on to help manufacture REMI. But before we can start manufacturing, we're bringing REMI to you through Indiegogo to get the feedback and funds that we need to help make REMI a reality.

Does the app keep recording even if I quit it?Yes, you can quit the app and REMI will still record your baby’s night profile. In the morning, just connect to the app to get your sleep score and data history.
Can I adjust the display remote?Yes, you can adjust the display remote using the app on your smartphone. All REMI’s display can be adjusted remotely (light, lullaby, bedtime, alarm, etc.).

How can I transfer my music to REMI? Easily transfer your music by connecting REMI to your mobile device or laptop with the USB cable.What happens if there is a power supply breach? In case of a power supply breach, all of your settings will be safe because they are stored in REMI’s memory. When the power comes back on, just connect REMI back with your smartphone. Time will adjust automatically. However, during a power breach, REMI cannot record your baby’s night profile.

Can I use REMI without my smartphone?All of REMI's main settings are managed by the mobile app which you can use on your smartphone or tablet. However, we designed REMI with a keyboard on the bottom so that some of the features are accessible without your electronic devices.

Where is my data stored? Who can access it?Your short term data is stored in within REMI and in the mobile app. Your data history is stored in a highly secured cloud and only you can access it through your user account.

Having your period can be uncomfortable enough when you have easy access
to running water, clean underwear and sanitary products. But what if you don’t?
Imagine you have had to leave your country for your safety. You’ve seen
unspeakable things, the journey has taken its toll on your body, your mind, spirit,
and you have few resources. You are living in overcrowded makeshift
accommodation with no privacy, no bathroom, no running water, and you are what
feel like a million miles from anything familiar. And then you get your period.
On August 31st, we will be driving to Calais with a car
stocked full (hopefully) with sanitary towels, tampons and underwear. We’re
raising money to buy as much as we can in bulk, to get maximum value from all
donations. Will you chip in?
We’ve established links with an organisation based there – Calais,
Ouverture &amp
column2: Humanité -  and will be covering all transportation costs

column1: ourselves so any donations go directly toward buying menstrual hygiene supplies
and underwear.
Everyone deserves to feel clean on their period. Everyone deserves to be prepared.
A couple of quid could go a long way to making life that little bit
easier.

Please help us support Carol and her family.  On 12/19/13, Carol tragically suffered a massive stroke.    

***PLEASE MAKE SURE TO CLICK ON ""UPDATES""  and ""GALLERY"" tabs, for videos and the latest on CAROL's PROGRESS!

 


Carol is young and vibrant, only 46 years old.  She is married to her devoted husband, John, and together they have a beautiful 7year old son, Nathaniel.

To know Carol is to love her!  She is a loving mother, wife, sister, daughter, aunt. She is an incredibly compassionate social worker, and has dedicated her life to helping others

 Carol was on life support, in the ICU for weeks.  She progressed through a sub-acute unit and miraculously woke from her coma in February.

Carol went on to Rehab in March until eventually the insurance company wouldn't pay for anymore time there.

She is at home now and is wheelchair bound with limited mobility.

Unfortunately the sub arachnoid hemorrhage has damaged her memory and there are many moments of confusion through out the day.

.

Carol needs to continue with her Rehab to make progress. Its getting close for John to continue back to work but in order to do this he must find a caregiver for Carol. If John doesn't go back to work soon he wont be able to get Carol on his medical benefits as Carols insurance will be ending in the coming months.

   



*Please check back regularly and click on ""Updates"" tab, where you'll find the latest on Carol's progress..  and feel free to write notes to Carol, John, and Nathaniel in the ""Comments"" tab*

What We Need.

We hope that with our support, her husband John can focus on Carol and Nathaniel, instead of worrying how he'll cover the family's expenses.  John has been by Carol's side since her stroke and as a result, has already run out of his leave time at his job.   Carol is also close to being out of her leave time, and the family is facing a possible end to her medical benefits. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please continue your positive thoughts and prayers for Carol and her family.  We would very much appreciate your help in getting the word out! Please post and re-post on your Facebook page, and email the link to your friends and family.  THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH!!

column5: >Hi, thank you for looking at my pitch! My name is Cameron Bennet, I am a student from Brisbane, Australia and recently competed in my first amateur Fitness and Physique competition through INBA. To my surprise and pleasure I placed first in my division, qualifying me for both Nationals and the Natural Olympia. Anyone who knows me, knows I used to be extremely small and skinny with minimal self confidence and something like this was beyond my wildest dreams. But since beginning training and putting in the hard yards, I have seen a change in myself I could never have expected!

column1: Going to San Diego to compete in the Natural Olympia would be a culmination of the hard work, countless hours of gym and training and the triumph over the immense amount of self doubt and external criticism that accompanies attempting something like this. Not only this, your contribution would also help further promote myself in this competitive industry to hopefully inspire others lacking the self belief that they can achieve anything they set their mind to.

All funding raised will go towards flights and travel costs from Brisbane, Australia to San Diego, quite an expensive trip to travel to the other side of the world. I have estimated costs to be close to $3000, my target is just to assist with some of this and any funds raised would be deeply appreciated.

I will be going into this competition as one of the youngest competitors, but far from this being a disadvantage, I want to use it to help people realise that age isn't a hurdle and you need to seize opportunity when it's there, you can't wait until you're ready!

While I obviously go to San Diego with the intention of putting in my best possible performance and hopefully coming away with a win, I also hope to serve as an inspiration to anyone in the fitness industry or otherwise who may not have that self belief or who may believe the people telling them they can't achieve their goals and dreams. I hope I can show them the transformation I have made both physically and mentally to enable me to achieve my goals.

The competition will be exceptionally tough at the Olympia and I have no misconceptions that my chances as a first time competitor may be discounted by some. But I know the hard work and dedication that have gone into this journey so far and how much more I still have to achieve and I don't plan on stopping until I get there!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, even if you can't contribute, could you take a moment to share this cause. Or if you really don't have time, please take away the key message that if you truly want something, then work for it. You absolutely can achieve it! And please don't be the person to crush someone else's dreams, no matter how crazy you may think they are. People need to be supportive and together we could achieve so, so, so much more!
Thank you for your time and any help you can provide!

Short Summary – Be sure to check
out our YouTube video!
Everyone deserves a safe food supply!
But how safe is our food?
Have you ever questioned whether or not that hamburger in your
fridge is safe to feed your family?
Have you suffered for your bad decision-making?
Have you tossed out a beefsteak simply because you didn't want
to take a chance?
Safe Food Scientific has developed a product that lets you know
in real time, whether or not the beef in your refrigerator is still fresh enough
to eat. We do it with something called a Bio-Sensor.
A biosensor is a simple little piece of paper that turns color
when your meat is bad. How does it do this? Well, bad beef smells. Our
biosensor turns colors in the presence of bad gas given off by bacteria in beef
when they multiply and their numbers get too high.  It's as simple as
that.
While we are working on lab certifying for pork, poultry, lamb and fish.  We have already engineered one for beef, called it our
Beef-Fresh Check Sensor™, And right now, a national premium grocer has
tested it and they are considering putting it into all of their stores.  A
regional grocer is ready to put this on the shelves in New England “whenever
you are ready.""
Our “Beef-Fresh Check™” sensors provide consumers with
laboratory precision at home in an easy to use tab, “A Lab in a Tab™”! We at
Safe Food Scientific Inc., have been working diligently for years to get our
first consumer product, “Beef-Fresh Check” sensors production-ready. With local
independent labs confirming our accuracy in measuring the amount of bacteria in
beef as it spoils, we are ready to bring this power to where it can have the
biggest impact, right to your kitchen.
Different types of spoilage bacteria present in beef, reproduce
at different rates under proper conditions
column2: access to nutrients, water and the

column1: right temperature. These bacteria can grow exponentially, doubling their
numbers every 20 minutes.
Beyond causing disease (illness), large number of microorganisms
in beef, and their waste products will cause disagreeable changes in its odor,
taste and texture.  As meat spoils, gaseous by-products of bacterial
metabolism accumulate and can be detected by our “Beef-Fresh Check ™” tabs.
Unlike other labels or sensors, our bio-sensor technology reads (interprets),
in real-time, the amount of bacterial contaminants.
This process is in line with the FDA and international standards
that establish that food cannot be sold and should not be eaten, when bacteria
counts reaches a certain level (10M cfu/g).  That is precisely the level
that causes the color change in our “Beef-Fresh Check™” tab.
In addition, Safe Food Scientific, Inc. has been working with a
production partner to validate each step of the production process, and
finally, our “Beef-Fresh Check™” Home Freshness Monitor is now
production-ready.
Our goal is to have these available to US consumers in the
spring of 2014. We are working with premium grocers at the regional and
national levels, and they are awaiting our sensors for pilot testing!
So we come to the Indiegogo community looking for funds to
support our initial production of “Beef-Fresh Check™” tabs!
We also have strong interest from the international marketplace
(Australia, Africa and Asia). At Safe Food Scientific, we are excited at the
opportunity to give people around the world the power to ensure the meat they
eat is as fresh and safe as possible!
Your support of our Campaign will help give people around the
world the ability to ensure the food they give their loved ones is as fresh as
possible!
What We Need!
We are looking for $20,000 to fund the
minimum initial production run. In return for your support, we have some great
perks, from Beef-Fresh Check Family Packs to a great t-shirt or hoodie with our
“How Fresh Is Your MEAT?” tag line, to having the ability to help name our
cow!  (up to 25 people will be able to
suggest names for the cow and vote on the final name, which will be used in our
marketing).
Please let your friends know about
us!  Help us make some noise and get to
market!  Don’t forget to use the

Indiegogo share tools for Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest! 

","Short Summary – Be sure to check
out our YouTube video!
Everyone deserves a safe food supply!
But how safe is our food?
Have you ever questioned whether or not that hamburger in your
fridge is safe to feed your family?
Have you suffered for your bad decision-making?
Have you tossed out a beefsteak simply because you didn't want
to take a chance?
Safe Food Scientific has developed a product that lets you know
in real time, whether or not the beef in your refrigerator is still fresh enough
to eat. We do it with something called a Bio-Sensor.
A biosensor is a simple little piece of paper that turns color
when your meat is bad. How does it do this? Well, bad beef smells. Our
biosensor turns colors in the presence of bad gas given off by bacteria in beef
when they multiply and their numbers get too high.  It's as simple as
that.
While we are working on lab certifying for pork, poultry, lamb and fish.  We have already engineered one for beef, called it our
Beef-Fresh Check Sensor™, And right now, a national premium grocer has
tested it and they are considering putting it into all of their stores.  A
regional grocer is ready to put this on the shelves in New England “whenever
you are ready.""

<h3 style=""text-align: center

Omega Lifestyle Health and Fitness is a small training venue that utilizes facilities of the Vernon College Fitness Center located in Wichita Falls, TX. 

Along side training, Omega aids Vernon Colleges' student body in gaining knowledge and comfort in the gym when the opportunity presents itself and partake in community events such as Vernon College's 5k Hunger Run, which donates proceeds and food to the local Wichita Falls Food Bank and Share our Strengths: No Kid Hungry campaign.

The facility is a remainder of what was once a brand name gym(for legal purposes I have left the specific name out) and was acquired by Vernon College to provide a facility for the student body, faculty members, and community.

Due to the fact that the equipment is outdated and has seen better days the gym is in dire need of an upgrade. Even with commissions from personal trainers, the fitness center has had a difficult time creating a budget in order to purchase new equipment due to the continuous maintenance needed on the outdated machines and the shared budget under the continuing education programs.

column5: >Though not at fault, the shared funds between several scholastic programs have kept any funding for the fitness center at bay and seems to be an uphill battle.

column1: Even though we operate as a separate entity, we have created a collective effort with Vernon College Fitness Center.
We have taken it upon ourselves to not only fund for ourselves, but also help provide for the fitness center, its student body, faculty members, and surrounding communities.
Our Needs

Our needs are simple yet come with a heavy price tag. Our training program would like to purchase equipment to be utilized for outdoors boot camps, one on one training, and physical fitness assessments.

The needs for the facility itself, include but are not limited to the  purchase of 10 new spins bikes, a possibility of 2 new treadmills and elliptical, 2 squat racks , and other small accessory needs and maintenance.
Hunger Run

Budgeting for a community event can be difficult and raising awareness has been a challenge. Timing systems, awards, and event shirts all add up fairly quickly. That's why we will be using a percentage of the funds to help fund the 2015 Hunger Run.
The Impact

Raising funds will help Omega Lifestyle Health and Fitness with a head start in its current  business ambitions as well as provide a safer and more effective training environment for our clients. We have  room to grow as a training business and  as a fitness center alike and with the funding from this campaign it will give us the push we need to be truly effective for our members, both students and community.
Aside from the fitness center, the impact on the community is what truly drives us to be and do our best day in and day out. The more funding we receive then the more we will be able to give back to our community through Share Our Strength and the Wichita Falls Area Food Bank.  

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

 Running under the Continuing Education program, its hard to receive funding for what we truly need. The involvement of so many programs under one department makes it difficult to get the things necessary to have the gym run as smoothly as possible.

column1:
Omega Lifestyle Itself has faced challenges simply by being such a small operation. Our set backs include lack of  a proper website , merchandising, and the larger scale gyms operating in the area.  

Due to the nature of the situation, all funds will be collected by Omega Lifestyle Health and Fitness. Who will then purchase and donate the equipment to the facility.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand it can be a crazy world at times and that not everyone has the ability to help out financially. If you are unable to donate please share our story and spread the word of our dreams and goals!
Or if you're located in the surrounding area Follow this active link and sign up for the Hunger Run!!  >

Omega Lifestyle Health and Fitness is a small training venue that utilizes facilities of the Vernon College Fitness Center located in Wichita Falls, TX. Along side training, Omega aids Vernon Colleges' student body in gaining knowledge and comfort in the gym when the opportunity presents itself and partake in community events such as Vernon College's 5k Hunger Run, which donates proceeds and food to the local Wichita Falls Food Bank and Share our Strengths: No Kid Hungry campaign.

Though not at fault, the shared funds between several scholastic programs have kept any funding for the fitness center at bay and seems to be an uphill battle.
Even though we operate as a separate entity, we have created a collective effort with Vernon College Fitness Center.
We have taken it upon ourselves to not only fund for ourselves, but also help provide for the fitness center, its student body, faculty members, and surrounding communities.
Our Needs

Our needs are simple yet come with a heavy price tag. Our training program would like to purchase equipment to be utilized for outdoors boot camps, one on one training, and physical fitness assessments.

The needs for the facility itself, include but are not limited to the  purchase of 10 new spins bikes, a possibility of 2 new treadmills and elliptical, 2 squat racks , and other small accessory needs and maintenance.
Hunger Run

Budgeting for a community event can be difficult and raising awareness has been a challenge. Timing systems, awards, and event shirts all add up fairly quickly. That's why we will be using a percentage of the funds to help fund the 2015 Hunger Run.
The Impact

Raising funds will help Omega Lifestyle Health and Fitness with a head start in its current  business ambitions as well as provide a safer and more effective training environment for our clients. We have  room to grow as a training business and  as a fitness center alike and with the funding from this campaign it will give us the push we need to be truly effective for our members, both students and community.Aside from the fitness center, the impact on the community is what truly drives us to be and do our best day in and day out. The more funding we receive then the more we will be able to give back to our community through Share Our Strength and the Wichita Falls Area Food Bank.  Risks & Challenges  Running under the Continuing Education program, its hard to receive funding for what we truly need. The involvement of so many programs under one department makes it difficult to get the things necessary to have the gym run as smoothly as possible.

Omega Lifestyle Itself has faced challenges simply by being such a small operation. Our set backs include lack of  a proper website , merchandising, and the larger scale gyms operating in the area.  Due to the nature of the situation, all funds will be collected by Omega Lifestyle Health and Fitness. Who will then purchase and donate the equipment to the facility.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand it can be a crazy world at times and that not everyone has the ability to help out financially. If you are unable to donate please share our story and spread the word of our dreams and goals!

Or if you're located in the surrounding area Follow this active link and sign up for the Hunger Run!!  >>>http://www.active.com/wichita-falls-tx/running/distance-running-races/the-hunger-run-5k-2015?int",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

READ BELOW FOR ENGLISH VERSION
Follow me @ Instagram
Mein Vorhaben

Ich bin Marvin, 28 Jahre alt und absolut sportbegeistert. Seit meiner Kindheit treibe ich Sport und achte extrem auf meine Ernährung, da ich eine Stoffwechselstörung habe. Ich spiele seit 20 Jahren Badminton und gehe regelmäßig ins Fitnessstudio. Das Fitnesstraining brachte mich auch auf meine Geschäftsidee.

Ich habe vor einen Lieferservice für Sportnahrung zu starten. Darunter kannst du dir das Prinzip vom klassischen Pizzataxi vorstellen. Über meine Homepage www.nutrip.de kann die Ware bestellt und noch am selben Tag geliefert werden.

Die Idee kam mir nach einem Trainingstag. Wenn man regelmäßig trainiert ist die Ernährung und die dazu passende Sportnahrung sehr wichtig und mit unter ausschlaggebend für die eigenen Ziele. Wenn man beispielsweise nach Hause kommt und man hat seinen Proteinshake nicht mehr vorrätig, so kann dies den Erfolg unterbrechen. Bestellt man aber noch am selben Tag sein gewünschtes Produkt bei NUTRIp, so ist eine Lückenlose Versorgung gegeben.  Der Name NUTRIp setzt sich aus Nutrition =Ernährung/ Ernährungsweise, Trip= die Fahrt zusammen.
Da sich die Anzahl der Mitglieder in Fitnessstudios drastisch vermehrt, so sehe ich darin stetig wachsendes Kundenpotenzial.

Ich habe mein Startkapital mit 10.000 Euro berechnet. Da es sich um einen Lieferservice handelt, benötige ich einen Lieferwagen. Damit ich und meine Idee ins Gespräch kommt, wird einiges an Werbematerial benötigt. Ich habe vor den Lieferwagen auffällig zu bekleben, in den Lokalen Zeitschriften werden Annoncen geschaltet. Flyer werden ausgelegt, besonders in Geschäften für Sportmode, natürlich in Fitnessstudios. Wurfblätter werden verteilt, explizit in der nähe von Fitnessstudios und anderen Sporteinrichtungen. Eine große Summe wird für die Sportnahrung benötigt. Ich möchte ausschließlich qualitativ hochwertige Produkte beziehen. Des Weiteren  werden T-Shirts und Shaker bedruckt und als Werbegeschenke in den Umlauf gebracht. Die Homepage ist bereits Programmiert und kann jeder Zeit an den Start gehen. Neue Medien wie Instagram und Facebook werde ich natürlich auch nutzen. 

Wenn ich das Funding-Ziel nicht erreichen sollte, müsste ich den ""normalen"" Weg gehen zur Bank beziehungsweise KFW Förderung. An der Umsetzung und an den Erfolg glaube ich und ich werde meine Idee in jedem Fall verwirklichen.

Im laufe der letzten Jahre habe ich beobachtet wie enorm sich das Thema Körper und Ernährung verändert hat. Fitnessstudios Boomen, es gibt immer mehr Veganer,  Bio-Supermärkte gibt es an fast jeder Ecke. Der neuste Trend aus den Staaten sind Detox Saftkuren die zum Kunden nach Hause geliefert werden. Warum dann nicht auch die Sportnahrung? Genau das habe ich zu meiner Idee gemacht. Qualitativ hochwertige Sportnahrung die nach Bestellung sofort wie ein Pizza nach Hause geliefert wird. Ich möchte einen Beitrag zu dem neuen gesunden Körpergefühl beitragen.

Ich werde der erste Sportnahrungslieferservice sein, der sofort nach Bestellung noch am selben Tag liefert. Der Bedarf ist mehr als Vorhanden. Alleine im Fitnessstudio, welches ca. 5km von mir entfernt ist, zählt derzeit 7500 Mitglieder. Würde nur jedes 50 Mitglied potenzieller Kunde sein, so wären dies 150 Kunden. Deutschland ist eines der drei Umsatzstärksten Länder Weltweit, in der Fitness/ Sportnahrungsbranche. Im Jahre 2013 lag der Umsatz der Fitnessindustrie alleine in Europa bei 32,02 Mrd US $ (Quelle: Statista.com). Der Umsatz ist Tendenz steigend. All diese Fakten sprechen für sich und lassen mich nicht an meinem Erfolg zweifeln.
<h3><span style=""line-height: 26px
column5: >Jeder der über mein Vorhaben spricht und so mit meine Idee teil, trägt dazu bei NUTRIp ein Stück nach vorne zu bringen. Erzählt euren sportbegeisterten Freunden davon. Holt euch vielleicht ein Feedback ein und berichtet mir davon.

column1: Bis hier hin erstmal vielen Dank fürs lesen. Vielleicht steht irgendwann ein Teammitglied von NUTRIp vor deiner Tür und liefert dir einen Proteinriegel :). Dann weisst du, damals bei Indiegogo warst du einer der ersten, der von dieser tollen Idee las.
<div>
ENGLISH VERSION

I am Marvin, 28 years old and absolutely enthusiastic in sports. Since my childhood I am doing sports and pay a lot of attention to my nutrition because i have a special metabolic disturbance. I play badminton for 20 years and i go to the gym regularly. Through the fitness training i came up with my business idea. I want to start a Nutrition delivery service. So you can imagine this idea as a  simple pizza taxi just for Nutrition. Via my Homepage www.nutrip.de you can order your Nutrition and you will be delivered on the same day. The idea came to me on a training day. If you train regularly the Nutrition is very important for your success. So if you come home after training and you don't have any protein shake this can interrupt the performance. But if you order on the same day your product on NUTRIp, a complete supply is given. The name NUTRIp is a composite from Nutrition and Trip. The members in gyms is always getting more and more, because of this point i see a constantly growing customer potential. My start-up capital is 10000 Euro / 11223 US$. So it is a delivery service and i need a little van. I need a lot of publicity material. The van gets full of NUTRIp stickers. I do listings in local magazines. We give Flyers to shops for sports fashion an of course to the gyms. Most of the money i need for the quality Nutrition. I only want to order the best brands. Further shaker and Tshirts be printed and will be put in circulation. The homepage is already programmed and can be started. I have a account on instagram: nutrip_lieferservice and i Facebook is coming next. If i don't reach the target i need to go the normal way to the Bank. I believe in my ideas any time and i implement them.

During the last couple of years i have observed how the topic of body and nutrition has changed. Gyms are booming, there are more and more vegetarian, organic supermarkets are on every corner. The latest trend in america are detox cures that are delivered to customers home. Why not the sports nutrition? This is my business! You need a shake in the afternoon after training, and have nothing at home, you order your product on NUTRIp and get it at home like a pizza. I will be the first delivery service which supplies on the same day after request. Potential customers are more than available. Just an example, the gym just next to me has 7500 members, if any 50 member is a potential customer for me this would be 150 customers. Germany is one of the three major revenue countries world-wide, in the fitness/sports nutrition industry. In 2013 the sales of the fitness industry was 32,02 Mrd US$ just in Europe  (Source statista.com). The sales trend is rising.All these facts speak for themselves and will not let me doubt my success.
Everyone who speaks about my idea NUTRIp brings the project a little bit forward. Told your friends about it, get a feedback an told me about it.

Up to this point i like to say thank you! Maybe one day is a team member of NUTRIp at your door and delivers you a protein bar :). Then you know, you were one of the first who read about this great idea at Indiegogo those days….. .
THANK YOU

column2:
>unaware of PMDD.

In 2014, with the advancement of the internet (especially Facebook)
column3: >more and more women are able to connect with other women with PMDD to find support and help in reaching a diagnosis.
column4: >A major roadblock still exists, however, in the awareness of this disorder as well as a lack of information available. There have been several studies on PMDD, but any effort being put into distributing this information to patients and doctors has been minimal.

column6: >it needs to be distributed in a way that can be universally understood.
column7:
>Also needed is more funding for research on what causes PMDD and how to treat it. While pharmaceutical companies are quite ready to offer treatments, it is still unknown what actually causes PMDD. How can we be effectively treating a disorder that doesn't have a consensus on what it is? There has been and are ongoing studies on the symptoms and causes of PMDD, but more research is definitely needed.


Stopping Incorrect Diagnoses

column1:
Women and doctors need to know the symptoms of PMDD and how to treat it. All too often PMDD is misdiagnosed as bipolar disorder, hormonal disorder, general depression disorder, or worse. These incorrect diagnosis often lead to improper treatments and can have devastating results.

Women who are unaware that they have PMDD can't seek the proper treatment and doctors who cannot identify it risk great harm in their patients. A continuation of absent information can lead to an increase in suicide and broken homes as well as malpractice against doctors who believe they are helping.
<ul>
• Feelings of sadness or despair, or even thoughts of suicide
• Feelings of tension or anxiety
• Panic attacks, mood swings or frequent crying
• Lasting irritability or anger that affects other people
• Lack of interest in daily activities and relationships
• Trouble thinking or focusing
• Tiredness or low energy
• Food cravings or binge eating
• Trouble sleeping
• Feeling out of control
• Physical symptoms, such as bloating, breast tenderness, headaches, and joint or muscle pain

True PMDD occurs only during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle, with relief by menstrual day 4 or by the end of menses, and most importantly there is a symptom-free period during the late follicular phase, before ovulation. Therefore, a key to diagnosing PMDD is to determine whether symptoms are consistently occurring during the luteal phase.

There is no blood test for PMDD. While other disorders can exist and exacerbate PMDD
column2:
PMDD is not a hormonal disorder nor is it a generalized mental disorder. The only way to diagnose PMDD is to track your symptoms. Then take this information to your doctor and (if needed) educate them on what PMDD is and isn't.


What We Need &

>Women need and have a right to proper medical treatment for all illnesses whether they are physical, emotional, or both in nature. This world already stigmatizes people with mental disorders. Women with mental disorders are even further marginalized.

column1: What we need is a concentrated effort to increase awareness and distribute information so women can receive the treatment they so desperately need and deserve.
Where Funds Will Go
Phase 1:
Establish the National Association for Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder as a 501(c)3
• Establishing NAPMDD as a non-profit organization will not only make future donations tax deductible, but also make NAPMDD eligible for federal grants
Phase 2:

column2:
>Invest in a print and online marketing campaign that is not backed by a pharmaceutical company

  • Print and distribute informational brochures on what PMDD is and isn't to women's health organizations and medical practices

column1: • Invest in a CPC online marketing campaign referring women to the National Association for Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder so they may have access to free information and support

column2: >Provide support and resources to women with PMDD

column1: <ul style=""font-weight: normal
• Provide hosting for http://napmdd.org as well as continued development of the website
• Continue to build online support groups so women around the world can connect with and find support for PMDD
Phase 3:
• Educate suicide prevention centers around the world on what PMDD is and isn't and how to help someone with PMDD who is considering suicide
<div><b>PMDD conference &amp
<div>
• Hold an annual PMDD Retreat where women with PMDD can connect with others as well as discuss advancements in treatment
Provider Directory
• Create an online directory of PMDD specialists around the world
The Impact of Your Contribution

column2: >Your contribution will help save the lives of millions of women around the world who have run out of options and answers for their symptoms. PMDD is very real and truly destroys the lives of the woman who has it as well as those around her.

>Together we can prevent another wrong diagnosis and perhaps a future drug addict, broken family or possible suicide. All of these risks are very real to women with PMDD.

Together we can stop all of this

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell people about PMDD and what it is and isn't
• Refer people to our campaign and let them know what it means to women's health
• Refer sufferers of PMDD and their families to http://napmdd.org for free information and support
• Educate yourself and your medical team so we can all be better treated

Referral Contest

Refer as many friends as you can and when their contributions total the following amounts you'll win the following prizes:

$250 in contributions = $25 Spa Finder Gift Card for you!

$500 in contributions = $50 Spa Finder Gift Card for you!

$1000 in contributions = $100 Spa Finder Gift Card for you!

How to Enter:
1.) Visit our IndieGoGo Campaign page at: http://igg.me/at/pmdd

2.) Use the share tools on our campaign page so we can track your referrals

3.) Once you hit your minimum contributions you'll be sent your reward*

*Only one reward per tier per person. You can bank your contributions for a larger prize or cash out when you hit the minimum.

Let us know if you have any questions! Happy referring!!!
