column1: ","What PMDD Is and Isn't

Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder is a severe mood disorder caused by a negative physiological reaction to a woman's own ovulation cycle. While only recently has PMDD been recognized by the American Psychiatric Association as a true disorder, it has been disrupting (and even some times taking) lives for generations.

This disorder is often referred to as a severe form of PMS, which is a common collection of symptoms that affect as much as 80% of menstruating women.  PMDD on the other hand affects up to 18% of women of reproductive age. Calling it a severe form of PMS only serves to fuel the stigma that women should be able to self-control their symptoms or at the very least silence them with an over the counter medication.

The truth is PMDD destroys lives. Just ask a women who has it or her partner or parents or friends. Women with PMDD lose the ability to operate in their day to day lives. They suffer emotionally and physically. Relationships are severed. Career goals are diminished. Ability to function is destroyed. Just ask a women with PMDD or her partner or her kids. PMDD is not PMS.

My Story I wasn't diagnosed with PMDD until my early 30s. It was the result of a self-diagnosis later verified by my medical team.  After the birth of my first child and upon the return my ovulation cycle, I began experiencing bouts of panic attacks, depression and suicidal thoughts. I thought I was losing my mind.
I had already been treated and cleared of postpartum depression, but my symptoms were worsening and oddly only occurring in the 12-14 days before the onset of my period.
I knew I wasn't bipolar. I hoped I wasn't going insane.

My disorder was destroying my family. Ultimately, I ended up self-committing to a psychiatric hospital after months of reoccurring symptoms. I brought with me one of the very few books written on PMDD, and used my time at the hospital to truly research my disorder. I read my book. I asked for printouts. I talked openly with doctors.

Unfortunately (and not surprisingly) my chart was noted with PMDD, but most of the staff did not know what it was. While there, I was also diagnosed as bipolar and given Lamictal, an anti-seizure medication which is sometimes used to treat bipolar mood disorders and epilepsy. I have neither.

I did start feeling better and was cleared to be sent home. Less than 24 hours back with my family I began suffering even worse than when I went in. I was convinced I was going to die. That my heart would stop. My anxiety was greater than ever before. The doctors refused to listen. Or rather, they listened, but didn't believe. They didn't believe I was giving the medication a chance. They didn't believe ""all I had was a premenstrual disorder"" and not a different, better known disorder.

See the difference is, PMDD is a specific set of symptoms that only occur during the luteal phase (the time between ovulation and menstruation). Bipolar, even though similarly cyclical, does not occur with such precision. A woman with PMDD and who knows her cycle well, can pinpoint to the day when symptoms will start and often when they will end.

Every woman deserves access to proper medical care and all women deserve access to available information as I did and continue to have. This is why I am so passionate about this cause. As the administrator to several PMDD support groups I see day after day, women joining up not knowing what they have and how to treat it. They are so often given misinformation or improper treatments that ultimately make them worse.
With the information I have sought out, my life and my family are so much better for it. Every woman deserves this.
I Call Bullsh*t

Us more ""Seasoned PMDD Sisters"", often tell the newer members that ""every case is different and you have to try several treatments to find yours"". I personally feel that is bullshit. Why should a woman have to gamble endless amounts of money and time and quality of life just to receive the proper treatment and diagnosis they deserve?
Stopping An Extreme Lack of Awareness & Information
Of the 500 women surveyed in a 2009 study, 8 out of 10 did not know that severe premenstrual
problems have been officially classified as PMDD, nor did they know that
such problems can be diagnosed and treated. Even more disturbing is
that the one in 4 respondents who described their premenstrual symptoms

as strong or severe were among those unaware of PMDD.In 2014, with the advancement of the internet (especially Facebook) more and more women are able to connect with other women with PMDD to find support and help in reaching a diagnosis. A major roadblock still exists, however, in the awareness of this disorder as well as a lack of information available. There have been several studies on PMDD, but any effort being put into distributing this information to patients and doctors has been minimal. What we need is a concentrated effort to distribute information to both groups of people, and it needs to be distributed in a way that can be universally understood.Also needed is more funding for research on what causes PMDD and how to treat it. While pharmaceutical companies are quite ready to offer treatments, it is still unknown what actually causes PMDD. How can we be effectively treating a disorder that doesn't have a consensus on what it is? There has been and are ongoing studies on the symptoms and causes of PMDD, but more research is definitely needed.Stopping Incorrect Diagnoses

Women and doctors need to know the symptoms of PMDD and how to treat it. All too often PMDD is misdiagnosed as bipolar disorder, hormonal disorder, general depression disorder, or worse. These incorrect diagnosis often lead to improper treatments and can have devastating results. Women who are unaware that they have PMDD can't seek the proper treatment and doctors who cannot identify it risk great harm in their patients. A continuation of absent information can lead to an increase in suicide and broken homes as well as malpractice against doctors who believe they are helping.
Symptoms of PMDD
Feelings of sadness or despair, or even thoughts of suicide
Feelings of tension or anxiety
Panic attacks, mood swings or frequent crying
Lasting irritability or anger that affects other people
Lack of interest in daily activities and relationships
Trouble thinking or focusing
Tiredness or low energy
Food cravings or binge eating
Trouble sleeping
Feeling out of control
Physical symptoms, such as bloating, breast tenderness, headaches, and joint or muscle pain

True PMDD occurs only during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle, with relief by menstrual day 4 or by the end of menses, and most importantly there is a symptom-free period during the late follicular phase, before ovulation. Therefore, a key to diagnosing PMDD is to determine whether symptoms are consistently occurring during the luteal phase. There is no blood test for PMDD. While other disorders can exist and exacerbate PMDD
column2: PMDD is not a hormonal disorder nor is it a generalized mental disorder. The only way to diagnose PMDD is to track your symptoms. Then take this information to your doctor and (if needed) educate them on what PMDD is and isn't.What We Need & What You Get

column1: Women need and have a right to proper medical treatment for all illnesses whether they are physical, emotional, or both in nature. This world already stigmatizes people with mental disorders. Women with mental disorders are even further marginalized.
What we need is a concentrated effort to increase awareness and distribute information so women can receive the treatment they so desperately need and deserve.
Where Funds Will Go
Phase 1:
Establish the National Association for Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder as a 501(c)3
Establishing NAPMDD as a non-profit organization will not only make future donations tax deductible, but also make NAPMDD eligible for federal grants
Phase 2:

Invest in a print and online marketing campaign that is not backed by a pharmaceutical company  Print and distribute informational brochures on what PMDD is and isn't to women's health organizations and medical practices
Invest in a CPC online marketing campaign referring women to the National Association for Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder so they may have access to free information and support
Provide support and resources to women with PMDD
Provide hosting for http://napmdd.org as well as continued development of the website
Continue to build online support groups so women around the world can connect with and find support for PMDD
Phase 3:
Suicide prevention
Educate suicide prevention centers around the world on what PMDD is and isn't and how to help someone with PMDD who is considering suicide
PMDD conference & retreat
Hold an annual PMDD Retreat where women with PMDD can connect with others as well as discuss advancements in treatment
Provider Directory
Create an online directory of PMDD specialists around the world
The Impact of Your Contribution

Your contribution will help save the lives of millions of women around the world who have run out of options and answers for their symptoms. PMDD is very real and truly destroys the lives of the woman who has it as well as those around her.

Together we can prevent another wrong diagnosis and perhaps a future drug addict, broken family or possible suicide. All of these risks are very real to women with PMDD. Together we can stop all of this with just a small contribution.
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Tell people about PMDD and what it is and isn't
Refer people to our campaign and let them know what it means to women's health
Refer sufferers of PMDD and their families to http://napmdd.org for free information and support
Educate yourself and your medical team so we can all be better treated

Visit our IndieGoGo Campaign page at: http://igg.me/at/pmdd2.) Use the share tools on our campaign page so we can track your referrals3.) Once you hit your minimum contributions you'll be sent your reward**Only one reward per tier per person. You can bank your contributions for a larger prize or cash out when you hit the minimum.Let us know if you have any questions! Happy referring!!!

This month we aim to raise $5000 to provide 200  Hope Totes to patients in 2015. Please support our efforts and help us let young adults diagnosed with cancer know how much their local community cares about them!

Being diagnosed with cancer can be terrifying, and as a young adult, it can be particularly isolating. But, Thrive Through Cancer was founded on the belief that no one should face cancer alone.

That’s why we started the Hope Tote program at Swedish Medical Center. With generous support from the local community, we provide newly diagnosed cancer patients with Hope Totes - bags filled with comforting and encouraging items to bring them joy and hope. We want them to know they are not alone. We care about their survival.  

We received the following note from the mother of this 21-year-old Swedish patient who received a Hope Tote:

""Your bag brought giant smiles to all of our faces. It was so incredibly thoughtful and filled with very generous items. My son received the bag on his very first day of chemo and I thought the timing was just perfect. He enjoyed going through all of the items...Thank you so much for bringing joy into people's lives during these ‘bumps in the road.’""

Thank you for your incredible support to our organization and young adults fighting cancer!

While Thrive Through Cancer is not exclusively affiliated with any one organization, donations will be processed through an existing 501(c)(3) non-profit Swedish Medical Center Foundation to provide Hope Totes to patients at Swedish Medical Center.

Fundraising for  . . .

BART LAB Robotics Team
World RoboCup 2014  |
Brazil
and Robotics Technology (BART LAB), Mahidol University is a collaborative
medical/engineering research center for medical robotics and computer -
integrated surgical technology with missions to conduct research and
development in robotics dedicates to medical technology, security and rescue/service. Our students and researchers
have been developing the rescue robot to participate in national and international RoboCup events
since 2005. BART LAB Robotics Team was champions for several years and
continuously awarded for instance first place at RoboCup Japan Open 2010 and 2011
etc.
As the results, World
RoboCup organizer has warmly welcomed and invited our team to participate in
the competition  in recent years and
particularly World RoboCup 2014 will be held in João Pessoa, Brazil.
We Need Your Support
column2:
>The budget included transportation and robot development is $87,000 (2,600,000Thai Baht). Our team willingly intends to be in the international arena to present the potential of  technology from the people of Thailand and to inspire the youth in the country. 

Your Support will go through the flight budget, you will fly us to the goal destination, Brazil.

All 15 members are going to participate in the competition and we will bring two Rescue Robots to participate in Rescue Robot League. We have TeleOp V (Teleoperated Robot) and AutoBot III (Autonomous Robot). 


Top:  TeleOp V, Teleoperated Robot


Bottom:AutoBot III, Autonomous Robot


The weights of TeleOp V and AutoBot III are approx. 70 kg. and 40 kg. , which require at least 7-8 people to assemble and carry them.


Potential Impacts on Thailand 

The robotics is recently introduced through medias and advertisement in Thailand, however only few groups of people are interested in it. We are a part of this journey. We have been working on robotics research and contributing our knowledges and experiences to public. We have organized the robot camps for many years to educate and encourage Thai youth in robotics technology. And this time is our great opportunity which we are qualified to participate in World RoboCup 2014 in Brazil. We would like to make this opportunity to inspire and drive the youth's thoughts in our region. Your support will be able to change their believes, minds and attitudes in their potential toward robotics.


    Gifts
column6:
>

BART LAB Robotics Team would like you to be a part of this valuable venture and would be grateful of the support to participate in Rescue Robot league in this competition. Our team would like to express our sincere thanks for your time and consideration. 

Every $10 support, we will write and send you a Thai-style Thank you card wherever you are to show how grateful we are.

Every $50 support, we will send you a World RoboCup 2014 competition of BARTLAB Robotics Team premium DVD set.

Every $100 support, we will send you a team t-shirt to show that you are a part of our team. 

  

We extremely expect your consideration to offer us the opportunity and support our team. Thank you very much x

http://www.bartlab.org

We have TeleOp V (Teleoperated Robot) and AutoBot III (Autonomous Robot). Top:  TeleOp V, Teleoperated RobotBottom:AutoBot III, Autonomous RobotThe weights of TeleOp V and AutoBot III are approx. 70 kg. and 40 kg. , which require at least 7-8 people to assemble and carry them.Potential Impacts on Thailand The robotics is recently introduced through medias and advertisement in Thailand, however only few groups of people are interested in it. We are a part of this journey. We have been working on robotics research and contributing our knowledges and experiences to public. We have organized the robot camps for many years to educate and encourage Thai youth in robotics technology. And this time is our great opportunity which we are qualified to participate in World RoboCup 2014 in Brazil. We would like to make this opportunity to inspire and drive the youth's thoughts in our region. Your support will be able to change their believes, minds and attitudes in their potential toward robotics.  GiftsBART LAB Robotics Team would like you to be a part of this valuable venture and would be grateful of the support to participate in Rescue Robot league in this competition. Our team would like to express our sincere thanks for your time and consideration. Every $10 support, we will write and send you a Thai-style Thank you card wherever you are to show how grateful we are.Every $50 support, we will send you a World RoboCup 2014 competition of BARTLAB Robotics Team premium DVD set.Every $100 support, we will send you a team t-shirt to show that you are a part of our team.   We extremely expect your consideration to offer us the opportunity and support our team. Thank you very much xhttp://www.bartlab.org",10.0,0,"1 Campaign

About Beth

Beth Lankford is a very kind, loving, and gentle soul who lives in South Carolina.  After inheriting her dad's estate, she went on a ""charity spree,"" giving away tens of thousands of dollars to people in need, locally and around the world.

Then she got the bad news that her holdings had been squandered by a Wall Street investment bank.  The bankers and and executives responsible got multi-million dollar bonuses, and Beth got left with literally nothing.  Now she's struggling with mystery illnesses that have left her unable to work or even to stand up confidently.  Her marriage has disintegrated into a battlefield, and she can't get out of it because the only access to health care she has is through her husband's insurance.

You need to understand this woman a little to grasp why I've decided to do this fundraiser.  Even in her present condition, her constant concern is for how she can help other people.  She's worried about not being able to participate in Toys for Tots this year, worried about not being able to participate in charity poker runs and other activities, worried about how to help her friends and family in need all the time.  She never, ever, EVER asks for anything for herself.  She's probably going to be angry at me for setting this fundraiser up - she's a proud, southern woman, and that comes with a whole lot of stiff neck and ""No, I'm okay, let's just worry about those people.""
She's a beautiful and wonderful soul, and she needs help whether she's willing to ask for it or not.  So I'm asking for her.

I'm not related to Beth, in fact we've never met.  I'm one of the many people she helped out a long while ago.  I'm still not on my feet, but I absolutely must try to do something to help this wonderful woman.  She has given selflessly and without any expectation, and now it's time for the generosity to flow back in her direction.  She won't even know I've set this up until contributions start hitting her PayPal account, unless she happens to see it on my Facebook page.  I'll be sending any additional contributions, if any, that end up bundled for a post-campaign payout through traditional banking back to her when they're received.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

At present, Beth's insurance through her husband is about $250 a year.  If he drops her from the insurance, as he regularly threatens to do, that cost jumps to nearly $2400 per year.  This is to say nothing of increased and new costs for transportation, food, housing, etc.  She has developed a series of health problems that her doctors have only been able to guess about over the last couple of years - some say fibromyalgia, some say it's a kind of heart disease, some say it's a recurrence of the cancer she beat a decade or so ago.

column1: Her husband has been profoundly unsupportive, even accusing her of faking her illness for attention.  He's left her increasingly ignored in favor of impressing his friends and socializing, even though she sometimes falls and can't stand up again under her own power.  That situation has deteriorated to the point that she's moved out of the house and into the home of her adult children, but they have little income themselves and are certainly in no position to help with her insurance and medical bills, let alone dedicate the one vehicle they share between the three of them to trucking her back and forth to the doctor eight or ten or fifteen times a month, to the pharmacy, etc.

Basically, my friend is being held hostage in a loveless and at least verbally and psychologically abusive marriage by poverty.  If I personally had the money, I'd happy send it to her, any amount, but I don't.  All I can do is hope this reaches enough people who want to help, and are able to do so. I've set the goal at five thousand dollars, thinking this would be enough to cover her health insurance for the year plus the costs of deductibles, co-pays, and anything else that she might need along the way.  Obviously this won't cover nearly everything she needs, but it'll sure help.
I'm not setting up any kinds of ""perks"" for this fundraiser.  The reward here is doing a good thing for a good person.  No more, and no less.

The Impact

The impact is simple:  you can extend and improve the quality of life of a beautiful and kind human being whose life has taken a hard downturn through no fault of her own.  This lady is dying.  I'd rather not see a world without her light in it any sooner than is absolutely necessary.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

There is no ""risk"" here, because nothing is being offered.  This isn't to start a business or fund a charity or patent an invention
column3: it's just to do a good thing for a good person who deserves it.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.  PLEASE.

We our continually developing and optimizing the crackpot.cube's capabilities. Currently, we are in the midst of trying to finish our app along with maintaining and improving the functionality of the cube.

That is where we need you! We have set the goal of raising a minimum of $50,000 by June 8th. The funds raised will allow us to finish the development of our app and meet the day to day needs required for maintaining such a content heavy platform. This will be a tremendous boost for our team and more importantly for our crackpot users around the world by allowing them to more easily and quickly manage their cubes via the app. In apreciation for your support, when you donate at least $1 to our campaign you will be among the first people in the world to receive your very own crackpot.cube, which you can play around and get familiar with at the conclusion of this campaign. Can't contribute? No worries, you can still help us immensely!

We're declaring war on multimedia mediocracy, one pledge at a time.

<h2>About the National Center for Missing &amp
The National Center for Missing &
column2: Exploited Children is the leading 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization working with law enforcement, families and the professionals who serve them on issues relating to missing and sexually exploited children. Authorized by Congress to serve as the nation’s clearinghouse on these issues, NCMEC operates a hotline, 1-800-THE-LOST® (1-800-843-5678), and has assisted law enforcement in the recovery of more than 191,000 children. NCMEC also operates the CyberTipline, a mechanism for reporting child pornography, child sex trafficking and other forms of child sexual exploitation. Since it was created in 1998, more than 2.1 million reports of suspected child sexual exploitation have been received, and more than 98 million suspected child pornography images have been reviewed. NCMEC works in partnership with the U.S. Department of Justice’s Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention. To learn more about NCMEC, visit www.missingkids.com. Follow NCMEC on Twitter and like NCMEC on Facebook.

column3:
Exploited Children is exempt from federal taxes under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and has received a ruling that it is a publicly supported organization as described in sections 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) of the Internal Revenue Code. All donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.

column1: 1,000 Hope Bags for 2014
Help us raise $45,000 to provide 1,000 Hope Bags to survivors of child sex trafficking.
Hope Bags provide survivors with basic items they need for those first few hours and days after they are recovered. Each Hope Bag includes items such as:
Tank top or t-shirt
Lotion
Sweat jacket or hoodie
Shampoo
Yoga pants or sweatpants
Hand sanitizer
Flip flops
Facial cleansing cloth
Toothbrush
Snacks
Toothpaste
Bottle of water
Deodorant
Journal
Comb
$10 food gift card

The National Center for Missing & Exploited Children partners with the FBI and U.S. Department of Justice to recover victims of child sex trafficking through the Innocence Lost Initiative. But, when those victims of trafficking are recovered from the control of their pimp, they often leave with only the clothes on their back.
We wanted to do more to help these children who have survived a nightmare, so we developed Hope Bags.
We stuff the bags with clothes, shoes, and toiletries. The Hope Bags are distributed by FBI agents and victim specialists in communities across the country.
NCMEC Child Sex Trafficking Team creating Hope Bags for Operation Cross Country.
Child sex trafficking is a missing child issue

We know missing children, especially those who have run away, are targeted by traffickers. One in eight endangered runaways reported to the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children in 2012 were likely sex trafficking victims.
These children are the most vulnerable. They are more likely to be manipulated by the false
promises that traffickers use to secure their trust and dependency.
Give the gift of a fresh start

Your donation provides survivors with a Hope Bag and other valuable resources to rebuild their lives. If we exceed our goal, your support will contribute towards our mission to help bring an end to child sexual exploitation and find the missing.
$5 provides all new toiletries
$10 provides snacks and a food gift card
$25 provides a fresh change of clothes and shoes
$45 provides a complete Hope Bag
Thank you.

Hi there, my name is Ashley and I'm a 24-year-old who inherited bad dental genetics from her parents. No matter how well I take care of my teeth, they keep getting worse. I brush, floss, and rinse twice a day. I do not drink soda. I simply have a lack of good, tooth-protecting bacteria in my saliva. I had a root canal when I was five and I STILL have my baby canine teeth.

Last year I had to have two teeth pulled, and this year I need an additional six. This is all on top of having periodontal disease (diagnosed 08/13/13). The treatment for perio cannot begin until the teeth needing extracted are gone. After this, I will be needing dental implants.
<h3>     I don't show my teeth when I smile, ever. This has been my most
sensitive subject and the cause of extreme self consciousness and

anxiety. I've gotten into arguments with people who try to make me smile and tease me for it. I don't want to marry my long-term boyfriend until I can smile in our wedding photos. My promotional modeling career hasn't been affected, but it doesn't exactly bring in the big bucks. My print modeling career has been halted due to the fact that I cannot smile.. attractively.

My job does not offer insurance of ANY kind. Any contribution will be applied directly to my bills. My dentist is in Indianapolis/Southport, Indiana. It costs approximately $280 per tooth extraction. I also need Novocaine/ sedation. I will be needing to take time off of work as well.

A healthy smile is as important on the outside as it is on the inside. Many medical problems can arise due to periodontal disease-- And I imagine it'd be rather difficult to chew with 3 teeth gone on the bottom-right side of my mouth. A healthy smile would.. restore all of the confidence I've lost over the years. These problems are the ONLY thing I see when I look in the mirror.
*If you cannot contribute, please take one minute out of your day to use the share tools and get the word out.*

Even if I can find a dentist SOMEWHERE that'll do the procedures at a discounted rate, or for free, I will still be in need of travel expenses and lost wages from having to take off of work.

","Hi there, my name is Ashley and I'm a 24-year-old who inherited bad dental genetics from her parents. No matter how well I take care of my teeth, they keep getting worse. I brush, floss, and rinse twice a day. I do not drink soda. I simply have a lack of good, tooth-protecting bacteria in my saliva. I had a root canal when I was five and I STILL have my baby canine teeth.

Last year I had to have two teeth pulled, and this year I need an additional six. This is all on top of having periodontal disease (diagnosed 08/13/13). The treatment for perio cannot begin until the teeth needing extracted are gone. After this, I will be needing dental implants.
I don't show my teeth when I smile, ever. This has been my most
sensitive subject and the cause of extreme self consciousness and

anxiety. I've gotten into arguments with people who try to make me smile and tease me for it. I don't want to marry my long-term boyfriend until I can smile in our wedding photos. My promotional modeling career hasn't been affected, but it doesn't exactly bring in the big bucks. My print modeling career has been halted due to the fact that I cannot smile.. attractively.

My job does not offer insurance of ANY kind. Any contribution will be applied directly to my bills. My dentist is in Indianapolis/Southport, Indiana. It costs approximately $280 per tooth extraction. I also need Novocaine/ sedation. I will be needing to take time off of work as well.

A healthy smile is as important on the outside as it is on the inside. Many medical problems can arise due to periodontal disease-- And I imagine it'd be rather difficult to chew with 3 teeth gone on the bottom-right side of my mouth. A healthy smile would.. restore all of the confidence I've lost over the years. These problems are the ONLY thing I see when I look in the mirror.
*If you cannot contribute, please take one minute out of your day to use the share tools and get the word out.*

Even if I can find a dentist SOMEWHERE that'll do the procedures at a discounted rate, or for free, I will still be in need of travel expenses and lost wages from having to take off of work.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

My name is Deborah Lestenkof, I'm a 38 year mom of four living in Anchorage, Alaska.

When I was five years old, my mother took me to get registered for kindergarten, where I had to pass a physical in order to complete registration. They found my blood pressure was extremely high, and I was rushed to the nearest Children's hospital for many tests.

The doctors simply found that my kidneys were getting worse, calling it ""chronic glomerulnephritis"", not really knowing the cause. I was put on high blood pressure medicine at the age of 5, and was told I would one day lose all function of my kidneys.

When I turned 23, two years after giving birth to my oldest son, Jesse, my kidneys completely failed. None of my family members matched my blood type, so I was put on the cadaver transplant list. I begain peritoneal dialysis and continued this for five years, until I got the call for a kidney tranplant in Seattle, Washington.

My transplanted kidney lasted 6 wonderful years until sadly they began to go into rejection. I lost my transplanted kidney and found myself back on dialysis. I've been on dialysis 4 years now, and am currently on the transplant list.

I need a transplant fund set up to cover all my travel, meals and extended stay expenses while staying in Seattle during my transplant time. While my insurance covers the surgery, it won't cover travel expenses such as airfare, meals, taxi or cab fares, etc while I'm staying in Seattle. I am raising funds so I can pay for my ticket once I get the call, as well as paying for meals, trips to the doctor, etc for the 6 weeks or so that I have to stay in Seattle.
My nephrologist that currently treats me, and has treated me for the past 18 years, is Peter Hulman at Providence Hospital, Anchorage, Alaska.
My transplant team is headed by Jessica Buck, Virginia Mason, Seattle, WA.
Thank you for your time and thoughtfulness, anything helps! God bless.

~Deb Lestenkof

Dear Friends, Acquaintances, and Strangers:
My name is Shaka Joseph, I am a self employed Body Therapist / Massage Therapist. This message is to enlist your contribution to my Knee Replacement fund.
My story
This is an individual project, but the cause is worthy of your support, and very important to me and those who depend on me in one way or other.
I am a provider of a wellness service
column2: self employed, hard working, compassionate individual who is trying hard to hold on to this status.

column1: I grew up in an industrious, workaholic environment. There was always work to do be done, before and after school. To catch a break, my siblings, cousins and friends and I used to 'runaway' for a couple hours sometimes to play by the river and in the Cocoa and rubber estates that were in our area. Off course sometimes there were consequences when we return home, especially if Ma or Pa was calling (in my case), but that was a small price to pay for the fun we had. That is how I learnt to swim, doing 'dog paddle' in the river, from one bank to the other.  The dawn to dusk work ethic, with little play time has remained with me to this day.

About 25 years ago in Trinidad and Tobago, I ‘broke’ my left leg in a motorcycle fall. The fracture split the tibia upwards into the knee joint capsule. Several  years ago two different orthopedic specialist recommended a full knee replacement. Those were words I did not want to hear from a doctor, the recommendation was totally unacceptable, however over the last year or so the degeneration of the knee joint started catching up with me, causing increasing pain, irritation and impaired mobility. Most times now I can hardly walk more than two blocks without resting. Unfortunately, the Knee replacement recommendation is now a prescription to be filled.

As a person with a job that requires standing, moving around and maneuvering people,s bodies, I cannot afford to lose the use of my leg anytime soon.  I need to do this operation, so i could continue working, providing service, and supporting myself and those who need my help.
What I do for a living

My DBA is 'Holistic Bodycare Hoboken', and I try to always provide results oriented body therapy and massage. Though I am pretty good at what I do, business has been challenging over the last 8 years or so but surviving is something to be very thankful for, and hopefully better days will return for America and me.

As a Body Therapist of almost 20 years I have worked with, and helped thousands of people to get out of pain and other forms of neuromuscular distress, even visitors who do not have my fees are welcomed
column2: over the years my practice have also helped to provide income opportunities for many individuals of all demographics, and some therapists still earn an income working in my treatment studio. All of this is seriously threatened by my medical condition, and I do need the cooperation of others to raise the funds for the ‘repairs’ and the  'parts', it’s called “Complete Knee Replacement Surgery”. Moreover, because of deformities in the joint capsule, the replacement artificial joint has to be customized, that translates into very expensive as well.

column1: My funding needs, My modest but unique offerings

The surgery and about 10-12 months of recovery time will cost an estimated $100.000. I have no health insurance. My budget cannot afford it, besides it will be regarded as a ‘pre-existing’ condition. My fundraising goal is to raise $85,000. and I need all the support possible to reach, if not surpass that goal.

The Hospital for Special Surgery in New York City is the place where I want my surgery done, Their doctors have done more knee replacement than any other hospital in America, and they manufacture the best quality hardware/parts for the replacement.  In this kind of operation one will want to reduce the chances of complications, and repeat operation as much as possible. From that point of view I think the Hospital for Special Surgery is the best choice, besides most other hospitals will charge about the same price.
There are very important ways in which family, friends acquaintances, and members of the public can support this campaign:
<ul>
• Please make a financial contribution to the fund, if you can. What ever you can afford to give counts, and will be very much appreciated.

• If you cannot contribute money but will like to help, please do. Encourage people in your circle to contribute and spread the word. Beyond your immediate circle it will be great to tell other individuals, groups and organizations you know, and ask them to support.
• Remember you can use Indiegogo Share Tools to tell others about this project and get their support.
• If you will like to do some kind of activity to help and need info., please contact us. we will be happy to assist.
All contributors, individuals, corporate and groups will be kept in the loop about the progress of the fundraiser, and will be updated about how the money is used.

We are offering some unique and useful 'Perks'. We know that most people give out of their sense of caring and generosity, and we want to show our heartfelt gratitude with the Perks can offer. I also want to thank all the companies and people who have so generously made this great pool of perks possible.
<ul>
<li>

We are giving complimentary membership to the Life Extension Foundation (Lef) and subscription to the Lef magazine, this is a cutting edge Non-profit resource organisation that is working for good health and longevity of Americans: www.lef.org
<li>

Free accommodation packages on the Almond Park Estate Beach Resort. This is nestled in the rural village of Toco, on the north eastern coast of Trinidad and Tobago. This place is ""...ideal for a family reunion or a retreat. The unspoiled landscape and undulating hills invite you to relax and get away from the stress and tensions of life in America: www.jammevbeachresorts.com
<li>
For donors in the New York, New Jersey areas we are giving A+ quality massage sessions: www.massage-facials.com
<li>

The Miracle Cloth. This very useful cloth will be part of one of our gift packages. This awesome cloth is very well known as the 'magic shammy', and in my situation it symbolizes the miracle that I am hoping for in this project.
<li>
Shaka's Certificate of Gratitude (CG), and posting of your name and photo (If you consent) on the 'Wall of Gratitude', on his massage website.
• Other Perks may be announced in the course of the campaign.
<li>

Hey guys, Save Money and Go Green with your elcetricity and Gas supplier. This is my biggest perks of all. For no more than your donation to this fund, We will hook you up to save money on your Electricity and gas bill, as well as give you real Green choices in your energy consumption, for the rest of your life. And you don't have to change your utility company. Available only in NJ, CT, NY, NJ, MA, MD, DE, PA, IL, DE . The process is simple and can be done online 5 days after your donation is made. This Perk is for Electricity and Gas bills only. For more info visit http://www.viridian.com/josephflynn/default.aspx or contact me.
If I did not reach my funding goal...

I really hope that this project will realize it's funding goal on this platform. However if I did not raise the full amount, the funds raised here will be secured and I will continue the effort until I can afford to do the operation. Infact, a special restricted account is already opened at TD Bank in the Hoboken NJ branch, where the funds will be lodged until the surgery is done.
Thank you all very much, for caring and helping!

My name is Casey Cole and I am a retired USMC Veteran diasgnosed in 2012 with stage 4 metastatic Pancreatic Cancer and was told that it was far enough advanced that chemo or radiation therapy would be pretty much useless and was referred to Hospice. I am not a quitter, so started searching for alternative treatments. I began using Rick Simpson Oil, glyco-nutrients and other supplements as well as dietary changes, exercise (when I am able) and lifestyle changes. I also run a Cannabis news page on facebook, Casey Cole's Cannabis News where I have posted literally over a thousand Cannabis studies sorted by disease.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

I am looking for $10,000 in funding to cover the costs of the supplements which have kept me alive to this point as well as equipment necessary for the dietary changes such as a juicer, blender etc. Also, due to the severe backlog of disability cases at the VA, I will be using some of the funding to cover living expenses as I am unable to work at this time. My treatment costs are currently approximately $1,400.00 per month with as much as $100 per month variance. Monthly living expenses are $1000.00 including food and utilities.
<div>
The Impact

The regimens I am following are set forth by several renowned Doctors including, but not limited to, Dr. Bob Melamede, Dr. Sircus, Dr. William Courtney, and several others as well as from the research of Mr. Michael West of Glycop co-op. My markers are down greatly and I am feeling healthier in general, but the money is gone and I need your help to continue on to victory over this ""untreatable"" Cancer. My regimen, test results and care will be published and each contributor will receive a copy of the book when completed.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times are hard right now and that not everyone who reads this can contribute and that's ok because you can still help by sharing this campaign using the indiegogo sharing tools, telling your friends and family about it and sharing it on your social media pages. Thank you for taking the time to read this.

There are presently more than 500.000 survivors of oral head and neck cancers living in the United States today.  In addition, 58,000 people living in the United States will be diagnosed with this disease this year.  Not only can a diagnosis of oral head and neck cancer be life-threatening, but many patients as a result of the disease and its treatment, must also endure alterations in facial and neck apperance as well as alterations in speech, sight, smell, chewing, swallowing and taste perception

Whereas other types of cancer can be hidden by clothing, cancer of the head and neck cannot.  Many people suffering from oral head and neck cancer and the side effects of treatment may find it difficult to return to their previous jobs and/or ""normal"" daily living.
Coping with this type of cancer can be extremely difficult.
Your donation will go to SPOHNC to provide paitents and caregivers:
<ul>
• Local chapter support groups - over 100 nationwide
• National Survivor Volunteer Network
• Extensive sources of information including news on available clinical trials
• We Have Walked in Your Shoes - a Guide to Oral Head and Neck Cancer, a free publication
<li>
Receipe and Resource Guide - nutrution and eating can be very difficult for those who have this disease

As a 5 year survivor I can tell you SPOHNC was a godsend, not only to me but to my wife, Linda, who as my caregiver endured as much if not more that I did.  We both are part of the National Survivor Volunteer Network, in a small attempt to give back.
Please contribute what you can - your reward is knowing that you have really helped those are going through very difficult times.
Thank you!

Denvo Health Care was formed in 2007 and is incorporated in the State of California as a community-based 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation. It is headquartered in the South Los Angeles community of Compton, CA. It draws patients from all over Los Angeles County, but principally provides services to SPA 6 and its Compton Health District. This geographic region is home to 288,097 individuals. It has the distinction of having lowest ratio of community outpatient services, hospital beds and urgent care facilities in all LA County.

Concerned about a lack of physicians in the area, a group of community physicians based in Compton and Lynwood CA came together in 1988 to work with the school district to address the critical lack of services and poor immunization rates among school children in the Compton and South Los Angeles area. This group of physicians has been serving the uninsured for the last 30 years and has collectively treated over 35,000 uninsured residents. The immunization rates have improved dramatically, however, this region still suffers from a severe lack of health services. In early 2007, after the closure of MLK county hospital, the physicians saw a spike in patients with unmet preventive, primary and critical needs – associated with a loss of providers in the area.

Upon retirement of several of their peers, the remaining physicians became concerned that a community response be developed to address the critical lack of need – one that would have life beyond the life-cycle of a few remaining community physicians. De Novo Health Care was formed along with a Community Clinic Advisory Board (AB) in 2007 that met to assess the health care needs and then develop a plan to address the critical lack of services.
<h3 class=""p3""><strong>What We Need &amp

De Novo has expanded into the community and now has two operational clinics in the area. The funding received from this campaign will go directly into our clinic. The money will be used to purchase and maintain the office equipment, building infrastructure and medical supplies. We are also hiring a professional grant writer to help us apply for other medical grants.  De Novo is a non-profit clinic so every donation will include a tax deduction. With every donation of $15 or more you will have your name placed on our website in special thanks.
Other Ways You Can Help
<div>

If you aren't in a position to support us financially at this time. Another way to help is by spreading the word by using the share tools here on IndieGoGo. Join, share tweet us. Direct others who might be able to get involved back to this IndieGoGo page. Anything and everything helps!
Thank you, so much.
www.dnhcc.com

We are also hiring a professional grant writer to help us apply for other medical grants.  De Novo is a non-profit clinic so every donation will include a tax deduction. With every donation of $15 or more you will have your name placed on our website in special thanks.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to support us financially at this time. Another way to help is by spreading the word by using the share tools here on IndieGoGo. Join, share tweet us. Direct others who might be able to get involved back to this IndieGoGo page. Anything and everything helps!
Thank you, so much.
www.dnhcc.com",3.0,0,"1 Campaign

Support David's battle and Kill Cancer With Kindness!
Our friend David Churchill is fighting cancer. And it’s freaking expensive.
We are raising funds for David's treatments and have set a starting goal of $2500. Our hope is to raise more than this and to give David as much as we possibly can.
Though cancer has invaded, with your help Churchill can have the best chance for victory and carry on with that vim and vigour we all love.
Donate whatever you can. Any amount is appreciated. We've added some imaginary perks to make it easy for you to select a funding level.

To celebrate reaching our goal, we’re having a cabaret of music, poetry, performance and laughter! Join David and all of his supporters for some entertainment and morale boosting! Please note that we are NOT selling tickets to the cabaret. If you would like to attend the event, simply RSVP to FriendsofDavidChurchill@gmail.com. Space is limited so RSVP as soon as possible. If we reach our capacity, you will receive a message explaining this.

Date: Sunday, February 24, 2013
Venue: 3030
Address: 3030 Dundas Street West
Time: 4 – 8pm
Cash Bar. Bar menu available. Seating is limited.
Performances by…
<ul>
<li>
The Hackits (sonic onslaught of rock goodness)
<li>
Sister Mary Elephant (classic rock cover band)
<li>
Cale Sampson (socially conscious hip hop)
<li>
Julian Sark (narrative pop music)
<li>
Teige Reid (character performance piece)
<li>
Serena McArter (honey bunches of odes)
<li>
Mike Shnall (stand-up comedy)
<li>
Liam Doherty (evening's MC, who defies description)
Please note: Some of the performances are not suitable for children.
A little about David...

David has been a professional writer for over 30 years. As a freelance writer, he has worked as a film critic for numerous publications, including The Toronto Star Video Magazine, Now Weekly and Cinema Canada. He also wrote about the business of film for Strategy Magazine and The Hollywood Reporter and was the Canadian correspondent for 15 years for the US-based magazine Location Update/P3 Update. He has written about poetry competitions, archaeology and architecture for other publications. He has also written two screenplays, one of which, The Sleeping Dog, received development money from Astral Media’s The Harold Greenberg Fund. He currently writes feature and informational copy for VINTAGES, the fine wine and spirits division of the LCBO. His first novel The Empire of Death (2010) is available at wordplaysalon.com. He is at work on his second novel, The Storm and Its Eye. David is also a co-founder of and contributing writer to a popular culture criticism blog, Critics At Large. It can be found at criticsatlarge.ca. He lives north of Toronto with his wife, Rossana (Rose).

<div>
Short Summary

Hey Everyone! My name is Jeremy, and my wife Monica and I just received some awesome news.... WE'RE PREGNANT!! Wait, it gets even better. We're pregnant with TWINS! This is HUGE for us. We both had our doubts if we ever would get pregnant, and Monica never thought she would hear those two words ""You're Pregnant."" Let me explain...

First let me tell you a little about us. Monica and I have been married a little over 3 years. Monica truly is my dream girl! I love her more than anything and desire to give her the best life I possibly can. Choosing to marry me was a big decision in Monica's life (and not just because of my personality, lol). I have a terminal, genetic disease called Cystic Fibrosis, or CF for short.
Here's a link to learn more about CF. http://www.cff.org/AboutCF/

CF is a genetic disease that causes the mucous in your body to be extra thick and sticky. It primarily affects the lungs and digestive system. The primary complication associated with CF is chronic lung infections. The mucous also causes problems in the reproductive organs. 98% of males with CF lack the ""plumbing"" necessary to get the ""swimmers"" out of their system. Thus the only way to have children of our own is through in vitro fertilization.
Here's a link explaining in vitro in more detail. http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/007279.htm

As I mentioned, CF is a terminal illness. There are a lot of great medicines and therapies to treat the symptoms but no cure. I usually require a ""tune-up"" every year or so. No, I don't get new spark plugs and fresh oil. A ""tune-up"" is when people with CF spend 2-3 weeks in the hospital, taking antibiotics through an IV. This is why I say it was a big deal for her to marry me. She knew that for the rest of my life I will be battling CF to stay healthy and she could lose me early on in life. That is a lot of baggage. When we got engaged, I told myself ""If she loves you enough to marry you despite your CF, you better be the best husband ever. Spoil her like crazy and give her the best life you can!"" That is my goal. That is why I need your help.

Our IVF process cost a little over $17,000. I have been hospitalized 3 times in the past year and a half and therefore have had to double the amount of treatments and therapy I do, which has doubled the amount of money we spend on meds. We have been doing Dave Ramsey's Total Money Makeover for the past 2 and a half years. We have paid off around $21,000 in debt. Most of that was our 4 school loans, our cars, and less than $1,000 on credit cards. Our combined take home pay is around $50,000 a year. I say all this to let you know that A) we are not wealthy and being greedy, and B) we are very financially responsible. I would want to know how someone was going to use the money I gave them, and whether they are financially responsible before donating. That is why I offer you that information. We currently owe $8,985.24 for our IVF bills.

I want my wife to have as ""normal"" a life as possible despite my CF. It will never be completely normal obviously, but I try. I don't like the financial strain that my CF puts on my family. That's the purpose of this campaign, and that's where you come in!

My goal for this campaign is to pay off our IVF debt before the babies arrive! Nothing more. I'm not looking to make a fortune and live lavishly off whatever we make from this campaign. Having babies produces it's own financial difficulties, but those we will deal with on our own like everyone else in the world.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We need $8,985.24 to pay off our IVF debt. All the money we have given to us will go towards our IVF debt. Monica has already been putting money aside for years preparing for this by making and selling her custom cakes. Her site is http://cakesbymonicap.blogspot.com. When we say it will ALL go towards IVF, we mean it. Every pennie we have made off of her cakes went into a savings account at a seperate bank for our ""baby fund!""

As I mentioned earlier, we are smart with our money. We both drive cars that were made in the year 2000 and are paid off. We live in a 1,000 sq ft home. We don't live beyond our means. We have sacrificed, and done everything we can to pay our debt down before going through IVF. In an ideal world, we would have saved all the money prior to starting IVF. My PFT's (lung function tests) have started to decline at a slightly steeper pace over the last couple years. We decided we should go through the process now, so I will get to spend that much more time with our kids. Living with CF has taught me that time is very precious!
<div>
The Impact

By helping us out in any way possible, you are helping me give my wife (and now my twin babies) the best life I can possibly give them. I never ask for help. I'm pretty stubborn and want to be as self-sufficient as possible. It takes a lot for me to ask for someone's help. Even when offered I often turn it away. I used to anyway, when it only affected me. Now I'm responsible for my family, so I guess I have to swallow my pride! :)

I would like to be able to give my kids a good life. I may only live to see 40, or I may live to see 60. The median life expectancy for someone with CF is the early 30's, so I'm doing pretty good right now. My doctors say I should see 50, given no catastrophic events occur with my health. Either way, I want my family to be taken care of financially whenever it is that I go. This campaign, along with Monica and I's hard work, will help me make these things possible.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that the holidays are right around the corner. I don't want this campaign to be the reason anyone has ""less"" of a Christmas or any other holiday. I also realize times have been tough. If you are unable to help support our campaign financially there's still something you can do to help. MAKE SOME NOISE!

Get loud about our campaign with us. Spread the word to your family, friends, co-workers, anyone you can think of! Indigogo has a lot of really cool sharing tools. Any help you can give us will mean the world to me, to Monica, and to our unborn twins!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this! I hope you enjoy all the videos and updates we will be posting throughout the pregnancy! I hope you will all continue to follow us on facebook, and our blog about our wonderful life together that happens to include Cystic Fibrosis at http://jeremyparks.blogspot.com

ITALIAN VERSION UNDER

Hi guys, I’m
Roberto Eduardo Maria Mazzarago. I am an artist from Bari,

Italy.

OUR FOCUS:

Create a public orchard.

Simple!
It's an adoption. For every euros you want to give to my campaign I will plant a seed and I will
give a name to the tree will born from that seed, your name! You adopt, we plant!
1 euro= 1
seed.

3 euros= 3 seeds.
5 euros= 5 seeds.

I want...
...to plant only fruit trees: Lemon trees, Orange trees, Apple trees, Cherry

trees, Apricot trees and other trees can be grow in the region of Italy I live, Puglia.
...to plant in a public field because tomorrow everyone can eat the fruit

of these trees.
I give...
...for every tree you want to plant I send you (by e-mail) an ADOPTION CARD like

this:


And every year I sent to you a BIRTHDAY CARD like this:
Hi Mr. Williams, your tree has one year old now! he grows healthy and strong. For his birthday we gave him a bigger pot. Will soon be ready to be planted in a field along with many other fruit trees.
I dream...

...to create a public garden with a lot of fruit trees and every people can eat from those.
Although I have set a goal very low I hope this campaign will be successful and considerably exceeds the goals that I set.
So if we are successful, with the money raised from this campaign I hope to buy a plot in which to create the garden of fruit trees!
With this campaign I hope to buy a field to create that public garden!If the campaign did not exceed the goals set, the trees will be planted in public places already exist.

500€=500 trees? no! five hundred trees are really a lot of trees, so for now we thought we would stop at fifty but all the found raised from fiftieth euros to (infinite) will be used to create a public garden in which to plant the
column2:
>adopted trees and let them grow. I hope we will be successful, in order to buy a plot of land large enough to hold more than fifty trees.
If we do not succeed? the funds raised will be used to buy the materials needed to the growth of the trees: soil, pots, fertilizers, small irrigation systems, etc.
If we fail to buy land, when the trees are big enough they will be planted in public places accessible to all.

column1: So, let’s start to plant trees!!
PLEASE SHARE!:D:D

Hope you understand everything, I know my English is not perfect!
If you see any mistakes please let me know by email.
Thank you
Italian version
Ciao, mi chiamo Roberto Eduardo Maria Mazzarago e sono un artista. Vivo in Puglia, più precisamente in provincia di Bari.

IL NOSTRO OBIETTIVO:
Creare un frutteto pubblico.

Semplice!

Si tratta di un'adozione. Per ogni euro donato alla mia causa pianterò un seme a cui, una volta nato l'albero, darò un nome...il tuo nome! Tu adotti, io pianto!

column3:
/>

1 euro= 1 seme.
3 euro= 3 semi.
5 euro= 5 semi.

Voglio...
...piantare solo alberi da frutto: limoni, aranci, mele, ciliegie, albicocche, insomma tutti quegli alberi che si adattano bene al clima della Puglia.
...piantare in un luogo pubblico perchè desidero che domani tutti possano mangiare i frutti degli alberi piantati.

Darò...
...per ogni albero adotatto ti invierò tramite e-mail una scheda di adozione come questa:

column1: e ogni anno un biglietto di auguri che ti aggiorni sulla crescita del tuo albero, come questo:

Hi Mr. Williams, your tree has one year old now! he grows healthy and strong. For his birthday we gave him a bigger pot. Will soon be ready to be planted in a field along with many other fruit trees.

Sogno...
...di creare un giardino pubblico dove chiunque possa raccogliere senza preoccupazioni
column2: >i frutti degli alberi piantati con il vostro aiuto.
column3: >Nonostante abbia impostato un goal molto basso nutro la speranza che questa campagna abbia successo e superi di molto gli obiettivi che mi sono prefisso.
column4: >Quindi se avremo successo, con i soldi raccolti da questa campagna spero di poter acquistare un terreno dove poter far nascere quel giardino pubblico di alberi da frutto. Differentemente gli alberi verranno piantati in luoghi pubblici già esistenti.

column1:
500€=500 alberi? no, 500 sono davvero tanti alberi! abbiamo pensato quindi di fermarci a 50 esemplari ma tutti i fondi raccolti dal cinquantesimo euro fino al (beh, infinito...speriamo tanti!) verranno utilizzati per creare il frutteto pubblico dove piantare e far crescere gli alberi adottati. Se avremo successo potremo acquistare un terreno abbastanza grande da poter accogliere molti più che cinquanta alberi.
Se se non dovessimo riuscirci? i fondi raccolti verranno utilizzati per acquistare i materiali che servono alla crescita degli alberi: terra, vasi, concimi, piccoli sistemi di irrigazione ecc.
Se non riusciremo ad acquistare un terreno, quando gli alberi saranno abbastanza grandi verranno piantati in luoghi pubblici accessibili a tutti.
Che aspettiamo? piantiamo alberi!!!

>Created by women for women

The Kinflyte Freedom Essentials Capsule is a 3-piece set that includes a wire-free bra, bra-replacement top, and hi-rise underwear. The trio of stunning essentials has a patent-pending system of hidden compression that promotes improved body alignment and provides posture support for the bust, shoulders, and back. It works with your body to help improve alignment.

With over 18 innovative features, Kinflyte’s posture wear design has created modern essentials every woman should own.
column4:
>
 

The proprietary patent-pending design creates a support structure, applying cushioned compression to the shoulders and back, while wirelessly supporting the weight of breasts, promoting improved posture. Using the latest in technical performance knits, Kinflyte essentials are incredibly soft against the skin, comfortable, and breathable.
column8:
>

The Freedom Essentials Capsule enables free range of movement and promotes a better stance. All three pieces are designed to fit the contours of your body like second skin. By combining the beauty of intimates with the durability of performance-wear, this 3-piece set fits and supports your body smoothly and comfortably.
column11:
>

Our wire-free Freedom Bra gives you free range of movement while promoting better posture. Thoughtfully designed with cushioned compression around the bust, back, and shoulders, the Freedom Bra provides magic comfort. It's a bra that stays on and doesn't ride up.

Versatile, so you can wear it under a top, dress, or go solo. Moisture-wicking and antimicrobial, wear the Freedom Bra with confidence day or night. A stash pocket is there when you need it.

column1: • Cushioned compression lifts and elevates the bust, shoulders, and back.
• Inserts with removable bra pads for options to shape and enhance.
• Ready-to-wear aesthetics with gold accent details.
• Wider shoulder bands takes pressure off your shoulder blades.
• Moisture-wicking and anti-odor to support your active lifestyle.
• Antimicrobial with UPF50 UV protection, perfect for travel.
• Machine washable. Wash cold, gentle cycle and air dry.
• Hidden stash pocket for when you need it.
• Tagless care label so no irritation from tags.

column3:
>

Our Unity V-Top is a bra-replacement top that makes an amazing solo experience. Just like the Freedom Bra, it is wireless and gives you free range of movement while promoting better posture. Designed with cushioned compression and minimal visible seams, the Unite V-Top supports an elegant silhouette.
column4:
>

Pair with jeans, trousers, or your favorite skirt. The V neckline makes this an especially versatile top. A concealed zippered pocket is the perfect place to stash credit card, cash, or keys. Sleeves are invisibly lined to provide postural support. Cushioned compression design gently lifts shoulders, back and bust.

column5:
>

Kinflyte essentials are ideal for women who:

column1: • want to feel sensual, beautiful, and self-assured
• struggle with chronic back pain
• worry about poor posture
• spend 40+ hours in an office environment
• feel uncomfortable in their bra
• want a smooth, svelte look
• live an active lifestyle, great for fitness activities
• are mothers and soon-to-be mothers
• prefer traveling with versatile pieces
• looking for alternatives to mastectomy bras

column7: >
column8:
>

Indiegogo is a “crowdfunding” platform where you support the new products of entrepreneurs by pre-ordering them at a deep discount for later shipment. For all our backers, closer to the ship date, we will send you an email to re-confirm your order details, so you'll be able to modify size and shipping address.
column10:
>

Most women have worn bras and tops that are too big, too tight, or provide inadequate support. Repeating daily routines in an ill-fitting bra lead to discomfort, bad posture and anxiety. Committing to a poorly fitted bra each day can lead to back and neck strain, rounded shoulders, tension headaches, poor digestion, and limited range of movement.
 
Women are in need of a solution to look and feel their best in all types of clothing at various occasions. They need supportive intimates that allow them to work, play and lounge around comfortably. Whether it’s a bra, underwear or even a top, women deserve to wear functional, supportive clothes that make her feel feminine, strong and beautiful. Women shouldn't have to sacrifice style for comfort.

We’re bringing you a collection of bras and intimates that helps improve alignment by working effortlessly with your body, not with straps, seams or thick materials that tug against it. Women are in need of sensual, posture-supportive essentials that meet the requirements of a beautiful, inspiring, hard working woman’s agenda.

column1: <div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/GFeHYvCx6u0?autohide=1&amp

column3: >
column4: >
column6: source=webclient"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">
column7: >
column8:
>

The size guides translate for your everyday bra, top, and underwear. Bust sizes for the bra-top (Unity V-Top) are based on the fullest part of your bust. Our technical knits have four-way stretch for better fit and soft comfort. Our apparel stretches with you and retain its shape.
column19: >
column22: >
column33:
>

As a working mother, I understand the challenge of finding supportive intimates and activewear that allow me to work, play and lounge around comfortably. I wanted to create everyday essentials that would make women feel feminine, strong and beautiful, without sacrificing style for comfort.

My understanding of women’s intimate apparel concerns combined with my background in product marketing for award-winning consumer products gave me the confidence and skill set to develop the solution. I sought the help of Diane Lee
column35: former senior designer for The North Face, and Elizabeth LeMay
column36: former Nike innovation executive. Together, we researched, designed, developed and extensively tested prototypes to create the perfect collection of posture-supportive essentials.
column40:
> 

Retro-Future Inspired Designs

Inspired by my Korean heritage and love of art deco, Kinflyte has an East-meets-West aesthetic. Design influences included a 1,600-year old Korean hanbok dress and art deco fashion. The retro-future elements are a nod to films like Blade Runner, Fifth Element, and Fritz Lang's Metropolis.
column41:
>

Kinflyte is about women who strive every day. We're a kinship of makers, artists, designers, writers, technologists, explorers, and badass mothers.

Our Mission

Kinflyte supports women who strive each day and designs apparel that help every body move better.

We have invested in the latest technical fabrics to support our mission, and everything we design is purpose-built.
column44:
>Founder + Co-Inventor

Vivian Lee loves tackling problems and creating solutions in every industry she's been a part of - consumer tech (interactive cameras, Android smartphones), video games (Electronic Arts), and now women's apparel. She was an Innovation Award finalist, recognized by Women in IT Silicon Valley. Viv led the overall concept, development, patent, and design for Kinflyte.

The idea for Kinflyte was inspired by her own challenges as a working mom. Raising kids, working in tech, and commuting long hours presented a real problem for her back, neck and shoulders. A year in the making, Vivian has been inspired by all the women she has come across in the development process. She has held multiple fit sessions with women in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Chicago and Portland to iterate and improve the designs. And, she has consulted with women wellness professionals in physical therapy, pilates, yoga, dance, martial arts, and athletic training.

One Saturday afternoon, we were in Berkeley and saw a woman and her son selling cupcakes and cookies on the sidewalk. The woman's name was Lavern and she was having a bake sale to raise money for a kidney transplant. Selling cupcakes -- for a kidney transplant! We couldn't believe it. Her medication costs for the first year alone will be $9,000.
Let's help Lavern so she can stop having bake sales and get her life back.
Lavern's Story

Lavern has polycystic kidney disease, a hereditary condition that causes numerous cysts to develop in the kidneys. About a year and a half ago, her kidneys failed and she has been on dialysis treatment ever since. She stopped working full-time as a first grade teacher and now spends 2 days a week at a clinic getting dialysis. Her cysts are growing and multiplying, and she needs to get a kidney transplant as soon as possible. The Stanford Hospital has identified a donor for Lavern and is ready to perform her operation.
The problem: Lavern cannot afford it.

She has health insurance through Blue Shield, but her PPO plan only partially covers the procedure and does not cover prescription drugs. The anti-rejection medication she must take after the transplant will cost her $9,000 in the first year. With procedure costs, medication costs, and copays, the hospital told Lavern that all together the transplant will cost her about $21,900 out of pocket.
The Bake Sale

Every Saturday and Sunday, as long as it's not raining (and she feels well enough), Lavern drives 80 miles from Stockton to Berkeley to sell cupcakes, cookies, and brownies on the sidewalk to raise money for her transplant. Her 12-year-old son Marquis goes with her. This basically consumes 3 days of her life every week. She spends all of Friday baking, then all of Saturday and Sunday driving and sitting at her bake sale table. She is able to raise $300-600 every weekend this way.

Of course, these 3 days are in addition to the 2 days she already spends getting dialysis each week. This ordeal has pretty much taken over Lavern's life. It leaves her little time to care for her two sons, be with family and friends, and simply enjoy her life.
<div>
Help Lavern Get Her Life Back
This is no way for someone to live. Having to sell cupcakes for a kidney transplant is just not okay. Surely, there must be another way for Lavern to get this operation to save her life.
We want to help Lavern, and we hope you do too.

By raising $9,000, we will cover Lavern's medication costs for the first year. Without anti-rejection medication the transplant will fail as her body will not accept the new kidney. For the operation to move forward, it is critical that these costs are covered.
However, we hope we can go even beyond the $9,000 goal. Since the total cost of the transplant will be about $21,900, any funds raised above $9,000 will certainly mean a great deal to Lavern.
Thank you for reading about Lavern's story. If we all pitch in together, we can make a difference in her life.

Short Summary

I speak for Addy, who is my niece.  Addy is disabled, but still the most beautiful 5 year old you will ever meet.  She may never be able to talk or walk, but she will always make you smile.  She has a disease so rare that even after 100's of tests, doctors &amp
column2: medical professionals are unable to determine what is wrong with Addy.  Even with the strength of a family of medical professionals (I am a paramedic, &amp
column3: my wife an emergency room nurse), Addy's condition remains a mystery.  Because of a lack of a diagnosis, Addy is not eligible to receive assistance for a wheelchair lift for the family van so she can get to her medical appointments, as well as to the hospital to continue to allow testing to continue to help find what causes this rare condition so she can continue to help other children down the road.  While the family (my sister-in-law) is very humble, &amp
column4: not asking for assistance, myself and my wife are trying to help, because it is not fair to Addy &amp
column5:
her family that they are slipping through the cracks of government.

My only mission is to help Addy get her Wheelchair lift so she can continue to get to the doctors, and make a difference for future children!  Thank you for your support!  Any extra money collected will be passed on to a another needy child, all we are trying to do is collect enough to help our Addy get her wheelchair lift.

column1: Check out our short video on Addy: http://www.photoshow.com/watch/mv9sF5IT
<div style=""margin-left: 90px
Visit our website at www.AddyToTheSky.Weebly.com

Mission
To extend the love of Jesus Christ through offerings of quality healthcare to increase the physical, emotional and spiritual well-being of all our customers.
Business Model

The Lost and Found companies were conceived to reestablish what has been lost from pharmaceutical care in recent decades - high quality service, compassionate support of those with financial need, and the personal touch of knowledgeable pharmacists who are also neighbors of their customers. The Lost and Found Pharmacy will revive the soda fountain culture of the past, where visitors are drawn into a comfortable and friendly environment and treated like part of the family.
Two incorporated Lost and Found entities have been created to function as a harmonious whole:
<ol>
<li>The pharmacy is an independent non-profit 501(c)(3) charitable organization
• The soda fountain is a proprietary retail business with profits funneled toward the Pharmacy's mission.
Together, the Lost and Found corporations will be dedicated to the whole health of their patrons.
The Pharmacy

column2: title=""Pharmacy""/>With a rapidly aging regional population, the need for healthcare products and services is ever increasing. The Lost and Found Pharmacy will offer the same prescription drugs and pharmaceutical products as the for-profit retail pharmacies, but with several notable and charitable differences, e.g. lower costs to the consumer and assistance for Medicare gap customers.

column1: Key services include: benevolent care to uninsured or Medicare “gap” patients, individualized counseling, comprehensive informational sessions, and assistance with the completion of insurance forms.
The Soda Fountain

column2: title=""LAF Soda Fountain""/>In today's fast-paced society the iconic soda fountain, along with the happy ambiance that surrounded it has been lost.

column1: Located within the pharmacy – just as it was in the old neighborhood “drug store”, the Lost and Found Soda Fountain will provide unique refreshments at its authentic 1924 fountain and serpentine countertop. Ice cream sodas, root beer floats, cherry Cokes, and old-fashioned candies will be the traditional offerings. Additional products will include over the counter medications and common necessities. Soda fountain services will also include a listening ear, encouragement, comfort and support.
The Road to Sustainability

Part of the price of each filled prescription will be used to support the Pharmacy's overhead costs. In addition, proceeds from the Soda Fountain will help support the cost of providing prescription services to needy individuals. Other sources of support for the startup, operation, and charitable services of Lost and Found include regional churches, corporations, foundations and individuals. Your gift can help thousands of people - particularly seniors - in the Pittsburgh area and beyond obtain the medicines and personal care they need. Any funds received exceeding the start-up goal will go directly to the Lost and Found Medicare Gap Financial Assistance Program.

Bringing awareness to Mental Health can save someone’s life.
My name is Vishal and I have suffered from Mental Illness.

For the longest time, I thought being depressed was a sign of weakness. Luckily, I had a great support network composed of my family and two close friends of mine who never once brought me down. Instead, they were always there for me by lending an ear and supporting me through my illness. Though I was fortunate enough to have a support network, some may not and that is the reason why I have chosen to do this.
The NHL has recently promoted Hockey Talks this month and it has given me the idea to help show awareness to this topic.
I want to raise at least $5000, which will go to creating a billboard here in the South Okanagan showing awareness and hopefully reducing the stigma associated with Mental Health.
I know there are individuals who have suffered through mental illness alone and they were, and still are, too scared to seek out help.
Mental Illness is an issue that affects many. Understanding the need to reduce the stigma when it comes to mental illness is the first step in becoming a support network for those affected.

Please help show awareness to this cause.
