Hi, I'm Josh Powers and I just graduated from the Colorado Media School. I'm also a composer, musician and performer of many years, a circuit bender and an visual artist.  I've got a dilemma with my teeth and it seems at this point I have little choice but to ask you for help. 

It all started a few months ago with about a week of extremely inflamed and sore gums. It was determined that I had multiple issues. A gum disease situation in advanced stages that requires the extraction of 4 of my bottom front teeth and bad tooth that needed a root canal.

Due to my immune disorder, (I suffer from Common Variable Immuno-Deficiency) this situation became urgent very quickly. My teeth became more loose and the gum disease spread to my upper teeth in the time it took to simply get the root canal done. It has been causing me a lot of pain and discomfort. Meanwhile my insurance refused to pay for the lower partial that would replace my front teeth. The dentist had to appeal 3 times which took about 2 months.

Even though most of the current procedure has finally been payed for, I still have to come out of pocket for the Periodontist consultation ($100) Extractions ($400) fillings ($200) which had to be done recently as cavities not previously seen were in the way of the partial, a deep cleaning required by a periodontist ($1,000) and the newest development which is the now advancing gum disease in my upper front teeth which, if they determine I need laser treatment, may end up costing me thousands of dollars.

Because this has become my #1 priority and I have taken on several new visits unexpectedly, the issue has entirely eaten my travel budget for SXSW, which is actually work for me because I am one of the main organizers for an event down there which requires me to attend. The other organizers are depending on my commitment to be there. Not only has it destroyed that budget but the situation is now even requiring me to spend money I do not have (like rent) putting me in a significantly deep hole.

The amount that I have outlined is to merely get me back to square one where I can at least pay for what's currently going on and what I have to pay for in the immediate future. It is a modest amount compared to what I may incur in the near future if I end up needing laser treatment on my gums.

Thank you so much in advance, I hope that the ""perks"" I have outlined are an adequate consolation for your help.

- Josh Powers

<div> <h3>Help Us Raise Awareness &amp
column2:
End Sexual Assault

Did you know that 1 in 6 women are sexually assaulted in their lifetime?

column1: Together, we are going to change this. April is Sexual Assault Awareness Month (SAAM). Help us to raise awareness about a serious issue. If we meet our financial goal, then we will host a major charity event for SafePlace.
Throughout April, we will:
<ul>
• Publish a social media campaign using the hashtag #GoTeal.
<li>Raise awareness of the unseen &amp
column2:
often unreported issue of sexual assault.
  • Encourage others to share their stories using the hashtag #GoTeal.
  • Encourage women that are experiencing or have survived sexual assault to get help.

column1: <li>
Raise funds for SafePlace.
If we are able to hit our goal, we will:
<div><ul>
• Host a major charity event for SafePlace.
• Publicize the event for an entire month.
• Invite the press as well as some of our city's most influential people.
• Have a guest speaker.
• Host a photobooth.
• Sell raffle tickets.
• Have VIP meet and greet session with our models.
• And ensure that we are able to raise a sizable donation for SafePlace.
Sexual assault effects the lives of our mothers &
column4: sons, and our partners. Our loved ones will continue to suffer until we put an end to sexual assault.
column8: >Help us end sexual assault on campuses, in homes, and across the United States by participating in our campaign.

column1: What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We need your help to get the word out. The money we raise for this campaign will go toward:

column1: <ul>
• Hiring PR professionals to help us reach the media and make SAAM (Sexual Assault Awareness Month) a more positive and effective campaign.
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Purchasing ad space in local magazines like Austin Monthly.

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Buying T-Shirts, photographs, artwork, and other merchandise to unite our cause.

column1: • Hosting a charity event to raise money for SafePlace.
A large, charitable contribution to SafePlace. If we break through our goal, additional funds will be spent making our event even more successful or being directly donated to SafePlace.
If we aren't able to raise the money we need, then we won't be able to host the charity event.

We will be Tweeting, Facebooking, and Instagramming important information throughout the month of April in order to raise awareness. However, we expect to raise the majority of our charitable contribution at the fundraiser, so please help us meet this goal. Every contribution counts.

The Impact

Sexual assault awareness is important. Statistically, the majority of sexual assault victims are female. As a woman, this means being cautious in every day to day situation. Together we can teach consent. Yes means yes.
Retrose Management is based in one of the most beautiful, progressive cities in the world. Still, there are 2 reports of sexual assault here EVERY day. WE CAN DO BETTER THAN THIS.

""Together we stand, divided we fall."" We believe in our city, in our country, and in our species. We believe that we can live in a world that's better than a constant fear of rape. Help us make this a reality. Help us raise awareness, expect more of each other, offer better support to survivors, and change the communities we hand to our children.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We need your help. We have already spent time and money to create beautiful photos to help drive this campaign, but we need you to take action. We need you to share our campaign, our campaign photos, and use the hashtag #goteal.

column1: If we don't get the shares, we won't get the exposure we need to make sure that this campaign is a success.

Can't contribute? That's okay!

  • SHARE our images from our social media pages &

• Tell your networks why this campaign is important.

    • This campaign is about awareness. Please share the #GoTeal campaign and help spread the word.

    Thank you for you help and contributions!!

JOIN THE PHRESH REVOLUTION:
We're thrilled to introduce PHresh KITCHEN - a new healthy
alternative fast food restaurant, with food that tastes great and is good for you!

We've spent years researching, testing, and developing a new health-conscience restaurant concept, and we're pleased to introduce our creative, great tasting menu that's quick and convenient, GMO free, low sodium, organic and  adheres to the Diabetes and Healthy Heart guidelines.
But wait – there’s more… Our
portable, mobile, compact and environmentally friendly restaurant units (which
we call iKitchens) will be placed wherever you are - in high traffic areas like
malls, hospitals, shopping centers, universities and more…
Sounds great, doesn’t it?!  We think so, and we’ve got the attention of lots
of healthy-eating registered dietians, doctors, and athletes, and we’d love
YOUR support too.
Read on…  Or donate now!  We need your help to make quick, healthy, great tasting food near you, a reality!
Our initial operation is to open a
commissary kitchen, so we can begin delivering our healthy, great tasting food
to local businesses!

Once we are up and running, in early 2015, we will open our first restaurant unit near the University of Central Florida, in a high traffic area, where customers can come in and eat or take meals and snacks on the go.  We're a new twist on fast food - a healthy version that everyone in the family can feel good about eating! Even if you're  not into “Health Food” we promise you'll love the taste so much, we're confident PHresh KITCHEN will be a regular stop for you!

Our mission is to Create Nutritious Healthy Meals on the go and to Create Healthier, Longer Lives!  Help us make this a reality (and build a PHresh KITCHEN near you!)

We're receiving overwhelming celebrity support for what we are doing,   

and these are just a few of the people
who are part of the PHresh Revolution:
<ul>
<li>
<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >3-time Olympic Gold Medalist Swimmer and Olympic Hall of Fame Member, Rowdy Gaines, as Company Spokesperson
column3: > (he is broadcasting his 7th Olympics for NBC at the 2016 Rio Games)

column1: <li>
Michael Dorsey (Lost 152 lbs. on TV’s Biggest Loser)
<li>
Dr. David Katz (Founding Director of Yale University's Yale-Griffin Prevention Research Center).
<li>
Dr. Nancy Collins (Founder and Executive Director of Nutrition411.com)
<li>
Debi Silber (The Mojo Coach – Top Blogger on health, nutrition and exercise)
<li>
Dr. Sandra Frank (Nutrition analysis expert for the media, cookbook publishers, writers and dietitians)
• Our team includes 6-registered dietitians, nutritionists, doctors, organic chefs, Olympians, athletes, TV’s Biggest Loser winners and contestants, actors and actresses
JOIN THE PHRESH REVOLUTION - Our background and Why:

Among all the food restaurant chains available, there are very few options for people to go and eat healthier.  At the moment, 40% of an average household’s food budget is spent on eating out, and when people eat out, they go to where it’s fast and convenient,  but not necessarily healthy.
adults are overweight or obese, and that leads to diabetes, heart disease and
many forms of cancer.

A few years ago, Tim Murphy, CEO and Founder of PHresh KITCHEN had a dream to create a new kind of fast food restaurant.  One that busy people could pop into for a quick meal or snack, wherever they might be, and know that everything on the menu is fresh, creative, and good for you.
• No weeding though high fat and high calorie menu items to find the one or  two healthy options
• No wondering what kind of pesticides are in the vegetables, or antibiotics are in the meat
• No wondering what the vegetarian, vegan, or gluten-free eater in the group can eat
• No driving for miles past the big fast food chains, to find the one good    choice
• No worrying about a healthy meal for your children, A healthy menu the kids will love too!

We’re getting ready to open our first restaurant in early 2015.  We’re committed to expanding our franchise so we can offer delicious, organic, GMO-free, and healthy fast food to everyone, everywhere.  We’ll feature state-of-the-art, cloud-based technology to make ordering and preparation fast and easy and we’ll do it all from our unique and environmentally-friendly, mobile iKitchens.
<span style=""font-size: 16px
column3: >We need some help, and want you to be a part of our team.  If you understand the importance that eating better can have on helping you to live a longer, healthier and happier life, and you want to make a difference in how everyone eats, please make a donation to our crowd-funding campaign, which will help establish the first commissary kitchen to launch our delivery program, and then propel us into the first iKitchen.

column1:
We have some PHresh and fabulous rewards for you, to say thanks for your support and for joining our mission.  Please watch our video to learn more, and check out the PHresh KITCHEN Website as well.  And while you are in the PHresh KITCHEN website, sign-up for our free ""Get Fit Get Faboulous Get PHresh"" 2015 Calendar and Healthy Toolkit.

Plus we also need you to pass this on to your friends, family, and anyone else who gets the importance of healthy eating like you do.

And if there are a few of you out there that would like to join the PHresh Zone Revolution, we are looking for additional investors, as well as celebrities, vendors and team members in the food, health and exercise fields.

Additionally if you, or someone you know, would like to participate with PHresh KITCHEN in a larger way, we have many other capital funding methods that we would like to share.

We are targeting doctors, health professionals, registered dieticians, and athletes.  Our goal is to partner with individuals and companies in the food, health and exercise fields that share our common mission of creating healthier, longer lives!
So if you know of anyone who might like to collaborate with PHresh Kitchen, please help us and pass this information on!

Thanks for your support!  Together, we can start a whole new, healthy eating revolution.

Happy New Year, and see you in the PHresh Zone!

Tim Murphy
Founder &

Family Background

Marcial and Stephanie Gonzalez have been married for 8 years and have known each other for 12 years.  We are both Youth and Young Adult Leaders in church for many years.  We met in church where we were actively involved.  We have been working with high-risk children since 1999.  We feel a strong calling from the Lord to commit our lives to ministry.

In June 2012, we received a call from Honduras to adopt this child because the mother could not take care of the child.  We had been praying about adopting domestically, but had considered internationally as well.  When we received the call, we knew that we were supposed to adopt little Marshall III.

His mother neglected and abandoned him.  We have been supporting the baby 100% since November 2012.  We got an apartment in Honduras so we can travel back and forth from the United States and Roatan, Honduras to take care of him.  When we are not there, we have a nanny there with him while we go through the adoption process.  Honduras has so many restrictions and hesitations on international adoptions.  We have gone through so much since November 2012.  However, we are prayerful that the Lord will grant us the desires of our hearts and expedite and approve this adoption.
Costs

We have started the process by retaining an attorney to have the birth mother sign paperwork, met with the attorney to be deemed Legal Guardians so that we can have rights over the baby.  There are several dates ahead of us to go to the court to seek approval for Foster Parent (2/21/13), Legal Guardian, go to US Embassy to get baby visa and complete adoption process.  The ongoing costs are as follows:
<ul>
• $500 -- mthly apartment rental
• $300 -- mthly nanny expense
• $900 -- monthly travel
• $5000 -- attorney fees
• $2000 -- court fees
• $2000 -- birth mom fees
• $1200 -- Homestudy
• $300 -- mthly child care (medical, food, pampers, clothes)
• $2500 -- agency fees
We would love to raise $15,000 to cover the costs.  However, we want to be realistic with our goal.  So we are asking for $7500.  That amount will be used towards the above-mentioned costs.
The Impact
<div>

We would be extremely grateful if you joined us in this campaign and donated to it.  We have grown so close to our son, Marshallito and pray to bring him home soon to raise him in a loving, Christian home and to make a wonderful addition to the Gonzalez family.

THE 10, 11, 12 marathon challenge
10, 11, 12 challenge simple really. 10 marathons, 11 charities in 12 months. How do you pick 11 charities you ask? With your help!
This challenge could help you, your mum, your dad, your bother, sister,
grandad, grandma, aunty, uncle, cousin, in fact it could help anyone

you know.

In partnership with The Costa Foundation, I want all
of us to select 10 more charities for myself to run 10 marathons for, all over the country in

12 months.

How will we choose these worthy causes?

This is
where I REALLY need your help. The poll I have posted on my linked facebook group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/101112marathon....) gives
you the option to add a charity close to your heart. The top ten worthy
causes in the poll will have an individual marathon dedicated to them.
This is not  competition, just a way of choosing a few good causes to

support, amongst the thousands of wonderful charities there are.

THE TARGET
Together I know we can raise a substantial amount of money for all

these great causes. The fundraising will be split into 60 day periods over the 12 months to focus on fundraising for which ever charity has been associated with the marathon at that time. At the end of the challenge the money raised will be divided equally between all 11 causes.

On a personal level I would love to raise £5000,

£500 a marathon for this challenge, but I can’t do it alone.


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can donate to this fundraising challenge, you can still help. Please share this indiegogo site and the facebook group with your friends and family.

Of course you could also run with me! Contact me at marcus.claytor@gmail.com if you'd like to join in the challenge.

This is a way to support a charity that possibly supports you in some way, so whether it be through donating or running, lets do something special together.

Build Community Wellness*

Welcome to the Garcia Institute of Modern Excellence INIDIEGOGO Campaign!

We
are passionately seeking support to help us Be the Change We Wish to
See in the World! Currently 1600 people in the U.S. are dying per day
due to cancer. 2/3rd's of our adults are overweight or obese. 1/3rd of
all children graduating high school will be diagnosed with Diabetes II

and prescription drug addiction is on the rise!

It
is our goal to expand our performance and wellness center to have the
ability to proactively teach, inspire and motivate health on a larger
scale. Our country desperately needs preventative wellness centers that can reduce the daunting statistics.
Our personal community has fallen 11 counties behind in health in just the past 4 years. Our mortality rates, morbid disease and obesity rates are
rising. Our area struggles with low access
to healthy food and prevention education! We also have a large population of individuals locally
and around the globe who wish to improve their well being, yet have
been misled with fads, gimmicks and short term fixes.
The Garcia Institute of Modern Excellence has been extremely successful at improving health, athletic performance, injury prevention, rehabilitation and vitality!
<div>
Imagine what we can do with a facility that offers.....
• Large conference rooms for holding international training courses
• Open floor space for teaching functional fitness
• Private therapy rooms for chronic pain relief
• An area to prepare healthy meals to go
• Access to affordable, tasty food
• Meeting areas for weekly support group meetings
• Stress relief options
• Customized training for those with special needs
• Full time mentor ship programs
• Medical wellness plans
• Community Resources
<div>
It is our dream to continue to provide an authentic message of wellness
that offers an expanded reach, with an integrative approach to teach
individuals how to care for their most precious gift!
""If we do not take care of our body, where will we live?""
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2: What You GetWe need to raise $849,000 to make this Health Solution come to LIFE!

column1: We've invested our time and energy into raising money to help others, donating to those in need,
facilitating community health initiatives and raising money for cancer
research programs! We now know it's time to raise this money to offer a
safe haven for people to visit locally and internationally to receive

the support needed for their quality of life!

This money will
help a 15,000 sq ft building come to life on 3 acres within the next two
years! This will be a place of business, but as everyone knows GIME, it
will be a place for community! A place where individuals come to

experience their best self and to meet others who want to do the same!

Here
is the AMAZING part about this entire project! Your investment into
this LIFE SAVER, GUARANTEES you a RETURN! We have implemented LIFE
CHANGING PERKS that can help you or a family member ACHIEVE OPTIMAL
HEALTH!
• Follow our project updates as they happen!
• Receive a GIME Guide that makes eating healthy EASY!
• Earn the 12 Week Value Self DVD with a GIME Guide.
• Earn a percentage off all services for life.
• Receive a LIFETIME MEMBERSHIP!

An investment in GIME can transform not only the individual, but an entire community. 

What happens if we do not meet our entire goal?

We
will keep going! The monies earned from this event will go directly
into an account for this project and we will utilize portions for a down
payment on a loan to make up the difference! We have the land in place,
our bank and the TOP builder to make this the best location for OPTIMAL
PERFORMANCE &amp
column2: WELLNESS! You will be helping us create amazing

column1: change for the Nature Coast Area of Florida and for those who seek

support around the WORLD!

The Impact
<div>GIME
has a 99% success rate at improving the lives of those who are ready for our guidance! Our cutting edge, scientific approach, with compassion, love,
empathy and determination, makes us different! We provide real life
solutions to obstacles that have created damage to ones body or has held
them back from feeling their best! Life is too short not to experience what it feels like to have vital energy, self esteem and total health!
<div>We have helped thousands learn how to LIVE again!
We have several cases of eliminating and improving the following areas:
• Nerve Pain
• Depression
• Obesity
• Back and Joint Pain
• Anxiety
• Thyroid Issues
• Chronic Epstein Barr Virus
• Irritable Bowel Syndrome
• Fibromyalgia
• M.S. Symptoms
<li>Eating Disorders &amp
DON'T FORGET TO WATCH OUR VIDEO TESTIMONIES!!!
<ul>
<div>If the student is willing and ready to apply, GIME has solutions to the answers they have been seeking!
Individuals typically come to us after they have tried all other
conventional avenues. It is our hope to meet with them earlier on in
their hunt for health and to work in conjunction with their medical team

to get their life back sooner versus later!

Your investment
will allow us to make an immediate impact on our suffering community,
while offering a wave of support throughout the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please
share this project with family members, friends, co-workers! Anyone you
feel can benefit from our support or who believes in our quest for

wellness can be part of this life improving project!

We
currently consult with individuals all over the world and are grateful
to support in anyway we can! If we have helped improve your life, please
tell others! Allow them to hear your story and know that this

investment will offer a return!

We have 173,000 individuals in
Hernando County alone! I know if we all pull together we can make this
happen for GIME and our Community! If each person just donated $10 we

would double our goal! It's crazy what strength we can have in numbers!

Thank you for helping us Be the Change We Wish to See in the World!

What is
GUARDRIDE?
<div>

Early one morning in 2013, I was driving to a funeral and started thinking about how fragile life was and how my worst fear was having my teenage daughter or son drive drunk and take their life, a friends or another persons.

Although I trust my kid’s judgment, I know that even a good kid can make a bad decision, and I can’t be there with them at a high school party or while they are away at college to make sure they make the right choices.
Since I didn’t want to be worrying every time my kids went out, I looked for a solution that could help…there was none.
So I created GUARDRIDE to give me and other parents a tool to help keep our kids safe from drinking and driving.
<div><div><div>

column3: >GUARDRIDE is the world's first smartphone based DUI monitoring system that allows parents to partner with their high school or college age drivers to help prevent them from drinking and driving.
column5: >

column1: The patent pending GUARDRIDE™ IPHONE BASED SYSTEM IS FULLY COMPLETED AND READY FOR DELIVERY immediately at the end of our campaign. Since GUARDRIDE always wants to give back to the community,
column2: > we thought it fitting to launch the

column1: system with a charitable crowdfunding campaign to help donate systems to High
Schools in need around the country where DUI tragedy has struck.
tiers for discounted annual GUARDRIDE
subscriptions.  For every 10 families that join GUARDRIDE,
donate 1 system to the targeted High Schools. People will also have the ability to personally donate a GUARDRIDE system to the High School donation program.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
column2: >GUARDRIDE Helps Keep Your Kids Safe With 3 Simple Steps

column1: <div style=""text-align: center
<div style=""text-align: center
<div style=""text-align: left
1. When your kid goes out for the night with their friends you       simply start their GUARDRIDE session to help prevent them from drinking and driving.
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
2. Each time your kid gets behind the wheel during their GUARDRIDE session they must verify their sobriety &
column2: identity by taking a breathalyzer test with facial recognition.

column1: <div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
3. You will be alerted if your kid fails the breathalyzer and facial recognition tests or starts to drive without taking the tests.
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left

Using GUARDRIDE is as simple as downloading the Guardian APP on your phone, the Driver APP on your kid’s phone and giving them the systems BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer. Nothing has to be installed on the vehicle. During a GUARDRIDE session, they must pass a breathalyzer test before they drive while identifying themselves using facial recognition software. The default BAC (Blood Alcohol Content) setting is a zero tolerance 0.00% BAC.

If they fail their breathalyzer test or start driving without taking one you will be notified on your phone and be shown their location on GPS so you can take action. It takes less than 30 seconds for your kid to take the test, and give you peace of mind.
<div style=""text-align: left
THE GUARDRIDE SYSTEM
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
This IPhone based solution is comprised of two mobile APPs and a BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer. Nothing has to be installed on the vehicle.
<div style=""text-align: left
Before a young driver goes out for the night with friends, their parents start their GUARDRIDE session.
<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left

column1: <div style=""text-align: left

<div style=""text-align: left
<div style=""text-align: left
<span style=""background-color: initial
column3: >Once the GUARDRIDE session has started, the parental Guardian APP then starts to monitor the kids Driver APP to make sure they take a breathalyzer test with facial recognition selfie before they drive during their session.

column1: <div style=""text-align: left
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
T
column2: >he young driver only has to take their tests when they are in a GUARDRIDE session, not any other times they are driving a vehicle.
>If the young driver fails their breathalyzer test, facial recognition test or starts to drive without taking the tests, the Driver APP will alert the parents Guardian APP.
>GUARDRIDE will also show the parents their kids GPS map location so they can get them home safely.
>The Guardian APP’s interface is intuitive and simple to use, allowing parents to easily set-up their kids on the system, schedule sessions and be alerted of any driver test failures.
>The Driver APP is also easy to use, making it simple for young drivers to set up their facial recognition enrollment.
>It takes less than 30 seconds for the young driver to take their breathalyzer test with facial recognition.
column3: >The GUARDRIDE system has the same leading edge facial recognition technology software that is used by many of the top fortune 100 companies.

column2: >GUARDRIDE has partnered with BACtrack®, the leader in breathalyzers, and rated the most accurate consumer breathalyzer brand on the market.

column6: > Fuel Cell Sensor Technology, the same advanced technology trusted by hospitals, clinics and law enforcement. BACtrack® Mobile is easy to use
column7: a user simply blows into the breathalyzer, and their BAC results are transmitted wirelessly via Bluetooth® to the GUARDRIDE app on their smartphone.  Since all police-grade fuel cell breathalyzers have to be re-calibrated to maintain accuracy, the BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer needs to be sent in to BACtrack® once per year.

column1: <h1 style=""text-align: center
<div style=""font-weight: bold
column4: >On a normal night parents won’t receive any failure alerts

column1: <div style=""font-weight: bold
<div style=""text-align: center
column3: >But they can always check their session events screen to see how the night is going.

column1: <div>
<span style=""background-color: initial

column2: >And they can always watch and listen to the sessions breathalyzer test videos that are taken during each test to make sure no one is trying to trick the system.

column1: In

order to give parents an extra layer of safety, we will soon be launching a patent pending steel Key Guard that will prevent kids from putting their key into the ignition until they pass their Breathalyzer test with facial recognition. We also will be creating a keyless entry Key Guard.
will also be adding many other driving safety features to the system in the
near future, which we are secretive about for now ,but rest assured they will hit at the heart of young driver operating safety needs.
The GUARDRIDE Philosophy

GUARDRIDE believes the best way to reduce drunk driving among young drivers is to create a way for parents to constructively engage with their kids and form a partnership based on the principle of “trust but verify”. Because even a good kid can make a bad decision. GUARDRIDE is designed to help prevent that bad decision by having them agree to use the system every time they get behind the wheel during a session. Since the kids are aware their parents will know if they drink and drive...most won't.
UNDERAGE
DRINKING AND DUI STATISTICS
·  Underage kids drink and drive 2.4 million times a month
·
22 % of teens say they have recently
ridden with driver who’d been drinking
·
25 % of teen car crash fatalities
involved alcohol.
·
Nearly
10 million young people, ages 12 to 20 (24%), reported that they've consumed
alcohol in the past 30 days
·
Every 2 hours a young person dies from underage drinking
<h1 style=""text-align: center
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Where We Are And Why We Need

column1: After more than 2 1/2 years of planning and development, we now have a fully functional GUARDRIDE system on the Apple IOS platform, with Android in the plans for the future. We’ve harnessed the best of technology and system design to provide amazing features to help give parents a tool to help prevent their kids from drinking and driving.
Where We Are

The GUARDRIDE IPhone based system is already fully completed and ready for delivery immediately at the end of our campaign. We are launching the system with a charitable crowdfunding campaign to help donate systems to DUI affected High Schools around the country.
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 24px
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >We’ve turned to Indiegogo to open our idea to you and the awesome community of parents and concerned people around the world that want to help eradicate young drivers from DUI. We want to learn from you, and with your support, we will continue to improve on our system and offer more driving safety features to help keep kids safe.

column1: <div><span style=""background-color: initial

Since GUARDRIDE always wants to give back to the community, we thought it fitting to launch the system with a charitable crowdfunding campaign to help donate systems to DUI affected High Schools around the country. For every 10 families that join GUARDRIDE, BACtrack® and GUARDRIDE will donate 1 system with a BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer to the targeted High Schools.
There are various main tiers for people to participate along with other smaller tiers:
1
column2: > – Parents can help by contributing to the discounted GUARDRIDE subscription levels for

column1: their young drivers. These contributions help toward the system donations to the selected high schools.
Tier
2 – You can help by contributing to a discounted full GUARDRIDE system to donate to
a DUI affected high school.  We will donate in your name or anonymously and your name will go onto our top tier section on our website donors page.
3
column2: >– You can help by donating various tiered dollar amounts to help purchase a

column1: full GUARDRIDE system for a DUI affected high school.  Your name will go onto our donors page on our website.
Tier 4 - You can help by donating in your name or anonymously to your own high school if you donate a minimum of 10 systems. Your name will go onto our Platinum section on our website donors page.
Tier 5 - Donate towards the key guard working prototype and get full credit towards the estimated purchase price ($125) and also be in first group to receive key guard.

column3: > - Help donate toward the development of version 2 of the system which will add driving safety features to help keep kids safer on the road.

column2: >Also, please share via the social media icons at the top of the page, it really helps when you spread the word to other caring parents.

column1: <div><i style=""background-color: initial

column7: >YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS CAN HELP PREVENT YOUNG DRIVERS FROM DRINKING AND DRIVING

column1: The Team

We are a group that is fully committed to helping prevent young drivers from drinking and driving and unsafe driving.  Our highly qualified and experienced team has what it takes to develop our next app versions with additional safety features as well as the Key Guards.  We believe we have created a cutting edge DUI prevention system that is easy to use and has a great user experience.
Brian has over twenty-five years of finance and marketing experience
within the institutional finance and corporate sales industries.  He holds a B.S. degree
in Finance and International business from Northeastern University.  Brian’s strong creative side and analytical
style has helped to shape GUARDRIDE’s unique approach to helping prevent young
drivers from drinking and driving.
Owen Brown – Chief Technology Officer
Owen is a software engineer with a
strong background in mechanical and electrical design. He has 16+ years of
experience in writing micro-controller code for machine automation. For the last
few years, his focus has been on integrating machine control with iOS using
Bluetooth. He has several machine-control Bluetooth LE applications on the app
store. Owen is also the author of a new book called “Integrating iOS Bluetooth
LE with PIC18 Micro-controllers”. Owens B.S. in Math coupled with his
engineering expertise were integral in helping us find solutions to all the
complexities we ran into while developing the GUARDRIDE system.
James Langdon – VP of Software Development
James brings 15 years of corporate IT
experience, primarily focused in data architecture and resource
management.  In addition, he has
independently developed many web and mobile applications for a variety of
project applications. James has strong project management and development
life-cycle skills coupled with a keen focus on the user experience.  These traits coupled with his B.S. in
Communications have been invaluable in helping to develop a world class user
experience for GUARDRIDE.
Ransom Carroll – VP of Software Development
Ransom's
background has been focused on Air Force avionics, electronic circuits, and
custom software development.  This has helped him amass a large variety of
technical knowledge and skills over the past 15 years.   Ransom’s Bachelors
of Science degree in Information Systems and Associate’s degree in Applied
Science also give him an extremely strong technical background.  Ransoms strong technical background coupled
with his extensive experience in troubleshooting and finding simple solutions
to complex issues has helped tremendously in developing the GUARDRIDE system.
Risks and Challenges

We have been working for more than 2 1/2 years planning and developing GUARDRIDE and getting it ready for launch.  Unlike most Indiegogo campaigns we are finished with the GUARDRIDE system so we don't have any risk in delivering this system in August at the end of the campaign.

We know what the next steps are for developing the future driving safety features for the system and the key guard prototype.  Our team is qualified and has the experience to complete these next steps, but we may encounter some difficulties along the way. We have plans to mitigate all the risks and have enlisted great advisors that will also help.
Software:

The GUARDRIDE system apps are fully functional, but we still have a little work to do building all the features that we want to eventually include in the GUARDRIDE app. Version 2 with some of the driver safety features is planned for release within 3-4 months after the Indiegogo campaign is completed. Software development sometimes gets tricky and takes longer than expected, but we have a lot of experience in this area and if necessary will look for additional help to solve any problems that could emerge.
Manufacturing:
We do not manufacture the BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer, that is manufactured by BACtrack® and is fully available now at www.bactrack.com

The Key Guard is the only component of the GUARDRIDE system that we need to manufacture. We have a non-working Key Guard prototype and have all the specifications of the components and sizing worked out in CAD. We now need to create the functional Key Guard manufacture ready prototype, which will cost an estimated $20,000-$25,000 to complete.  We will start the development of the Key Guard with the monies that are donated toward that tier and from some of the contributions we receive during the campaign and beyond. Once funded it will take 2-3 months to develop the Key Guard prototype.  After that it will be 4-6 months until first estimated delivery of the Key Guards. We will undoubtedly have surprises on our journey, but we trust that we have the team to overcome all challenges, as we’ve done so far. Our goal is to make the best possible product for you.

column2: >PLEASE SUPPORT US IN OUR CAMPAIGN AND HELP KEEP KIDS SAFE FROM DUI

column1: Should you have any questions, please visit

column1: ","What is
GUARDRIDE?

Early one morning in 2013, I was driving to a funeral and started thinking about how fragile life was and how my worst fear was having my teenage daughter or son drive drunk and take their life, a friends or another persons.

Although I trust my kid’s judgment, I know that even a good kid can make a bad decision, and I can’t be there with them at a high school party or while they are away at college to make sure they make the right choices.
Since I didn’t want to be worrying every time my kids went out, I looked for a solution that could help…there was none.
So I created GUARDRIDE to give me and other parents a tool to help keep our kids safe from drinking and driving.
Brian Griffin – Founder of GUARDRIDE
GUARDRIDE is the world's first smartphone based DUI monitoring system that allows parents to partner with their high school or college age drivers to help prevent them from drinking and driving.

The patent pending GUARDRIDE™ IPHONE BASED SYSTEM IS FULLY COMPLETED AND READY FOR DELIVERY immediately at the end of our campaign. Since GUARDRIDE always wants to give back to the community, we thought it fitting to launch the
system with a charitable crowdfunding campaign to help donate systems to High
Schools in need around the country where DUI tragedy has struck.
We have limited quantity reward
tiers for discounted annual GUARDRIDE
subscriptions.  For every 10 families that join GUARDRIDE, BACtrack® and GUARDRIDE will
donate 1 system to the targeted High Schools. People will also have the ability to personally donate a GUARDRIDE system to the High School donation program.
GUARDRIDE Helps Keep Your Kids Safe With 3 Simple Steps
1. When your kid goes out for the night with their friends you       simply start their GUARDRIDE session to help prevent them from drinking and driving.
2. Each time your kid gets behind the wheel during their GUARDRIDE session they must verify their sobriety & identity by taking a breathalyzer test with facial recognition.
3. You will be alerted if your kid fails the breathalyzer and facial recognition tests or starts to drive without taking the tests.

Using GUARDRIDE is as simple as downloading the Guardian APP on your phone, the Driver APP on your kid’s phone and giving them the systems BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer. Nothing has to be installed on the vehicle. During a GUARDRIDE session, they must pass a breathalyzer test before they drive while identifying themselves using facial recognition software. The default BAC (Blood Alcohol Content) setting is a zero tolerance 0.00% BAC.

If they fail their breathalyzer test or start driving without taking one you will be notified on your phone and be shown their location on GPS so you can take action. It takes less than 30 seconds for your kid to take the test, and give you peace of mind.
THE GUARDRIDE SYSTEM
This IPhone based solution is comprised of two mobile APPs and a BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer. Nothing has to be installed on the vehicle.
Before a young driver goes out for the night with friends, their parents start their GUARDRIDE session.
The parent also has the ability to schedule one-time or recurring sessions.

Once the GUARDRIDE session has started, the parental Guardian APP then starts to monitor the kids Driver APP to make sure they take a breathalyzer test with facial recognition selfie before they drive during their session.
The young driver only has to take their tests when they are in a GUARDRIDE session, not any other times they are driving a vehicle.
If the young driver fails their breathalyzer test, facial recognition test or starts to drive without taking the tests, the Driver APP will alert the parents Guardian APP.
GUARDRIDE will also show the parents their kids GPS map location so they can get them home safely.
The Guardian APP’s interface is intuitive and simple to use, allowing parents to easily set-up their kids on the system, schedule sessions and be alerted of any driver test failures.
The Driver APP is also easy to use, making it simple for young drivers to set up their facial recognition enrollment.

It takes less than 30 seconds for the young driver to take their breathalyzer test with facial recognition.  The GUARDRIDE system has the same leading edge facial recognition technology software that is used by many of the top fortune 100 companies.
GUARDRIDE has partnered with BACtrack®, the leader in breathalyzers, and rated the most accurate consumer breathalyzer brand on the market.

The award-winning BACtrack® Mobile offers police-grade Xtend® Fuel Cell Sensor Technology, the same advanced technology trusted by hospitals, clinics and law enforcement. BACtrack® Mobile is easy to use
column2: a user simply blows into the breathalyzer, and their BAC results are transmitted wirelessly via Bluetooth® to the GUARDRIDE app on their smartphone.  Since all police-grade fuel cell breathalyzers have to be re-calibrated to maintain accuracy, the BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer needs to be sent in to BACtrack® once per year.

column1: Silence is Golden
On a normal night parents won’t receive any failure alerts
But they can always check their session events screen to see how the night is going.
And they can always watch and listen to the sessions breathalyzer test videos that are taken during each test to make sure no one is trying to trick the system.
In

order to give parents an extra layer of safety, we will soon be launching a patent pending steel Key Guard that will prevent kids from putting their key into the ignition until they pass their Breathalyzer test with facial recognition. We also will be creating a keyless entry Key Guard.
We
will also be adding many other driving safety features to the system in the
near future, which we are secretive about for now ,but rest assured they will hit at the heart of young driver operating safety needs.
The GUARDRIDE Philosophy

GUARDRIDE believes the best way to reduce drunk driving among young drivers is to create a way for parents to constructively engage with their kids and form a partnership based on the principle of “trust but verify”. Because even a good kid can make a bad decision. GUARDRIDE is designed to help prevent that bad decision by having them agree to use the system every time they get behind the wheel during a session. Since the kids are aware their parents will know if they drink and drive...most won't.
UNDERAGE
DRINKING AND DUI STATISTICS
·  Underage kids drink and drive 2.4 million times a month
22 % of teens say they have recently
ridden with driver who’d been drinking
25 % of teen car crash fatalities
involved alcohol.
Nearly
10 million young people, ages 12 to 20 (24%), reported that they've consumed
alcohol in the past 30 days
Every 2 hours a young person dies from underage drinking
Where We Are And Why We Need You

After more than 2 1/2 years of planning and development, we now have a fully functional GUARDRIDE system on the Apple IOS platform, with Android in the plans for the future. We’ve harnessed the best of technology and system design to provide amazing features to help give parents a tool to help prevent their kids from drinking and driving.
Where We Are

The GUARDRIDE IPhone based system is already fully completed and ready for delivery immediately at the end of our campaign. We are launching the system with a charitable crowdfunding campaign to help donate systems to DUI affected High Schools around the country.
Why We Need You

We’ve turned to Indiegogo to open our idea to you and the awesome community of parents and concerned people around the world that want to help eradicate young drivers from DUI. We want to learn from you, and with your support, we will continue to improve on our system and offer more driving safety features to help keep kids safe.
HOW YOU CAN HELP

Since GUARDRIDE always wants to give back to the community, we thought it fitting to launch the system with a charitable crowdfunding campaign to help donate systems to DUI affected High Schools around the country. For every 10 families that join GUARDRIDE, BACtrack® and GUARDRIDE will donate 1 system with a BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer to the targeted High Schools.
There are various main tiers for people to participate along with other smaller tiers:
Tier
1 – Parents can help by contributing to the discounted GUARDRIDE subscription levels for
their young drivers. These contributions help toward the system donations to the selected high schools.
Tier
2 – You can help by contributing to a discounted full GUARDRIDE system to donate to
a DUI affected high school.  We will donate in your name or anonymously and your name will go onto our top tier section on our website donors page.
Tier
3 – You can help by donating various tiered dollar amounts to help purchase a
full GUARDRIDE system for a DUI affected high school.  Your name will go onto our donors page on our website.
Tier 4 - You can help by donating in your name or anonymously to your own high school if you donate a minimum of 10 systems. Your name will go onto our Platinum section on our website donors page.
Tier 5 - Donate towards the key guard working prototype and get full credit towards the estimated purchase price ($125) and also be in first group to receive key guard.
Smaller Tiers - Help donate toward the development of version 2 of the system which will add driving safety features to help keep kids safer on the road.
The BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer can be purchased separately for $99 with free shipping for GUARDRIDE customers through this link to the BACtrack®  website: http://bit.ly/28JUABZ
Please use the coupon code: GUARDRIDE, so it counts towards the DUI affected high school donations.
Also, please share via the social media icons at the top of the page, it really helps when you spread the word to other caring parents.
YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS CAN HELP PREVENT YOUNG DRIVERS FROM DRINKING AND DRIVING
The Team

We are a group that is fully committed to helping prevent young drivers from drinking and driving and unsafe driving.  Our highly qualified and experienced team has what it takes to develop our next app versions with additional safety features as well as the Key Guards.  We believe we have created a cutting edge DUI prevention system that is easy to use and has a great user experience.
Brian Griffin – Founder/President
Brian has over twenty-five years of finance and marketing experience
within the institutional finance and corporate sales industries.  He holds a B.S. degree
in Finance and International business from Northeastern University.  Brian’s strong creative side and analytical
style has helped to shape GUARDRIDE’s unique approach to helping prevent young
drivers from drinking and driving.
Owen Brown – Chief Technology Officer
Owen is a software engineer with a
strong background in mechanical and electrical design. He has 16+ years of
experience in writing micro-controller code for machine automation. For the last
few years, his focus has been on integrating machine control with iOS using
Bluetooth. He has several machine-control Bluetooth LE applications on the app
store. Owen is also the author of a new book called “Integrating iOS Bluetooth
LE with PIC18 Micro-controllers”. Owens B.S. in Math coupled with his
engineering expertise were integral in helping us find solutions to all the
complexities we ran into while developing the GUARDRIDE system.
James Langdon – VP of Software Development
James brings 15 years of corporate IT
experience, primarily focused in data architecture and resource
management.  In addition, he has
independently developed many web and mobile applications for a variety of
project applications. James has strong project management and development
life-cycle skills coupled with a keen focus on the user experience.  These traits coupled with his B.S. in
Communications have been invaluable in helping to develop a world class user
experience for GUARDRIDE.
Ransom Carroll – VP of Software Development
Ransom's
background has been focused on Air Force avionics, electronic circuits, and
custom software development.  This has helped him amass a large variety of
technical knowledge and skills over the past 15 years.   Ransom’s Bachelors
of Science degree in Information Systems and Associate’s degree in Applied
Science also give him an extremely strong technical background.  Ransoms strong technical background coupled
with his extensive experience in troubleshooting and finding simple solutions
to complex issues has helped tremendously in developing the GUARDRIDE system.
Risks and Challenges

We have been working for more than 2 1/2 years planning and developing GUARDRIDE and getting it ready for launch.  Unlike most Indiegogo campaigns we are finished with the GUARDRIDE system so we don't have any risk in delivering this system in August at the end of the campaign.

We know what the next steps are for developing the future driving safety features for the system and the key guard prototype.  Our team is qualified and has the experience to complete these next steps, but we may encounter some difficulties along the way. We have plans to mitigate all the risks and have enlisted great advisors that will also help.
Software:

The GUARDRIDE system apps are fully functional, but we still have a little work to do building all the features that we want to eventually include in the GUARDRIDE app. Version 2 with some of the driver safety features is planned for release within 3-4 months after the Indiegogo campaign is completed. Software development sometimes gets tricky and takes longer than expected, but we have a lot of experience in this area and if necessary will look for additional help to solve any problems that could emerge.
Manufacturing:
We do not manufacture the BACtrack® Mobile breathalyzer, that is manufactured by BACtrack® and is fully available now at www.bactrack.com

The Key Guard is the only component of the GUARDRIDE system that we need to manufacture. We have a non-working Key Guard prototype and have all the specifications of the components and sizing worked out in CAD. We now need to create the functional Key Guard manufacture ready prototype, which will cost an estimated $20,000-$25,000 to complete.  We will start the development of the Key Guard with the monies that are donated toward that tier and from some of the contributions we receive during the campaign and beyond. Once funded it will take 2-3 months to develop the Key Guard prototype.  After that it will be 4-6 months until first estimated delivery of the Key Guards. We will undoubtedly have surprises on our journey, but we trust that we have the team to overcome all challenges, as we’ve done so far. Our goal is to make the best possible product for you.
PLEASE SUPPORT US IN OUR CAMPAIGN AND HELP KEEP KIDS SAFE FROM DUI
Should you have any questions, please visit http://guardride.com
for more information or for FAQ's.  Also Email us at info@guardride.com.",34.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Wilton, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/guardride-world-s-first-teen-dui-prevention-system/pica

When we asked our Campers one word to describe what Camp Lightbulb meant to them, they came up with what you see above.
The Camp offers summer camp fun, arts, recreation and wellbeing to support and celebrate our LGBT youth in the welcoming, supportive environment of Provincetown.

The Camp was set up in direct response to the statistics that our LGBT youth are 4 to 6 times more likely tthan their straight counterparts to be bullied, depressed, contemplate suicide or be homeles.
The admission fees were kept very low at $250 to offer youth of all backgrounds to become our pioneer campers.
Your support will contribute to our first year' success and allow us to plan for another Camp Lightbulb next year.

I earned a B.S. in Community Health at Worcester State College in Massachusetts and currently have my Masters in Public Health in progress at Walden University. I did one-year graduate fellowship in global Health.

>My husband Dony who is the co-founder for the organization is a Veterinarian, and shares the same idea as myself. Because these individuals from the village desperately needed someone’s help and my husband and I chose to be that help. Therefore, serving the underserved is our passion.

","About us

column1: I am Ketline Etienne Vilma, I am the founder of Neriah Community Health Foundation, a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit charitable organization. I am a Public Health Specialist, and I also have expertise in health coaching, Research, Disaster Crisis Counseling, nutrition, just to name a few. I earned a B.S. in Community Health at Worcester State College in Massachusetts and currently have my Masters in Public Health in progress at Walden University. I did one-year graduate fellowship in global Health.

My husband Dony who is the co-founder for the organization is a Veterinarian, and shares the same idea as myself. Because these individuals from the village desperately needed someone’s help and my husband and I chose to be that help. Therefore, serving the underserved is our passion.
Description of our campaign

This campaign project aims to solicit urgent funding to finish building our health facility by June 2013, and obtain the medical and dental equipment we need to meet the health needs of those who are dying from lack of healthcare.  The village of Lafresiliere does not have a health center neither a hospital.
What We Need & What You Get
We’ve been serving the health needs of the population of Lafresiliere village, since 2009. We need your help to take the next step.
We’re looking for $27,000 to complete our health facility construction project.  We will be the only health facility in the area.

Providing care for patients in 2 rooms of a rental house was not really appropriate and it expired January 12, 2012.   People are becoming very sick. We got some help from individuals, churches and corporate.
Please, remember that your contribution is 100% tax deductible.  See more info on our Website: www.neriahcommunityhealth.org and contact Ketline via info@neriahcommunityhealth.org
Address: Neriah Community Health Foundation,   P.O. Box 1928 Wakefield, MA 01880
Don't forget to check our perks!

Our unique perks are set to encourage our donors to be part of our donor recognition tree and give toward a great cause. If we do not reach our entire goal we are going to put what we’ve raised toward the construction still.  Please help ASAP and we will send our gratitude to you and many thanks.
The cost for our construction project:

Roofing materials ($7,500), Woods ($3,250), Payments for 5 workers ($2,700), Plywood’s for doors ($2,250), paints ($1,300), Electricity (solar system): ($10,000). Total funds to complete the construction is $27,000.  Even though we are fundraising for $27,000 through indiegogo, we still need more for medical equipment.
The impact

Funding will help complete the health facility construction project, improve healthcare access for the residents in the village of Lafresiliere, Haiti and save lives of many. Everyone, including children, youth, and elderly but mostly those who are neglected (the poor).  We expect to increase the number of service population residents who seek medical testing and treatment from 2,000 to 10,000 in the next 12 months after expansion.  We can reduce the infant mortality rate and prevent prenatal deaths, assist the injured and provide much needed dental care.
Other Ways You Can Help
·   Help us to get the word out, promote and visit our website: www.neriahcommunityhealth.org
·   Sponsor our health facility construction project or medical equipment
·   Volunteers to travel with us to visit our project
·   Please, do not forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Wakefield, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-build-a-health-facility-for-the-underserved-villagers-in-haiti/pica

The water spark plug is an electrolysis device that excites water to an almost boiling point of tiny fog like droplets, then bombards the water molecules with pulsed resonant frequency to separate the water molecules into their gaseous state - Hydrogen and Oxygen. This ionized HHO mixture is recombined with ionized exhaust gasses and stripped of its electrons, leaving a clean, flammable, positively charged fuel that equals that of a gasoline ignition. The technology was designed to fit into a spark plug and be assisted by a high performance ignition system. We see an opportunity based on research by the Department of Energy to use lasers instead of the traditional high voltage plasma arc to ignite the ionized HHO mixture. Investment capital is sought right now to develop working prototypes. We have a research and development facility in Canada that is capable and eager to start this project. Please Share, we seek funding to bring you this technology!
Our video below answers some frequently asked questions and describes how the water spark plugs work..
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pf8asPBoavQ
Mahalo, Daniel Green

http://watersparkplugs.com/

column2:
>Summer time dreams can come true thanks to you!It's sum-sum-summer time when all kids deserve to be outside playing and participating in all of the summer time favorites that most of us take for granted.

I'm asking you to help an underprivileged kid to get outdoors this summer to experience hitting a home run, splashing in the pool, fishing in the creek, climbing tall trees or leaving the city to pitch a tent under the stars.
There are so many children whose parents can't afford sports registration fees, pool admissions, sports equipment, and especially the high cost of camps. But, with your help, a child could  take in the sights, sounds and experiences that summer has to offer. 
My name is Denise W, and this is my campaign to make a difference. As a social worker,  I have spent many years working with kids who yearn to play a summer sport, jump in a pool to escape the summer heat or sit frightened listening to ghost stories around a camp fire.
With your help, those yearnings will become a reality...hot, sweaty, sun burn kids running freely outside playing, fishing, swimming, climbing, and having the time of their life because of your generosity.

LeeSha needs a vacation!


Kelly Gilliland tells her story:

LeeSha was first diagnosed with breast cancer on May 19, 2011. She was 30 years old at the time and working with me at West Corporation. During that time, LeeSha was my mentor at work, teaching me by example how to be a great leader.

LeeSha had no choice but to face chemo at that time, which was a terrifying thought for her and her family. The doctors needed her to go through chemo before they could operate due to the size of her lump. LeeSha handled it like a champ.

For the first part of her chemo she continued working regularly and handling her symptoms with little to no complaints. When she began her second round of what she refered to as ""hard chemo"" she continued to work part time to try and make ends meet, although this was truly difficult.

LeeSha went on to undergo surgery and have her lump removed. She had a second surgery to insert a port which made life 1000 times better because she could avoid a lot of needles. She had a third surgery: a radical mastectomy, removing both breasts and all lymph nodes under one arm in order prevent future occurrences. This process ended up being one of the most painful experiences.

She went through this process of expanders that involved her going into the doctors office every few weeks and having her skin stretched to be able to insert new breasts eventually.

At this point now, LeeSha had taken on the role of assuring everyone that everything was fine. She had a son, 5 at the time, a family, a girlfriend and too many friends to count that were all extremely worried. She didn't like people to feel this way, so she took it upon herself to reassure everyone that everything was fine. But everything was far from fine.

Cancer is never easy.

Life became very difficult for LeeSha around this time. She wasn't able to work as many hours, as she was in recovery and very susceptible to illness, which is everywhere in a call center. Paying for prescriptions became so impossible that she had to begin picking and choosing which medications were most important. She had to try to balance work with healing and spending time with her family. She began experiencing PTSD.
In true LeeSha fashion, she pushed through it. She reached out and got help for what she was experiencing. Family and friends stepped up, and she got through to the other side.

Then the day finally arrived. On July 31, 2012 LeeSha woke up to what she's called ""the best birthday gift ever!"": awesome new boobs that weren't trying to kill her. Her reconstructive process was finally over and she had some wonderful D cups that she loves.

LeeSha returned to work and tried to get back to her normal routines. She was a superhero at work, instantly inspiring anyone she interacted with. She showed a lot of people what it means to persevere and handle pain with grace. While working, she fought early menopause that began due to her treatments. She had to continue to take a chemo pill that created fatigue, nausea and headaches, amongst other symptoms. She was prescribed many different medicines, each one to handle the side effects of the one before.
It finally all became too much. In February 2013 LeeSha did have to quit her job. It was a necessary decision, but obviously created further financial strain.

In March of 2013, Leesha's biggest fear became a reality. A lump that she'd found was diagnosed as another cancer. And so the process began again. This time it was surgery, then chemo and then radiation. This time it took the doctor two surgeries to remove the lump.

LeeSha went through a harder version of chemo therapy, which was extremely painful, and then experienced radiation for the first time, which terrified her. During this time she was constantly fighting with insurance companies. They were claiming she couldn't be covered for a number of reasons ranging from: pre existing conditions, all the way to- ""You're too young to have cancer."" (I know, it's crazy.)

Her doctors wanted her to have a full hysterectomy to prevent future occurrences, but due to the ridiculous amount of red tape, this surgery was put off for months and months.

In February 2014 LeeSha found a lump in her neck. The thought of this being cancer was truly terrifying. The doctor had previously mentioned that if the cancer had spread to her neck, they would be able to do little more than make her comfortable. You can imagine the relief we felt when we learned it was nothing more than a cyst. This was the first time LeeSha and I could bust out the wine bottle to celebrate, and not for consolation.

Finally, last week on June 10, 2014 LeeSha underwent two surgeries, one to remove a new lump they'd found and her hysterectomy. We found out a couple days later that the lump was not cancer, thank goodness.

Throughout the last 3+ years LeeSha has taught me what it means to be a good person. She's shown me to be kind to people that aren't necessarily kind to you. To stay focused on solutions instead of problems. To see the brighter side when things are awful. To be strong for the people you care about.  To truly see the beauty in each other's differences.

If I could give one person a day of fun with her kid and peace from daily struggles? Well, it's a no-brainer who I would choose.

________________________________________________________________________

My name is Ali. I work full time as a receptionist and I'm also a part time student. I'm creating this campaign because I want to do something nice for a friend that has truly been an inspiration. She is naturally a kind, thoughtful and empathetic person.

She has shown such strength through her battle with breast cancer and has remained positive throughout her treatment and surgeries. I am so happy to say that she is now cancer free! With treatment costs being such a financial burden, I know whatever money she has will be going toward medical bills. Now that she is healthier, I would love to see her and her son go on a vacation to celebrate her long-awaited victory and finally have some time to relax.

I first met LeeSha in 2008 when we worked together in the sales department of a call center. Sales was never my strength. I was actually pretty terrible at it. After several months of low sales, my manager appointed LeeSha as my mentor. She sat with me on a few occasions and taught me different techniques.
She was very patient, positive and so sincere in her desire
to see me succeed. She encouraged me to want to do better. With her help, I
made progress and for the first time (and only time during my employment there)
I met my sales goals for that month and banked my largest commission check.
LeeSha had faith in me and she took the time to help me reach my goals. Now it is time for me to help her reach hers. I am asking for everyone's help
to raise $1500 in order to send her and her family on a
vacation. I will leave the destination up to her, but I think her 7 year old son,
Ian, might suggest Disneyland!

","LeeSha needs a vacation!Kelly Gilliland tells her story: LeeSha was first diagnosed with breast cancer on May 19, 2011. She was 30 years old at the time and working with me at West Corporation. During that time, LeeSha was my mentor at work, teaching me by example how to be a great leader.

LeeSha had no choice but to face chemo at that time, which was a terrifying thought for her and her family. The doctors  needed her to go through chemo before they could operate due to the size of her lump. LeeSha handled it like a champ. For the first part of her chemo she continued working regularly and handling her symptoms with little to no complaints. When she began her second round of what she refered to as ""hard chemo"" she continued to  work part time to try and make ends meet, although this was truly difficult.

LeeSha went on to undergo surgery and have her lump removed. She had a second surgery to insert a port which made life 1000 times better because she could avoid a lot of needles. She had a third surgery: a radical mastectomy, removing both breasts and all lymph nodes under one arm in order prevent future occurrences. This process ended up being one of the most painful experiences. She went through this process of expanders that involved her going into the doctors office every few weeks and having her skin stretched to be able to insert new breasts eventually.

At this point now, LeeSha had taken on the role of assuring everyone that everything was fine. She had a son, 5 at the time, a family, a girlfriend  and too many friends to count that were all extremely worried. She didn't like people to feel this way, so she took it upon herself to reassure everyone that everything was fine. But everything was far from fine. Cancer is never easy.

Life became very difficult for LeeSha around this time. She wasn't able to work as many hours, as she was in recovery and very susceptible to illness, which is everywhere in a call center. Paying for prescriptions became so impossible that she had to begin picking and choosing which medications were most important. She had to try to balance work with healing and spending time with her family. She began experiencing PTSD.
In true LeeSha fashion, she pushed through it. She reached out and got help for what she was experiencing. Family and friends stepped up, and she got through to the other side.

Then the day finally arrived. On July 31, 2012 LeeSha woke up to what she's called ""the best birthday gift ever!"": awesome new boobs that weren't trying to kill her. Her reconstructive process was finally over and she had some wonderful D cups that she loves.

LeeSha returned to work and tried to get back to her normal routines. She was a superhero at work, instantly inspiring anyone she interacted with. She showed a lot of people what it means to persevere and handle pain with grace. While working, she fought early menopause that began due to her treatments. She had to continue to take a chemo pill that created fatigue, nausea and headaches, amongst other symptoms. She was prescribed many different medicines, each one to handle the side effects of the one before.
It finally all became too much. In February 2013 LeeSha did have to quit her job. It was a necessary decision, but obviously created further financial strain.

In March of 2013, Leesha's biggest fear became a reality. A lump that she'd found was diagnosed as another cancer. And so the process began again. This time it was surgery, then chemo and then radiation. This time it took the doctor two surgeries to remove the lump.

LeeSha went through a harder version of chemo therapy, which was extremely painful, and then experienced radiation for the first time, which terrified her. During this time she was constantly fighting with insurance companies. They were claiming she couldn't be covered for a number of reasons ranging from: pre existing conditions, all the way to- ""You're too young to have cancer."" (I know, it's crazy.)

Her doctors wanted her to have a full hysterectomy to prevent future occurrences, but due to the ridiculous amount of red tape, this surgery was put off for months and months. In February 2014 LeeSha found a lump in her neck. The thought of this being cancer was truly terrifying. The doctor had previously mentioned that if the cancer had spread to her neck, they would be able to do little more than make her comfortable. You can imagine the relief we felt when we learned it was nothing more than a cyst. This was the first time LeeSha and I could bust out the wine bottle to celebrate, and not for consolation.

Finally, last week on June 10, 2014 LeeSha underwent two surgeries, one to remove a new lump they'd found and her hysterectomy. We found out a couple days later that the lump was not cancer, thank goodness.

Throughout the last 3+ years LeeSha has taught me what it means to be a good person. She's shown me to be kind to people that aren't necessarily kind to you. To stay focused on solutions instead of problems. To see the brighter side when things are awful. To be strong for the people you care about.  To truly see the beauty in each other's differences.

If I could give one person a day of fun with her kid and peace from daily struggles? Well, it's a no-brainer who I would choose.________________________________________________________________________ My name is Ali. I work full time as a receptionist and I'm also a part time student. I'm creating this campaign because I want to do something nice for a friend that has truly been an inspiration. She is naturally a kind, thoughtful and empathetic person.

She has shown such strength through her battle with breast cancer and has remained positive throughout her treatment and surgeries. I am so happy to say that she is now cancer free! With treatment costs being such a financial burden, I know whatever money she has will be going toward medical bills. Now that she is healthier, I would love to see her and her son go on a vacation to celebrate her long-awaited victory and finally have some time to relax. I first met LeeSha in 2008 when we worked together in the sales department of a call center. Sales was never my strength. I was actually pretty terrible at it. After several months of low sales, my manager appointed LeeSha as my mentor. She sat with me on a few occasions and taught me different techniques.
She was very patient, positive and so sincere in her desire
to see me succeed. She encouraged me to want to do better. With her help, I
made progress and for the first time (and only time during my employment there)
I met my sales goals for that month and banked my largest commission check.
LeeSha had faith in me and she took the time to help me reach my goals. Now it is time for me to help her reach hers. I am asking for everyone's help
to raise $1500 in order to send her and her family on a
vacation. I will leave the destination up to her, but I think her 7 year old son,
Ian, might suggest Disneyland!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

 As many of you know, Salwa Koura had a stroke on December 25th of 2013. She is now ready to come home, which is very exciting.  In order for her to continue her progress there are some things she is going to need.

- a ramp for the house as well as to a van.
- a pole by her bed that helps her get in and out of bed.
- various personal items.

Many people may want to help her but aren't able to financially.  There are other needs to be met. Salwa is going to need 24 hour care which makes it a little tricky for the family to do things such as run errands. If anyone would like to volunteer their time to sit with her for an hour or so while errands are run it would be greatly appreciated. 
Salwa and her family are very appreciative of the support. We are so thankful for all the prayers, and for all the people who have been so concerned for her. Thank God she is coming home, and thank you in advance for all types of contribution.
