Please help us get the word out

 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

column1:
• Ask your friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share our Link on all your social media sites

We wish to send our sincere thanks for all your help and interest in our Project!

 

Frequently Asked Questions

1. When will the soccer fields be ready for use?

Current projections indicate that the fields will be ready for the Fall, 2015 season.

2. How is this fundraiser different than the Team Sponsor requirement?

The Team Sponsorship is an on-going fundraiser to support current soccer operational expenses. This special fundraising campaign is needed to help us fund the additional expense involved in securing our future usage of these new fields.
Once the fields become available to us, we will be in a position to reduce
costs to existing locations and our operations should become self-sufficient

3. Who are the partners involved in building the Park and YMCA building?

The City of Westlake Village, Westlake Village Community Foundation, and the Triunfo branch of the Southeast Ventura County YMCA.

4. How much will the entire project cost?

It is currently estimated to cost over $50 million

5. How is Dole involved?

Dole Corporation, and its CEO, David Murdock, have both contributed significantly to fund the startup costs of the project. Mr. Murdock has given $11 million personally, and Dole has donated $1 million.

Dole will build an Interactive Learning Center and Store within the YMCA facility
where they can continue to be a leader in nutritional education. The Center
will have videos, digital games, literature, and hands-on education
experiences.

5. What does “Help Us, Help You” mean?

By Helping Us with this fundraiser, we will be Helping You and your family have a
more enjoyable and safe soccer experience. This is a chance for our Region to
secure use of beautiful, state-of-the-art, lighted soccer fields. It will allow
us to provide you with a much more flexible environment for practices and
games.

6. What’s been done so far?

Grading of the site is complete at a cost of $15 million. Construction of driveways and parking areas are semi-complete
column2:
baseball fields have begun construction, and
lighting has been completed across the site.

7. How do I give you the T-shirt size I need?

We will send you a survey requesting sizing info, and any special instructions you may have.

8. Can I order extra T-shirts?

Yes, as part of the survey, you can purchase additional T-shirts in various sizes.

column1: 9. How important is this campaign to AYSO Region 4?

These new fields are vital to our program as some of our existing facilities are of extremely poor quality and others may not be available to us in the future.  It will provide your children with a fun, safe environment for many years to come.
10. With 3 new soccer fields, how many practices can we hope to see happening at this location?

A minimum of 6 practices on the soccer fields per hour and 6 more per hour on the baseball and softball fields. So 12 teams per hour.  The good news is that with lighting we can have many more sessions on this facility than the ones without lights.
11. Which divisions will be practicing and playing games here?

Fields will be set up on the soccer side and in the Fall on the baseball and softball fields.  Right now we’re thinking U12, VIP Program, U5, U6, U16 and U19 divisions at various times.  Likely some U16 and U19 on Sundays.  We can have several configurations with different color lines set up.  Depending on what’s happening with our other facilities, all of this is subject to change.  We
intend to maximize the use of this facility as much as possible.  As much
as we’d like to, we can’t put the entire program up there.
12. For the YMCA facilities on site - will AYSO families have access to them, or will that require YMCA membership?

The YMCA facility is for use by YMCA members, the remainder of the facility is open to the public as it’s a park controlled by the City of Westlake Village.  The City will schedule the fields, not the YMCA.  The YMCA can use the facilities but must schedule them through the City.  Westlake baseball, WAGS softball and AYSO soccer will be the priority users but will not be the exclusive users.  The City controls the fields.
13. If the campaign falls short of the $50,000 goal what will happen with the donations? Will there be a refund?

The City needs way more than $50,000 to complete the fields, millions actually.   As a primary user of these fields, the City has asked for our help and we think it’s important for us and our members to make a contribution to help the City get the project done.  If we’re short of $50,000 the entire amount raised goes to the project.  The Region will not keep the funds.  In fact the Region and its board members have previously donated over $50,000 at an earlier fundraiser.  Additionally, the Region plans to make ongoing contributions above the IndieGoGo effort to help get this project done.

Update Dec 13th: We have reached our Goal!!!!! Thank you to everyone who donated and made this possible! It doesn't end here, all donations from this point will be given to Project True!
Keep an eye out for our 2014 Calendar too

Update Dec 6th: We are at the halfway point! Thank you so much for all of your support. Remember that the $1000 is only the minimum goal, if we can raise above that we can make so many great things happen! Keep spreading the word and don't forget to get your own calendar!

*Please note when ordering multiples, click the Calendar OR Calendar + Poster Option, and in the ""Total contribution amount"" section type in the total price of your order ($45 for 3 Calendars, $40 for two Calendar + Poster Packs)

If you have a specific order (1 Calendar and 1Calendar+poster combo) Type in the amount ($35 in this example)
 and leave us a note in the comment section of your order specifying your exact order!
International orders it would be appreciated if you could add on $3 to your order to help with shipping costs!
Thank you.

Our History
Last February the team put together a shoot concept for Eating Disorder Awareness Week, in which the models would pose in purple tops and write inspirational words on their bodies to bring awareness to the fact that eating disorders affect those of all body types and ethnicities.

That photoshoot was a catalyst to a conversation between team members, models, critics and supporters, friends and family, about representation and perception of different body types, not only in the modeling industry, but in society in general. A common comment was that after a certain size or age you stopped seeing positive representations in the media and often overweight or older subjects were cast in a negative light. This is an issue that needs to be talked about. Weight and age do not define your worth as a person, nor should your dress size determine your beauty and confidence.

As a team we decided to do the Photoshoot again, but this time as its own campaign separate from eating disorder awareness, focusing on positive body image and diversity of body types.

The Title “EveryBODY is Beautiful” was contributed by stylist Alexa Kellee, and fits our cause perfectly. Our calendar will show that every body truly is beautiful, and the diversity of our models reflects that.

Team

Founder/Producer/ Talent co-ordinator/ Model/ etc, etc, etc.

Myself! My name is Megan Babee and I am a local model and activist located in Vancouver. This cause is very close to my heart and I am so grateful for all of the support it has received thus far. I dreamt up this idea with the help of my best friend and fellow model Devan Newman, but I never imagined it would have become such a passion. This project has shown me a new side to myself. Producing the calendar and Co-ordinating the team has been both exhausting and exhilarating. Every moment spent working on this project is a moment I cherish. I hope that this calendar will inspire others the way the amazing people I have met during this process have inspired me.

Photography:
Alex Waber is a local Vancouver photographer, he has a natural talent for capturing his subjects personality in every photo. Professional but lighthearted, Alex has a way with models that made him an easy choice for this project. Since agreeing to shoot for us last February he has become an essential part of this team and of this project.

Also a big thank you to our behind the scenes photographer and interviewer Alex Larente, Alex has also modeled for both shoots and being my better half has helped keep me calm during my mini stress attacks and has had a major part in putting all of this together. He also discovered he has an innate talent for draping fabric during the shoots!

Makeup:
We have some amazing Makeup artists working with us on this project, One I would like to thank in particular is Candice Harvey, Candice volunteered at last Februarys shoot and did makeup at all three of our shoots this year. Without her we would not have been able to run things so smoothly, thank you Candice!
Our other wonderful MUA’s are Tatiana Tavares, Alicia Mizel, Candice Johnson and Elizabeth Mcleod. We were lucky to have such a talented team to help pamper our models.

The Photoshoot for the calendar took place over three days in November, the 14th, 15th and 25th. The studio environment was relaxed and upbeat, the models and makeup artists had a seating area to hang out and chat in between shooting which helped to relax the models and get them ready for their turn in front of the camera.
(Preview of Model Lindsay Braynen, Makeup By Tatiana Tavares)
A BIG thank you to all of the Models who participated, we could not have done this without all of you.

Why a Calendar and where your money is going.

This time we wanted to do a fundraiser and a Calendar is a fun way to raise money and simultaneously raise awareness. A calendar is something you display proudly in your home, and something you see basically everyday. We want to remind our supporters everyday that everyBODY is beautiful and a calendar is a perfect fit.

Where is your money going?

The money we raise will be going toward a few different things,

Printing costs. This is where this indiegogo campaign comes into play, we can’t sell the calendars without first having the funds. Your donations will go toward printing the first batch of calendars and making this project a reality.

Paying for costs and the launch event. Our team and models have dedicated their time and in some cases their money to helping make this project its best. We want to reimburse costs that have come up during production and thank our models by putting together a launch event for them to celebrate. We have local performers and a wonderful nutritionist ready to perform/speak at the event and we would like to be able to pay their costs. We also need to pay for catering and permits involved in the event.

Funding the next project! We are planning a workshop project in the spring, a few fundraising events, and our 2014 Calendar is already in the planning stage, but we need funds to make these things happen!

Giving Back. If we raise above and beyond our goal we will only keep what we can put to use. This is first and foremost a non-profit project to raise awareness and without your help we would be nowhere, so we will donate the remainder to Project True Centre for Body image and Eating disorder recovery.
(Preview of Model Hilary Matheson, Makeup by Tatiana Tavares)

how to help without donating

Unable to Donate? Help us by spreading the word and sharing our indie gogo campaign link! We need support to keep this project alive and we appreciate every form of help. Go like our facebook page and share the links we have provided for our supporters.
facebook.com/Everybodyisbeautiful.ca

Dr Wayne Pickering, Author, Naturopathic Physician and Nutrition Expert needs YOUR HELP in creating his NEW  ""Combine When You Dine""  RECIPE GUIDE

a beautiful 12"" x 16"" custom-laminated four-color (both sides) placemat and it's purpose is to show you how to prepare food! New Hope for Diabetics AND ANYONE who wants to be healthy.
<ul>
<li>
Dinner on the Double = 1-minute Recipes. Spend less time in the kitchen and more time with your family.
• 130 EASY to prepare, very DELICIOUS and NUTRITIOUS Recipes, all properly combined for finest digestion.
• This makes meal planning fun and gives you some ideas for creating your own exciting, new, delicious recipes.

All in all, we suggest for people to eat sensibly and in accordance with your body's digestive chemistry. This is the Science of Food Combining. There are 131 Recipes all properly combined for finest digestion and each has an indication for which one is for Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner.
Biography
Imagine ... being 21 years of age
column3: a third bout of rheumatic fever and expected to die before his 30th birthday.

column1: What do you suppose Wayne Pickering did?
He asked ""What does it take to beat the odds?"" The Answer: Re-negotiate your Self-Worth

He studied Nutrition, Theology and Naturopathy (the study of food and exercise to aid the body's healing processes) and did, in fact, beat the odds. He now holds a Doctorate in Naturopathy (N.D.), and a Masters Degree in Nutrition (Sc.M.)! His wide healthy smile reflects a man who has come to terms with his health!

Today, Dr. Wayne is a healthy and successful Speaker and Consultant, who enthusiastically shows his audiences how to keep the fun in the living. His presentations have entertained, inspired and energized over 50,000 people in four countries, and has been featured at over 600 conventions, conferences, dinner meetings and training seminars

From the moment he walks on the platform, the audience feels his love and gives it right back ... synergism at its finest. He's heart-warming, vibrant and the incredible energy he brings to the platform through his stories, humor and jumping rope is memorable. A healthy man who walks his talk.
He is one of only a few health speakers who doesn't take himself so seriously as to alienate his audience.
Rather than ""politely listening to just another wellness message,"" audiences enthusiastically embrace both his infectious style and valuable information.
An Amazing Man with an Awesome Story! Give him a Minute, he'll give you a Lifetime.
THE PERSON BEHIND THE PROGRAM ...
Beyond Dr. Wayne's love for his career he enjoys life to the fullest by basking in the tropical areas of Florida either on the river or way out in the ocean on his surf ski (similar to a kayak).
He relishes the day eating the finest tropical fruit that's in season and he's in heaven when mango season is in.

He keeps in the best of shape with weight training, water skiing, jumping on his trampoline and surfing. The intense stretching routine and rope jumping style he has developed keeps his audience in awe.
He asks, “Are you dying to live or living to die?”
<ul>
• When wealth is lost, something is lost.
• When honor is lost, much is lost.
• But when health is lost, all is lost!
Healthy People have lots of goals
Unhealthy people only have 1 goal!
“Break Your Date with Death”
Love your Liver and Live Disease-Free Forever
<ol>
• Reverse Heart Disease
• Enjoy the Best Protection for Lifelong Kidney Health
• Keep your Joints and Muscles Free of Pain
• Deflate your Blood Pressure without drugs.
• Slash your Cholesterol by 100 Points
<li>
Bulletproof your Prostate.
Now You Can get your health back both Naturally &

column1: Hey Dr. Wayne …

Just thought I would keep you abreast of my health and weight loss which now stands at 60 lbs and still losing.  My doctor is so pleased with my progress that he has cut my medication in half for both high blood pressure and diabetes. He said if I come back in a month's time with good results again, that he will take me off the medication altogether. What good news!!!! And all because of your system
Hazel King
Queensland, Australia
Here’s the line up of who are in the Audio Programs:
Michael Klaper, M.D.  Who is the advisor to the NASA project on nutrition for long-term space colonists on the Moon and on Mars.
Douglas Graham, D.C.
column2: who currently serves as a nutrition advisor to the magazine Exercise for Men Only.

column1: Wayne ‘The Mango Man’ Pickering, N.D., Sc.M. “The Ambassador for Health” “Nutritional Performance Coach”
Frank Sabatino, Ph.D., D.C. who has been a part of landmark research in nutrition and aging and has published numerous articles on clinical nutrition, brain chemistry, women’s hormones, and aging.
Jeff Novick, R.D., who is the Director of Nutrition at the world-renowned PritikinLongevityCenter on Miami Beach, Florida

You haven’t failed at dieting, dieting has failed you!  Sometimes the diets and fads that we get into to lose weight or for whatever health reason is really worse than the excess weight itself. Diets are something you start and finish! In Addition, Diet is a 4-letter word and when you hear these Audio Program you will have finally eliminated the mass confusion about good sound nutrition and they will be your best guarantee of living to a healthy ripe-old age Free of Diet Related Diseases!
At Last! Discover the UNVARNISHED TRUTH about what it really takes to be completely healthy being 100% Totally Free of all Aches, Pains, Stress &

New Hope for Diabetics AND ANYONE who wants to be healthy.
Dinner on the Double = 1-minute Recipes. Spend less time in the kitchen and more time with your family.
130 EASY to prepare, very DELICIOUS and NUTRITIOUS Recipes, all properly combined for finest digestion.
This makes meal planning fun and gives you some ideas for creating your own exciting, new, delicious recipes.

All in all, we suggest for people to eat sensibly and in accordance with your body's digestive chemistry. This is the Science of Food Combining. There are 131 Recipes all properly combined for finest digestion and each has an indication for which one is for Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner.

       Venue Based Social Networking, we are giving 'CheckIn' a point....
Hello from CLINK

First of all thank you for reading this and taking the time to look at CLINK, to get to this point of where the idea for CLINK had formed over a year with countless doodle pads of concepts to now have a fully operational, productive product live in the UK makes me feel free proud and excited.

I’m Scott Horn and I was running a large nightclub in Windsor (just round the corner from Windsor Castle but the Queen never popped in to visit us!) and whilst I was managing the promotions to get people to come in and overseeing what was happening in the evenings, the need for a way to allow personalised marketing to my customers was formed and wanting my customers to be able to chat together without going through the whole accept my friend request process.

So myself, Kyle Croucamp and Richard Abel self funded the version 1 release of CLINK and in June 2013 we went live in selected venues in the UK, we are here now to request your contributions to launch version 2 which is allow for us to develop a platform that can allow the whole of the UK to CLINK.

Your contribution will help us get to that goal of expanding the business to hire full time people and to allow all of us to achieve of our dream of proving to our children that anything is possible through hard work and believing in a great idea.
To Us and Back to You

Without getting technical, the money is to be used to build a proof of concept SOA platform, our current technology solution meets the needs for version 1, but we need a scalable and enterprise grade platform to enable us to reach the whole of the UK and beyond.

Even before we have launched CLINK we had a 0.08% nightclub market share just based on the idea, thanks to Kyle he has taken it from 0% in only 2 months, each new contract brings that level higher and gets us access to some amazing nightlife venues which is why we can offer some very exciting perks!
For top contributors, we know nightlife venues, we know how to put on amazing events, get to London, be in our city, trust us…..
CLINK Aid
If you cannot contribute it doesn’t mean you cannot support us! Please like our Facebook and Twitter pages and let any WiFi enabled venue you may be in that CLINK would be perfect for them!
Here is our CLINK pitch

Hello all. I am raising money to pay for the costs of my health care. I am an HIV positive 30 year old male. I contracted the virus when I was 23 years old, because someone decided to lie about their status. He had known for 16 years that he was positive. While I do still qualify for some help through the state of Washington I am going to fall very short of my copays for both medical care and prescription drugs. The reason that I am asking for help is that on August 22nd I was terminated from my employer for no reason they call it at will termination, this means that I have no means to purchase medication. If I am unable to get my medication a number of terrible things can happen: such as the virus developing a resistance to the medications I am currently on, higher risk of contracting Lymph Cancers, and of course eventually I would be diagnosed with AIDS. Truly living with HIV is not the cake walk that it has been made out to be in recent years, I can only imagine how AIDS could ravage my health, and psychological well being. So please find it in your heart to help me out. Any unused funds will be donated to Gay City Health Project so that they may continue providing free Rapid HIV Testing and counseling.

The Pitch

I'm John. I live in Northern Uganda and work at a school. My friend B (name withheld for his privacy) works at the school too. He was born with this painful skin condition. He's put up with it all his life and together we decided it was time to get rid of it. That's where you come in. Neither of us can afford to pay for the surgery and we need your help. We consulted the best doctor in the country and tried everything to avoid surgery, but it's the only option we have left. The surgery will be done by a hospital that specializes in dermatology and was reccomended to us by that doctor. This clinic provides subsidized and low cost care for people in Uganda. Check out the website here.
<div>
What We Need
The consultations, surgery, recovery, follow up visits, and transportation will cost a maximum of $500.
<div>
Accountability
I'll keep you updated on his progress once we're funded and provide recieipts to prove where the money went.
<div>
Want More Information?
E-mail me at johnwpfeil@gmail.com. If you want more specific information on my friend I'll have to get permission from him before I give it out.

Brandon is a wonderful young man who could use your help.

Hi am Brandon's Mom and am asking for some help for him in getting his medical bills paid. Brandon does have health insurance but his out of pocket expenses with be in the thousands. I am hoping by raising money it will help in his recovery and he will not feel he has to over do it now that he is allowed back to work.

Brandon is 22 yrs old and works and goes to college. He was sitting in class at the end of November when he became ill. He said he felt he was having a stroke. He got dizzy, body chills, headache, neck, chest and back pains. I live out of state and my ex husband called saying Brandon was in the hospital with a collapsed LUNG. The doctors found a hole in his lung and that he would have to have it repaired. Brandon underwent surgery to repair it 2 days later. As a parent you never want your child to be sick and in pain. The surgery was Brandon's 4th major surgery in 7 yrs. When he was 15 he had to have his rib cage repaired to fix his sunken chest as it was affecting his heart and lungs. They did this by inserting a  bar into his chest. At 16 this bar was removed. When he was 17 he was cleared to play HS football and during his first practice he shattered his right pelvis and broke the head of his femur. He had to under go a 6.5 hr surgery to repair all the damage and is now my bionic boy. He missed his first month of his senior year and spent almost 4 months in a wheel chair.  I am very proud as he has faced them all with courage and humor. They say laughter is the best medicine and he was able to laugh even through the pain of a collapsed lung. He even had me laughing to ease my worries. The morning of the surgery I asked him what he was doing as I was unable to be there. He said SINGING and I  asked how is that..he said I am singing but not as LOUD as I normally do. He put a huge smile on my face and now I would like to do the same for him and am asking for your help in doing it.

Of course his father and I will do our best to help him pay his bills but I know we will fall short. I am hoping that Brandon will not have to start his adult life off with this unexpected financial burden.

I was very blessed that he was well enough to come for an early Christmas visit. His incisions are healing well and his energy level has returned. He still gets a little winded after climbing stairs but I am sure he will be back to normal soon.
THANK YOU for reading Brandon's story. Any donation we would be  grateful for. I would like to wish everyone a Blessed New Year and that it will find you and yours happy and healthy.

Adopt-One-Village -AOV- (www.AdoptOneVillage.org),  is a 501 C non-profit organization helping  to help create sustainability in a small village called YawTenkorang, in Ghana, Africa,  that has neither running water nor electricity. A team comes from the US several times a year with donations of clothing, shoes, bikes, medical &
column2: educational supplies and other goods. On these trips are people who are in fields such as education, medicine, and construction, and some who don't have specific skills, but do whatever is needed.   My name is Mary Anne, a pediatric nurse who lives in Maplewood, NJ., and a volunteer with AOV.

column1: Along with our American volunteers, we have a few volunteers from Ghana.

One such volunteer is Frank Temeng. We met Frank, who lives in Accra,   (a 3 to 5 hour drive to the village) in 2010, when he was hired as our driver.  He has since become an integral part of our team, often giving up his own ""vacation"" time to be a volunteer.  In addition to loading and carrying our luggage, he translates for us, helped repair a roof, painted classrooms, put up new chalkboards, taught and sang with children in the village, and even did our laundry, along with various other tasks! He gives of himself because he believes in our vision, and because his heart is full of love.

Several months ago, he began having serious pain and was found to have two large hernias.  Despite this, he still came to work and serve with us in the village in July 2012. By the end of the day, he was in visible pain, but never complained and still performed much work. It is getting harder for him to keep up and it is affecting his job as a driver in the capital city.

My personal involvement with Frank started in 2010 when he acted as translator for some of the patients we saw in the clinic that AOV helped build.  He is a man of great integrity, honor, and humility, always willing to do whatever is asked of him.  I was so impressed by his sweetness and generosity, I ""adopted"" him like a son. On our recent trip, he took charge of cleaning equipment in the clinic, and managed to involve a large group of men from the village to step up to the task.  He is a natural leader who inspires others.

The impact of our medical care and donations and teacher training is evident in the inspiration of the people of the village, and the decrease in wounds as bare feet are now covered by shoes!  We have helped make a great difference in this village of Yaw Tenkorang, and Frank has been an essential part of that difference.

But health care in Ghana is not the best. With a wife and 3 children to support on a meager income, Frank does not have the money for the needed surgery. Because Frank is such a good and humble man, we want to help him get this surgery as a way of showing our gratitude for his self-less service to our organization and the village we serve.  (We also need him for our future trips, and his family needs him as their bread-winner!)

We want to bring him to the US for his surgery, where we know he will have a chance of better care.  We have volunteers who will house him during his stay, and some of the funds will sustain his family while he recuperates.
Frank has helped us so much. Can you help us help him? Every little bit will help.

My personal involvement with Frank started in 2010 when he acted as translator for some of the patients we saw in the clinic that AOV helped build.  He is a man of great integrity, honor, and humility, always willing to do whatever is asked of him.  I was so impressed by his sweetness and generosity, I ""adopted"" him like a son. On our recent trip, he took charge of cleaning equipment in the clinic, and managed to involve a large group of men from the village to step up to the task.  He is a natural leader who inspires others.

The impact of our medical care and donations and teacher training is evident in the inspiration of the people of the village, and the decrease in wounds as bare feet are now covered by shoes!  We have helped make a great difference in this village of Yaw Tenkorang, and Frank has been an essential part of that difference.

But health care in Ghana is not the best. With a wife and 3 children to support on a meager income, Frank does not have the money for the needed surgery. Because Frank is such a good and humble man, we want to help him get this surgery as a way of showing our gratitude for his self-less service to our organization and the village we serve.  (We also need him for our future trips, and his family needs him as their bread-winner!)

We want to bring him to the US for his surgery, where we know he will have a chance of better care.  We have volunteers who will house him during his stay, and some of the funds will sustain his family while he recuperates.
Frank has helped us so much. Can you help us help him? Every little bit will help.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Maplewood, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/we-need-frank-temeng-he-needs-surgery/pica

column5: >My name is Nadine Desormeau.  I am a full-time graduate student of Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine at the Southwest Acupuncture College.  I am in an accelerated program where 4 years of education have been concentrated into 3 years.  Entering my second year of exams, labs and clinics, I am super excited about my future in the healing arts.

column1: I have been a holistic wellness enthusiast for 15 years.
column5: >I am a Registered Yoga Teacher with 4 certifications including Thai Yoga Bodywork.  I founded Stretchbod Yogacare over a year ago where I offer Thai Yoga Bodywork, Yogacare and breathwork all in a one-on-one personalized session. After many years of soul-searching and dream chasing, I am finally in a place where I feel aligned.

column1: I was recently informed that my school is consolidating its New Mexico Campuses and that the Albuquerque campus that I attend will be shutting down.  In order to continue my studies, I will have to commute to Santa Fe which is one hour away. This may not sound like much, but as a mother and wife, I have a densely packed schedule.

To meet the demands of my family, academics and work, I have decided to bring Stretchbod closer to home.  I am launching this campaign to raise funds for a garden studio that I am building in my yard.

Your contribution will help me bring my work space closer to home so that I could continue to offer this amazing service to my dedicated clients. This will also be a cost saving measure as I will not have the need to rent space.  Maintaining Stretchbod will also allow me to continue to cultivate my skills and create supplemental income to help support my family while I pursue advanced education in the healing arts.

Hello Friends!

We’re here to ask you to help us, to help you, to help others by purchasing our pyjamas. So brush away the sleepy dust, stretch, have a coffee and give us 5 minutes of your time to lend us a hand in launching the start-up of our dreams.

We are a contemporary and forward-thinking personalised silk pyjama company, aimed at bringing you the height of luxury at a price that won’t give you nightmares. We want to give you a happier and more comfortable sleep, while at the same time promoting good social behaviour by giving back to those in need.

Someone very wise once said that “it does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live” (yes you muggles, it was Dumbledore). But what about those who live in fear? At Snooze we have adopted the opposite approach, namely to help people live so that they have the freedom to dream. For every PJ bought we will donate a mosquito net to a child in Kenya who is at risk of catching Malaria.  Mosquito nets are the most effective and efficient means in which malaria can be prevented, and has the potential to save thousands of lives.

column2: >Behold a few pictures of our luxurious personalised silk pyjamas. Also make sure to watch our campaign video featuring our delightful model Jenna!
/>

column1: These
traditional long sleeved pyjamas will be a 100% silk! The PJs come in pink or
grey. The sizes available are S, M, L, and XL. They're going to be the comfiest
thing that you've ever worn to bed.
If you choose a perk that includes a PJ, we will email you
asking for your size and color!
<div>

Because two of our team members grew up in Southern and Eastern Africa, Malaria is a cause very close to our hearts. They witnessed first hand the destructive consequences of such an easily preventable disease. One of the members has even had malaria twice and knows the consequences despite having access to medication instantly. According to the World Health Organisation, in 2015, there were 214 million new cases of malaria worldwide, with the African Region accounting for 88% of those. In 2015 alone there were roughly 438 000 malaria deaths worldwide. Considering that malaria bearing mosquitos usually bite between 10pm and 2am, sleeping children are especially vulnerable, and we at SNOOZE. believe that everyone should have the right to a safe sleep. This is why for every pyjama sold we pledge to donate a mosquito net to Africa’s largest urban slum (Kibera in Nairobi, Kenya), in the fight against malaria. Mosquito nets are a simple, long lasting and effective way to help protect people from this horrible disease when they’re at their most vulnerable.
The Snooze team is made up of 6 students who all live in London to study a Masters degree at Cass Business School.
The SNOOZE. team:
Cleo Wanten                          Hugo Schild                          Victor Hielte
Nomad (grew up in South Africa)              British                                       Swedish
Selin Bodur                           Amaanraj Rai                           Ella Wong
Belgian                                            Kenyan                                    Hong-Konger

Before we started this project, we all believed it was important to combine a good product with a good cause. Amaanraj grew up in Kenya and has had malaria twice, and thus seen first hand how Malaria could ruin lives. With his personal contacts in Kenya, we were able to combine something we all liked, PJs, with a cause that we all wanted to help. With your help we hope to bring good sleep to you, but also to children in Africa.
In order to make the pyjamas happen, we need your help and contribution, big or small.

We need to raise a total of £5,000 to make our pyjama, buy the mosquito nets, and to set up our company. All of our pyjamas are of high quality and made in silk, and for every pyjama sold, you will help by contributing a mosquito net to a child in the Kibera slums, Kenya.
In order to succeed with our Get Sleep, Give Sleep goal, we need the full £5,000. If we don’t reach the full amount, your money will be refunded in full.
When you buy one of our pyjamas, you’re not just getting a better sleep because of our high quality silk, but you also give better sleep to someone else.
We call this Get Sleep, Give Sleep, and it is our dream to help as many as possible to sleep better, regardless of where you live.

There are already companies that have tried the get and give concept, but, as far as we know, there are none that focus on sleep and malaria. With your contribution, we can get better sleep, give better sleep, and hopefully save some lives.

If you feel like you can’t contribute at this time, but you still want to help Snooze and the cause, you can always help us by spreading the word on Facebook, Instagram, and any other form of social media that you’re a pro at!
Check us out on:
Facebook:
www.facebook.com/SnoozeLondon

Instagram:

@Snooze_London
Thank you!

Hello deep freediving addicts!
After the huge success of our first pulley system released in 2018, today we are super happy and proud to introduce its big brother to the freediving world : The XL pulling system!

Indeed, a few of our customers and friends mentioned that when using our first pulley model with stiffer or thicker ropes (10mm and above), sometimes pulling the bottom weight up by securing the sole of the foot on the carabiner felt a little bit too much like hard work. This is why we came up with this new XL model, using double-diameter pulleys. This significantly decreases the friction due to the angle of the rope against the pulley. As for everything else, it works in exactly the same way as the original model.

column3: >As always, it remains easy to use, strong (max. load 250kg), efficient, ergonomic, and still compact even if a bit chunkier than our CLASSIC model, and at an affordable price while maintaining high-quality components and finish!

column1: It is so resistant that you can just leave it hanging under your buoy, without any real need to rinse it in fresh water after use. You can even jump on it with both feet, it will keep working over and over (with any rope from 8 to 13 mm diameter)!
Finally, it will enable you to pull the line up way more efficiently in case of an emergency.
It makes it easy to drop the line even with just one hand (or even with only two fingers!), and has no sharp edges, giving it a perfectly ergonomic shape.

Try it once and you will never go back to the old simple-carabiner way, like the +2000 freedivers who already did the switch to this date! If you haven't experienced it yet, here is a nice DEEPER BLUE article about our first model (the CLASSIC one): :
https://www.deeperblue.com/review-extra-octopus...
Be the first to pre-order at a great discounted price!!! Production will start in June and delivery is planned for July 2020. The injection mould is almost finished already.
But enough words, better let the video speak for itself!!!
A warm thank you for your support in this shaky period!
Pascal

""I am a experienced freediver (VWT -131m) and ex-competitor, but I have also been working as industrial designer for many years. This makes me aware of what freedivers need and want, but also able to design products that will meet those needs. As a good Swissman, precision and attention to detail are my priorities in the manufacturing process, to ensure a high-quality final product.""

 

 

Made of top-quality components only
• a strong structure (polyamide charged with 20% fiberglass)
• a thick 8mm anodized aluminum arm (ALU6061
• two low frictions polyamide pulleys for ropes 8 to 13mm
• marine stainless steel screws

Note

Of course, our first CLASSIC model, more compact and more affordable, will stay in our catalogue as usual, available for purchase on our webshop www.octopusfreediving.com. This crowdfunding is only for pre-orders of the new XL model (delivery in July 2020). 

If this is your first-buy of an Octopus pulley system and you are not sure which model to go for, here are some pointers to help you decide: 

The CLASSIC model is perfectly suited for ropes of 8 to 10 mm of diameter. It can also be used with 11 and 12 mm ropes but this will require a little bit more effort to pull your bottom weight back up.

If your priority is maximum efficiency and safety, or if you are planning to use ropes of 11mm or thicker, then we recommend you to go for the XL model. Of course, this model will also work perfectly well with ropes of smaller diameter: in that case it will simply make your life easier when bringing the bottom weight back up at the end of your session, or if pulling an unconscious diver back to the surface in case of emergency.
After the huge success of our first pulley system released in 2018, today we are super happy and proud to introduce its big brother to the freediving world : The XL pulling system!

Indeed, a few of our customers and friends mentioned that when using our first pulley model with stiffer or thicker ropes (10mm and above), sometimes pulling the bottom weight up by securing the sole of the foot on the carabiner felt a little bit too much like hard work. This is why we came up with this new XL model, using double-diameter pulleys. This significantly decreases the friction due to the angle of the rope against the pulley. As for everything else, it works in exactly the same way as the original model.

As always, it remains easy to use, strong (max. load 250kg), efficient, ergonomic, and still compact even if a bit chunkier than our CLASSIC model, and at an affordable price while maintaining high-quality components and finish!

It is so resistant that you can just leave it hanging under your buoy, without any real need to rinse it in fresh water after use. You can even jump on it with both feet, it will keep working over and over (with any rope from 8 to 13 mm diameter)!
Finally, it will enable you to pull the line up way more efficiently in case of an emergency.
It makes it easy to drop the line even with just one hand (or even with only two fingers!), and has no sharp edges, giving it a perfectly ergonomic shape.

A warm thank you for your support in this shaky period!

Our device offers several features, proving itself as the most versatile one on the market

Kills Up to 99.99% of Germs and Allergens in Hard To Reach Spots – UV Pro utilizes advanced UV-C light technology to eliminate viruses, odor causing bacteria, mold and allergens by 99.99% at home and on the go.  It’s compact, portable size makes it easy to use, travel with and sterilize in even the hardest to reach areas.

No Harsh Chemicals or Irritants – Stop throwing out your money on expensive cleaning products! With UV Pro, you can sanitize your shoes, bags, gloves, and more without any chemical residue, harsh liquids or odor.

Efficient and Easy to Use – UV Pro is easy to use, simply place inside the product you wish to clean, set and go. The UV Pro offers a delayed start, so you can set it and forget it! Come back, and your product will be sterile within minutes!
Lab Tested and Proven! – Tested and proven in a US independent third party laboratory, UV Pro is proven to eliminate up to 99.998% of all pathogens in 10 minutes!
column3:
/>


Combat Germs wherever you go.

Did you know that your feet and hands have more sweat glands than any other part of your body? Now think about how often you wash your shoes or gloves. What about your gym bag? While the sweat itself doesn't smell, shoes, socks, gloves, and bags can trap odor-causing bacteria and fungus, which thrive in dark, damp environments. Just like you wouldn’t wear any piece of clothing for days without washing it, your shoes, bags, gloves and other items in day-to-day contact with your hands and feet need similar care and attention.

The UV Pro Elite is guaranteed to sanitize and kill up to 99.99 % of odor causing bacteria and fungus with no harsh chemicals. Not only will your shoes and personal items be odor-free, your skin will benefit as well.


Nail Fungus – 5% of the population suffers from nail fungus. Most turn to topical ointments, drugs or expensive laser treatments to get rid of the problem. However, many people do not realize that the dark, damp environment inside shoes is a leading cause of the problem and often times cause reinfection.

Cut down on cost and chemicals, and go straight to the root of the problem. UV Pro provides a safe, eco-friendly solution to treating and preventing nail fungus. As an added benefit to diabetics and anyone with a weakened immune system is that the UV Pro eliminates bacteria that could lead to serious health complications.

The UV Pro Elite has 3 modes for every type of shoe from running to most delicate leather shoes


The UV Pro Elite has 3 modes for every type of shoe from running to most delicate leather shoes:

column1: <li>
Normal - Our Standard setting is the quickest way to achieve clean. Works in 10 Minutes
<li>
Sport - For the Athlete. Hard on your feet? The Sports setting works longer to ensure your shoes stay fresh! - Works in 20 Minutes - Not recommended for leather shoes (see Elite)
<li>

Elite - For the Fashion Forward (or Business Person). We understand you invest in your wardrobe, the Elite UV Pro works in intervals to ensure products doesn't overheat and no damage is done. Use for delicate leathers and fabrics. - Works 3 minutes on, 3 minutes off, complete cycle = 12 minutes.

column2:
/>

The UV Pro's Features Makes it Very Versatile.

column1: <li>

Versatile

UV Pro can be used to sanitize an entire array of products. Unlike others, the UV Pro is designed for multipurpose use. Whether you’re sanitizing a bag, gloves or shoes, the UV Pro will get the job done!
<li>
Wireless

UV Pro is the wireless solution to sanitizing your shoes. No need to clutter your house, and leave items lying near an outlet. Simply take your item, slip in the sanitizer and store wherever you see fit.
<li>
Rechargeable

Don’t throw your money away on buying batteries. With UV Pro place the devices on the doc and recharge in 40 minutes. You can connect the doc through a standard outlet or using a USB. UV Pro is both eco-friendly and budget conscious!
<li>
One Size Fits All
No need to buy multiple models or sizes to suit your family. Whether you’re sanitizing shoes, gloves or a bag, UV Pro Elite fits in the hardest to reach spots and effectively sanitizes.
<li>
Compact for Easy Travel

You don’t stay in one place, so why should your UV Pro. Whether you’re in the office, at the gym, or away on business, drop your UV Pro in your bag and sanitize while on the go. The device is lightweight, compact and travel-friendly.
<li>
Sleek Design

The UV Pro consists of a sheet metal frame and plastic housing. The plastic housing aligns upward to provide better ergonomy while the metal frame gives a glossy surface used to reflect the UV rays, drastically reducing the amount of shadow casting as compared to its’ competitors.
<li>
Safety Proof

UV Pro is designed with safety in mind. A touch sensor prevents the device from turning on while in your hand. The device also offers a delayed start mode so you can drop it in, set it and forget it! Come back to clean items in under minutes!
We include a UV bulb rated to last 10,000 hours. This device will keep your shoes clean for years to come.
The UV Pro is Safe and Lab Tested.

UV Pro is designed with safety in mind. A touch sensor prevents the device from turning on while in your hand. The device also offers a delayed start mode so you can set it, drop it in, and forget it! Come back to clean items in just 10-20 minutes.
Tested and proven in a US independent third party laboratory, UV Pro is proven to eliminate up to 99.998% of all pathogens in 10 minutes.

How We Got Here

","Our device offers several features, proving itself as the most versatile one on the marketKills Up to 99.99% of Germs and Allergens in Hard To Reach Spots – UV Pro utilizes advanced UV-C light technology to eliminate viruses, odor causing bacteria, mold and allergens by 99.99% at home and on the go.  It’s compact, portable size makes it easy to use, travel with and sterilize in even the hardest to reach areas.

No Harsh Chemicals or Irritants – Stop throwing out your money on expensive cleaning products! With UV Pro, you can sanitize your shoes, bags, gloves, and more without any chemical residue, harsh liquids or odor.

Efficient and Easy to Use – UV Pro is easy to use, simply place inside the product you wish to clean, set and go. The UV Pro offers a delayed start, so you can set it and forget it! Come back, and your product will be sterile within minutes!

Lab Tested and Proven! – Tested and proven in a US independent third party laboratory, UV Pro is proven to eliminate up to 99.998% of all pathogens in 10 minutes!Combat Germs wherever you go.Did you know that your feet and hands have more sweat glands than any other part of your body? Now think about how often you wash your shoes or gloves. What about your gym bag? While the sweat itself doesn't smell, shoes, socks, gloves, and bags can trap odor-causing bacteria and fungus, which thrive in dark, damp environments. Just like you wouldn’t wear any piece of clothing for days without washing it, your shoes, bags, gloves and other items in day-to-day contact with your hands and feet need similar care and attention.The UV Pro Elite is guaranteed to sanitize and kill up to 99.99 % of odor causing bacteria and fungus with no harsh chemicals. Not only will your shoes and personal items be odor-free, your skin will benefit as well.Nail Fungus – 5% of the population suffers from nail fungus. Most turn to topical ointments, drugs or expensive laser treatments to get rid of the problem. However, many people do not realize that the dark, damp environment inside shoes is a leading cause of the problem and often times cause reinfection.Cut down on cost and chemicals, and go straight to the root of the problem. UV Pro provides a safe, eco-friendly solution to treating and preventing nail fungus. As an added benefit to diabetics and anyone with a weakened immune system is that the UV Pro eliminates bacteria that could lead to serious health complications.The UV Pro Elite has 3 modes for every type of shoe from running to most delicate leather shoesThe UV Pro Elite has 3 modes for every type of shoe from running to most delicate leather shoes:
Normal - Our Standard setting is the quickest way to achieve clean. Works in 10 Minutes
Sport - For the Athlete. Hard on your feet? The Sports setting works longer to ensure your shoes stay fresh! - Works in 20 Minutes - Not recommended for leather shoes (see Elite)

Elite - For the Fashion Forward (or Business Person). We understand you invest in your wardrobe, the Elite UV Pro works in intervals to ensure products doesn't overheat and no damage is done. Use for delicate leathers and fabrics. - Works 3 minutes on, 3 minutes off, complete cycle = 12 minutes.
The UV Pro's Features Makes it Very Versatile.

VersatileUV Pro can be used to sanitize an entire array of products. Unlike others, the UV Pro is designed for multipurpose use. Whether you’re sanitizing a bag, gloves or shoes, the UV Pro will get the job done!
Wireless

UV Pro is the wireless solution to sanitizing your shoes. No need to clutter your house, and leave items lying near an outlet. Simply take your item, slip in the sanitizer and store wherever you see fit.
Rechargeable

Don’t throw your money away on buying batteries. With UV Pro place the devices on the doc and recharge in 40 minutes. You can connect the doc through a standard outlet or using a USB. UV Pro is both eco-friendly and budget conscious!
One Size Fits All
No need to buy multiple models or sizes to suit your family. Whether you’re sanitizing shoes, gloves or a bag, UV Pro Elite fits in the hardest to reach spots and effectively sanitizes.
Compact for Easy Travel

You don’t stay in one place, so why should your UV Pro. Whether you’re in the office, at the gym, or away on business, drop your UV Pro in your bag and sanitize while on the go. The device is lightweight, compact and travel-friendly.
Sleek Design

The UV Pro consists of a sheet metal frame and plastic housing. The plastic housing aligns upward to provide better ergonomy while the metal frame gives a glossy surface used to reflect the UV rays, drastically reducing the amount of shadow casting as compared to its’ competitors.

<h2 style=""text-align: center

Nova Nation is a basement company that we started 18 months ago.

I have always enjoyed running and hiking, but always found it difficult to carry extra pair of shoes to be able to hike and at the same time run into the water. Therefore, I started to look for alternative shoes that would allow me to use one pair of shoes but in different terrains.
This is where the story of Nova Nation started!

I began to try different fabrics and rubber soles for my idea, ""the ultimate all terrain shoe""

My passion is running and I wanted to make a robust rubber sole without adding to much weight on the shoe. I spent a lot of time on the treadmill, trying jogging in different type of rubber sole shoes in order to find ""the ultimate all terrain shoe"".

Once the type of rubber was identified, I started testing the rubber in water as this is extremely crucial for us. The key was to make sure no water was left in the shoe after you leave the water, hence we chose to use a mesh material and keep the holes into the entire shoe.
Nova is fully waterproof and you can easily go from running on track and later to dirt then go for a swim in the ocean, using only one pair of shoes.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

The magnetic shoelaces are one of the best functionalities of Nova, and the idea is to keep the same perfect fit and strength and not having the regular shoes laces which many times loosens up during a jog which can be disturbing the actual work out.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
The magnetic shoelaces are fully waterproofed so you can run, walk or swim with your Nova shoes in the water.

With Nova, you can skip wearing socks while you train, because we wanted to create a barefoot type of shoe. The mesh material makes this possible and it will eliminate the odor while jogging/swimming sockless.
Nova is odorless and your feet will not sweet like with normal running shoes!
There will be no limitations with your NOVA NATION shoe
column2: we wanted to create a pair of shoes that can go from running to jumping, hiking and swimming and at the same time keep a perfect fit for your feet.

column1:
We made a super light all terrain shoe that weight's around 3.5 once /  100 grams.

The weight depends on your shoe size, we also made four different colors to fit your style.
The materials are not only very light they are also super flexible
column2: this is to give the bare foot feeling.

column1: We also added extra soft rubber at the front and the back in order to get the extra grip while you are running. Every detail is important to make the ultimate terrain shoe and we covered every little detail of the shoes for Nova to be up there with the top terrain shoe brands.

If you are like many other runners that don’t like socks while you are running, then we can gladly say that you don't need to worry about that anymore with Nov as it is 100% odorless and allows your feet to breathe while you are working out.
Easy storage comes handy with the magnetic shoe laces, hang them until next time.

The idea wasn't just to make an all terrain shoe, we also wanted to keep the retail cost low, and we can make that happen with your help as we want Nova Nation be a shoe that everyone can afford and not a high end shoes. This is a shoe made from a simple idea from our home 18 months ago and today we are asking your help to make this to a reality for you and us.
Just two different Nova's hanging without any reason at all.

Saltwater? Not a problem! Simply go from running on the beach to the water and get back to the beach again, you can rinse your Nova's after a day at the beach to get the salt off your shoes for your own comfort.
This has been an amazing journey for us, and we want to continue this journey with you. We have more ideas in pipeline in which our backers will be the first ones to know.

We are constantly working to find ways to create a life style and community for our customers. One great new tool which is under construction is an application in which every Nova user can sign on and share different hiking, jogging, and swimming locations, so that other users can easily find places to be active on. This to promote active life style and make our follower’s lives easy!
Everyone will be able to share their experience with each other and add new tracks for running, hiking swimming etc
When we told you at the beginning of the campaign that this was a basement company, well it started in Janet's basement.

That was 18 months ago, today we are still part time in Janet's basement and part time testing our Nova shoes. Hence we are still working on adjusting the shoe to perfection! The idea of Nova Nation came from Janet and her love for running and hiking, today she only uses a pair of Nova's for her run no matter what the surface is.

The passion for running and design has lead us to become the creators of potentially the world’s “Ultimate Terrain Shoes”, and with your help we will deliver the best all terrain shoes on the market. We will not stop there as we want to build a community around Nova Nation and we want you to be part of it from day one!
Sharing is caring, if you like NOVA like we do please share our campaign with your friends and family.
If you have any questions to us please ask us on the comments or send us a private email if you want to know more about Nova Nation.
Send your question to: info@nova-nation.net

Thank you for reading and watching our campaign, we can't wait to deliver your Nova Nation shoes, let's keep moving forward.

Every family's journey through pregnancy, birth, and parenting is unique, with different joys and challenges. We need to raise money to get a groundbreaking new program started for families in Minnesota. No mom, dad, partner, or baby, should have to struggle alone. No matter what happens: miscarriage, infant loss, infertility, perinatal mood disorders, a difficult birth, or breastfeeding challenges, The BabyLove Alliance, Ltd. will be there to educate, support, and encourage families every step of the way.

Who are we? 

The BabyLove Alliance is registered in the State of Minnesota as a non-profit that provides a comprehensive, seamless program supporting early pregnancy through postpartum care. Our mission is to improve the maternity care outcomes for families in the Twin Cities, to increase breastfeeding rates, reduce birth complications including premature birth rates, and to improve mental health outcomes for moms, partners, and babies. The BabyLove Alliance will address systemic shortcomings in maternity care by creating a biophysical program to partner with maternity care providers that both addresses the individual needs of each mother/baby, and create a community of support and education.
Details of the program?

In the first trimester, the goal is to identify potential risk factors for the mother and baby through a comprehensive intake process. The mother will be connected with emotional well-being assessments as needed, nutrition educators, and an early pregnancy education course. In the case of an early loss, the mother will be connected to mental health resources. In the second trimester, the mother will be required to check in with the social worker at 20 weeks where mental health consultations can be continued if the mother wishes. Also, at this stage the mother may enroll in prenatal yoga, will begin childbirth classes, and will be matched with a birth doula. The third trimester requires a check in with our perinatal social worker to get a baseline screening, a mental health consultant (as needed), an in-home meeting with the birth doula, a 30 minute prenatal lactation assessment, and will complete the comprehensive childbirth class program. Chiropractic and Acupuncture referrals will be given based on the position of the baby and postdates. Lastly, during labor, the doula will provide support throughout the entire birth. The birth doula will then check in with the mother at the following postpartum stages: three to five days, 2 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months post birth.

Through this seamless program of wrap around services, The BabyLove Alliance strives to offer families in the Twin Cities a way to increase maternity care outcomes while breaking down obstacles families face to receive optimum care

Why do we need this?

Many Twin Cities hospitals and clinics lack adequate access to staff to provide postpartum mental health therapy, lactation consultants, integrative medicine, midwifery, and birth doula support, all of which have been proven to improve maternity care outcomes. At BabyLove Alliance, we provide mothers with these services through a seamless program starting at early pregnancy through postpartum stages, all in one place.We understand that mothers face huge barriers in getting specific care and support during the childbearing years, and we strive to narrow this gap.

What will my funding go towards?

The funds received will help us pay for legal fees and filing fees related to getting a 501(c)(3) status, program design and implementation, printed materials, and for other start-up costs, such as postage and advertising. Once these initial costs are covered, funds will go towards supporting program components that may not be completely covered by insurance.

Will my donation be tax-deductible?

Because we do not have 501(c)(3) status, any donations are not tax deductible at this time. However, once we get approval from the IRS, we will be able to issue receipts for donations made.

My family and I are very fortunate to know and be associated with Mr. Rockson. Currently in his mid-50s, he started giving me tennis lessons in Hong Kong from the year 2010. We happened to get in touch with him through a variety of events coming together, and ever since, he has been very close to our family. At the moment, he is training my younger brother, who is 8 years old, and looks to have no end in sight.

However, we just got to know that he has been afflicted with stomach cancer (4th stage). Living in Hong Kong with two children, a wife, and parents is financially constraining for most people, and on top of that, to combat cancer really affects the entire family unit--not just financially, but also emotionally! 

Being his student, I have learnt much more than just tennis, and therefore, I have decided to start this fundraiser to help reduce the burden on Mr. Rockson and his family. The total cost of surgery and post-surgery care exceeds $35,000. Our goal is to raise as much as we can, and therefore, help keep the baton of tennis running strong in Hong Kong. 

Any amount towards the goal is much appreciated, and please do not hesitate to contact me for any further information. 

Let's get Mr. Rockson back on the tennis court. :)

<h2 style=""text-align: center
How often do you find
spoiled food in your fridge and pantry?   times.up
is a smartphone application that provides an automated inventory of food
purchases, notifies the user about upcoming expiration dates, and suggests
recipes for otherwise wasted food.
Existing software and apps allow users to
organize their food purchases and reduce food waste, but require them to
manually input data.<span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column4: >  With times.up, customers no longer need to scan or

column1: manually enter purchases one-by-one.
Food inventories will reach consumers in 3 ways:
1. Loyalty cards &
column2: memberships. In this case, the food inventories will be sent directly from the retailer to the user’s phone or e-mail.

column1: 2. Scanning QR codes printed on sales receipts (the customer does not need to have an online account or a loyalty card).

3. Taking a picture of the whole receipt. In this case the food purchase list will be recognized by OCR (Optical Character Recognition).

The expiration dates relayed to users will
be calculated based on the purchase date or on retailer estimates.
What do we have for now?
We currently have a prototype that provides an
inventory of purchased items and an estimated expiration date for each of them.
At the moment, the only functional automated input method is QR code scanning (codes
could be printed on sales receipts). Users can also use the app to ask for
recipe ideas that include items currently in his/her inventory.
What are we going to do with these funds?

In the following months we plan to develop a Public database of expiration dates and add crucial features to the app, such as notifications and new data input methods (loyalty cards and OCR). The campaign funds will be used to pay for programming costs involved in the development
of these features.
Perks...
First of all: hugs!
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >For 15$ or more we will send you Fancy times.up stickers.

column1: <div>

column1: <div>

For 100$ or more you will have the opportunity to be among the first to obtain and test our app. We will also send you a fancy t-shirt and a fancy shopping bag!
For more information, visit our website: www.wastemore.org/times-up/
Help us spread the word and make some noise about our campaign!

times.up

Quantas vezes você já encontrou comida estragada em sua geladeira ou em seu armário? times.up é um aplicativo de smartphone que fornece um inventário automatizado dos alimentos comprados, notifica o usuário sobre as próximas datas de validade, e sugere receitas para produtos que seriam desperdiçados.

Alguns programas e aplicativos existentes permitem que os usuários organizem suas compras de alimentos e reduzam o desperdício, mas os usuários têm que inserir as informações manualmente. Com times.up, os consumidores não precisam mais scanear ou inserir os produtos um por um.
Os inventários de alimentos comprados chegarão aos consumidores em 3 formas:
1. Cartões de fidelidade em alguma rede de supermercados. Neste caso, os inventários de alimentos comprados serão enviados diretamente do varejista para o e-mail ou telefone do usuário.
2. Scaneando códigos QR impressos em recibos de compra (o cliente não precisa ter uma conta on-line ou um cartão de fidelidade).
3. Tirar uma fotografia do recibo por inteiro. Neste caso, a lista de alimentos comprados será reconhecida por OCR (Optical Character Recognition).
As datas de vencimento retransmitidas para os usuários serão calculadas com base na data da compra ou em estimativas do supermercado.
O que temos até agora?

Atualmente, temos um protótipo de aplicativo que fornece um inventário de itens comprados e uma data de expiração estimada para cada um deles. No momento, o único método de entrada funcional é por código QR (os códigos serão impressos nos recibos de compra). O usuário também podem usar o aplicativo para pedir ideias de receitas que incluem itens atualmente em seu inventário.
O que vamos fazer com o dinheiro arrecadado?

Nos próximos meses, pretendemos desenvolver uma base de dados pública de datas de validade e adicionar recursos cruciais para o aplicativo, como notificações (alertas), doação a outros usuários e novos métodos de entrada de dados (cartões de fidelidade e OCR). Os fundos da campanha serão utilizados para pagar os custos de programação envolvidos no desenvolvimento desses recursos.
<div style=""text-align: center
Antes de tudo: abraços!

","Desça a página para ler a descrição em Português.Descendez en bas de page pour lire la description en Français.
times.up
How often do you find
spoiled food in your fridge and pantry?   times.up
is a smartphone application that provides an automated inventory of food
purchases, notifies the user about upcoming expiration dates, and suggests
recipes for otherwise wasted food.
Existing software and apps allow users to
organize their food purchases and reduce food waste, but require them to
manually input data.  With times.up, customers no longer need to scan or
manually enter purchases one-by-one.
Food inventories will reach consumers in 3 ways:
1. Loyalty cards & memberships. In this case, the food inventories will be sent directly from the retailer to the user’s phone or e-mail.
2. Scanning QR codes printed on sales receipts (the customer does not need to have an online account or a loyalty card).
3. Taking a picture of the whole receipt. In this case the food purchase list will be recognized by OCR (Optical Character Recognition).The expiration dates relayed to users will
be calculated based on the purchase date or on retailer estimates.
What do we have for now?
We currently have a prototype that provides an
inventory of purchased items and an estimated expiration date for each of them.
At the moment, the only functional automated input method is QR code scanning (codes
could be printed on sales receipts). Users can also use the app to ask for
recipe ideas that include items currently in his/her inventory.
What are we going to do with these funds?

In the following months we plan to develop a Public database of expiration dates and add crucial features to the app, such as notifications and new data input methods (loyalty cards and OCR). The campaign funds will be used to pay for programming costs involved in the development
of these features.
Perks...
First of all: hugs!
For 15$ or more we will send you Fancy times.up stickers.
If you contribute with 30$ or more, we will send you a Fancy t-shirt or a Fancy shopping bag.
For 100$ or more you will have the opportunity to be among the first to obtain and test our app. We will also send you a fancy t-shirt and a fancy shopping bag!
For more information, visit our website: www.wastemore.org/times-up/
Help us spread the word and make some noise about our campaign!
---- PORTUGUÊS----
times.up

Quantas vezes você já encontrou comida estragada em sua geladeira ou em seu armário? times.up é um aplicativo de smartphone que fornece um inventário automatizado dos alimentos comprados, notifica o usuário sobre as próximas datas de validade, e sugere receitas para produtos que seriam desperdiçados.

Alguns programas e aplicativos existentes permitem que os usuários organizem suas compras de alimentos e reduzam o desperdício, mas os usuários têm que inserir as informações manualmente. Com times.up, os consumidores não precisam mais scanear ou inserir os produtos um por um.
Os inventários de alimentos comprados chegarão aos consumidores em 3 formas:
1. Cartões de fidelidade em alguma rede de supermercados. Neste caso, os inventários de alimentos comprados serão enviados diretamente do varejista para o e-mail ou telefone do usuário.
2. Scaneando códigos QR impressos em recibos de compra (o cliente não precisa ter uma conta on-line ou um cartão de fidelidade).
3. Tirar uma fotografia do recibo por inteiro. Neste caso, a lista de alimentos comprados será reconhecida por OCR (Optical Character Recognition).
As datas de vencimento retransmitidas para os usuários serão calculadas com base na data da compra ou em estimativas do supermercado.
O que temos até agora?

Atualmente, temos um protótipo de aplicativo que fornece um inventário de itens comprados e uma data de expiração estimada para cada um deles. No momento, o único método de entrada funcional é por código QR (os códigos serão impressos nos recibos de compra). O usuário também podem usar o aplicativo para pedir ideias de receitas que incluem itens atualmente em seu inventário.
O que vamos fazer com o dinheiro arrecadado?

Nos próximos meses, pretendemos desenvolver uma base de dados pública de datas de validade e adicionar recursos cruciais para o aplicativo, como notificações (alertas), doação a outros usuários e novos métodos de entrada de dados (cartões de fidelidade e OCR). Os fundos da campanha serão utilizados para pagar os custos de programação envolvidos no desenvolvimento desses recursos.
Recompensas...
Antes de tudo: abraços!
Por 15 $ ou mais  nós lhe enviaremos adesivos times.up exclusivos.
Se você contribuir com 30 $ ou mais, nós lhe enviaremos uma camiseta muito chique ou uma bolsa de compras exclusiva!
Por 100 $ ou mais, você terá a oportunidade de estar entre os primeiros a obter e testar nosso aplicativo. Nós lhe enviaremos também uma camiseta bem chique e uma bolsa pra fazer compras exclusiva!
Para mais informações, visite nosso website: www.wastemore.org/times-up/
Ajuda-nos a divulgar nossa campanha!

times.up

Combien de fois avez-vous trouvé de la nourriture périmée dans votre réfrigérateur ou votre armoire? times.up est une application de smartphone qui fournit un inventaire automatisé des achats alimentaires, avertit l'utilisateur sur les dates de péremption à venir, et suggère des recettes pour la nourriture qui serait autrement gaspillée.

Des logiciels et applications existants permettent aux utilisateurs d'organiser leurs achats d'aliments et de réduire le gaspillage alimentaire, mais les utilisateurs doivent saisir les données manuellement. Avec times.up, les consommateurs n'ont plus besoin de scanner ou saisir les achats un par un.
Les listes d'aliments achetés seront transmises aux consommateurs de 3 façons:
1. Cartes de fidélité et abonnements. Dans ce cas, les listes des produits achetés seront envoyés directement depuis le supermarché vers le téléphone ou l'adresse mail de l'utilisateur.
2. Scanner des codes QR imprimés sur les reçus d'achat (le consommateur n'a pas besoin d'avoir un compte en ligne ou d'une carte de fidélité).
3. Prendre une photo du ticket d'achat dans son ensemble. Dans ce cas, la liste des produits achetés sera reconnue par OCR (Optical Character Recognition).
Les dates de péremption relayés aux utilisateurs seront calculées sur la base de la date d'achat ou sur des estimations du supermarché.
Qu'avons-nous pour l'instant?

Nous avons actuellement un prototype qui fournit un inventaire des articles achetés et une date de péremption estimée pour chacun d'eux. À l'heure actuelle, la seule méthode de saisie automatisée fonctionnelle est la lecture des codes QR (les codes seront imprimés sur les tickets d'achat). Les utilisateurs peuvent également utiliser l'application pour demander des idées de recettes avec des produits actuellement dans leur inventaire.
Qu'allons-nous faire avec cet argent?

Dans les mois prochains, nous prévoyons de développer une base de données publique de dates de péremption et ajouter des fonctionnalités essentielles à l'application, telles que les notifications (alertes), le don d'aliments à d'autres utilisateurs et des nouvelles méthodes d'entrée de données (cartes de fidélité et OCR). Les fonds de la campagne seront utilisés pour payer les coûts de programmation impliqués dans le développement de ces fonctions.
Contreparties...
Tout d'abord: Câlins!
Pour 15 $ ou plus, nous vous enverrons des autocollants times.up très chics.
Si vous contribuez avec 30 $ ou plus, nous vous enverrons un t-shirt très très chic ou sac très stylé pour faire vos courses!
Pour 100 $ ou plus, vous aurez l'opportunité d'être parmi les premiers à obtenir et tester notre appli. Nous vous enverrons aussi un t-shirt et un sac à courses très stylés.
Pour plus d'informations, visitez notre site Web:  www.wastemore.org/times-up/
